story:
The Project

On 11 March 2011, an earthquake with the magnitude of 9 struck the North-Eastern part of Japan. It was neither the first in recent years nor the strongest in history, yet the devastating consequences this time were beyond anyone’s imagination. Not only did a tsunami of unprecedented strength literally wash away many villages, defying all measures of protection that had been taken and robbing countless lifes, the collapse of nuclear reactors in the Fukushima power plant and the subsequent radiation left the nation aghast before an invisible and unscalable threat.

When coming back to Japan after a hiatus of a year in 2012, I noticed a change in behaviour, in attitude that had taken place: Gone was the optimism that had always kept the country on course, even in the face of natural disasters that frequently strike the archipelago. Fear and uncertainty had spread, putting the nation in a sort of zombie mode where everyone kept on with his daily life without knowing what tomorrow would bring. Using a modified digital camera that captures infrared pictures, I sought to translate this particular mood into a photographic series, called “Tokyo Radiant”.

The Book and Your Contribution

My plan is to publish a photo book of this series, with around 84 pages and 100 pictures, on 200g fine art paper and bound in hardcover. Layout for this book is almost finished, and completion and shipping is scheduled for early October 2016.

The $ 4,000 USD I am asking for will cover production of the book, especially the printing part. In order to shoulder this, I am looking for your contribution. Help me realize this project, be part of it and receive either the book or one of my other perks. As a piece of art, this series belongs to everyone who supports it!

Why this Matters

Let's be honest: As a piece of art, this project's whole justification lies in what it means to me, the photographer, and you, the audience. Despite its serious topic, it is no political piece and not meant to be accusatory in any way. Tokyo Radiant is an individual visualization of a world whose sense of security and certainty were shattered from one day to the other. If you like it, I am more than happy to receive your support!

If you feel with the victims and want to do good, please have a look at the many NGOs that are specializing in this. I purposely do not wish to link this to the support of my book, because I feel it to be a bad compromise. Any help for the victims, many of whom still are living in temporary homes, probably matters much more than this book, but if you like the pictures and the idea behind it, you should support it, and exactly for this reason. By the way, you can find links to selected NGOs on my project website, www.tokyo-radiant.com

If you like the project, but do choose not to support it financially, please consider spreading the word and sharing the information with people you know. Many thanks in advance!

About myself

I am a photographer whose work is focused on urbanity, man-made objects and strange encounters. So far, I have published two photo books with renowned German publishing houses. Having lived in Japan for a couple of years and still going there frequently, I feel deeply attached to the topic of this work.

Books:

- Tokio im Licht der Nacht. Berlin: Parthas, 2008.

- Frankfurter Nächte. Frankfurt: Societäts Verlag, 2013.

Website:

www.philipp-zechner.com

 

Spread the word!

If you like this project, please spread the word by sharing the information on your social media account, via your blog, etc. Please also visit my website www.tokyo-radiant.com for more pictures and more detailed information. Many thanks in advance for your support!

story:
My name is Adam Freundlich. I'm a young Romanian photographer, shooting landscapes, cars and people.

I want to create a small photoprinting lab in order to sell my work. 

Need your help for buying a professional printer and accesories. 

Thank you for your help!

story:
The Underwater Beauty Project

My name is Anna Shvab, I'm a biologist and underwater photographer. Since last year I have gone diving and photographed in the Red Sea in Israel and Jordan. In one year I have done more than one hundred photography dives. I have collected many interesting beautiful photos of incredible underwater creatures and shared it through the social media. People get inspired by my photos, they started asking questions, became interested in marine life, few of my friends even joined the open water dive courses. It helped me realize the meaning and the power of my photography - I can introduce this fascinating poorly explored world to the society. 

"Fish eye" Broomtail wrasse  (http://yourshot.nationalgeographic.com/daily-do...)

What do we know about the ocean, about this stunning huge world, covers approximately 72% of the planet's surface, filled with a huge variety of life.  About one million species live in the ocean, two-thirds of this species remain unknown to scientists, and to the average person it is a complete mystery.

The importance of this project is to familiarize people with underwater world, to explore it together, to understand it better and to become a part of it. When we are aware of its existence, we can no longer remain indifferent to its value and to its ecological problems.

This is the message of The Underwater Beauty - explore the world, enjoy its beauty and save it for you and for the next generations!

Common lionfish  

This is our contribution to our home - planet Earth. Together we can make this world a better place for us and for the rest of its inhabitants.

     Spiny Seahorse                                                    Bubble Coral Shrimp 

Why Pacific Ocean

Pacific ocean is one of the most interesting areas of underwater world and it is also one of the most productive places for underwater photography. The diversity and amount of marine life in Pacific are incredible. In relatively short time I can explore there more species than in any other place. Also expenses of my journey will be significantly lower than elsewhere, and it will give me an opportunity to visit more dive spots and to accomplish more photography dives to improve and diversify my collection of underwater photographs for the book.  

Swimming anemone 

Juvenile Crown toby                                          "Moray family"

Cost of "The Underwater Beauty" project

To accomplish "The Underwater Beauty" project I will need to cover the expenses. 

To reach a diving destinations I will need a lot of transportation, I will try to visit as much different interesting dive spots as possible  to improve the diversity of my photos. 

Diving is  not cheap, especially when you need to dive a lot... I have my own diving equipment and I don't need to rent, it will reduce the diving expenses. But underwater photography has its challenges - the sea is unpredictable and your time underwater is limited. You have only one hour or less to get the opportunity for a gear shot and try to get a photo that you want. You need to be lucky and patient. At some dive spots you can plan your dives with a specific animals, but sometimes you need more than one dive to the same place to get a good shot. To increase the chances I will need to dive a lot. 

 Durban dancing shrimp                                                                 Squat anemone shrimp

Bigfin reef squid 


To diversify my photographs collection and to get a fantastic photos  of an amazing big underwater animals like sharks, manta rays, turtles and many more,  I will need to update my photo gear with a wide angle lens and specific underwater port for it, which attached to the underwater housing.

The additional expenses for the journey will be accommodation and food, and also insurances. I will need diving and traveling insurances. In addition I will carry with me expensive photo and diving gear, which also need to be insured. 

The biggest part of the project budget will be the book and perks. Cause I would love to thank all contributors with a generous rewards for their indispensable support and share the incredible moments of "The Underwater Beauty" journey.

     Fire hypselodorid                                                 Starry moray eel 

Sun coral

Estimated cost for the project is 18000$ (including fees of indiegogo). This budjet will be enough to commit two month of underwater journey - the minimum that I need for realization of the project.  

Your support is very important for "The Underwater Beauty" project! Only with your support I will able to make the project successful and interesting, I will have more opportunities  for underwater photography. With a bigger budget I will have more time and more opportunities which is so important in underwater photography. I will visit more places will do more dives and will get more diverse and beautiful images. 

"Eye contact" Red Sea Moses sole (http://yourshot.nationalgeographic.com/daily-do…/2015-06-25/)

Risks & Challenges

  • Photography opportunities - sea can be very unpredictable for the good and for the bad. Sometimes you can plan your dives and go to the specific spots, and sometimes you just need to be lucky to see interesting subjects for photography. Hopefully I will be extremely lucky, if not I will need to dive more...
  • Water conditions - currents, visibility may create a difficulties for diving and underwater photography. I will try to deal with it, if it's possible, or I will have to wait for the better conditions.
  • Diving accidents - I'm experienced, well trained, familiar with water diver, I will dive with checked and secure diving equipment, accompanied by a guide. There is no many situation that can disturb me underwater, but most important - I'm always careful and responsible.

Bubble Coral Shrimp 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any kind of contribution will be very helpful for the "The Underwater Beauty" project. You can share it to involve more people to build something significant and important for us and for our planet. 

Thank you!

story:
What is the project ?

Usually, each photographer of our team gets a few emails/requests per year from women of different occupations who’ve always dreamed of being a fashion, lingerie or body art model but never tried. We decided to invite some of the ladies for a photo-shoot session. And we got amazing results! Photos we take are fantastic! Sometimes, non-professional models are so wild and beautiful in front of a camera and it's really unexpected.

Based on this experience the idea of the “Cameleon” project was born. We want to publish a photo book with photos of non-professional models who are in different kinds of careers. We have already received over 50 requests from ladies to be photographed who are in different occupations including:

  • psychologist
  • lawyer
  • aircraft pilot
  • architect
  • yoga teacher
  • nurse
  • taxi driver etc.

Our goal is to show that people are beautiful regardless of occupation or age, it is important when the beauty is authentic and natural.

And anyone could be a model for this project !


What do I receive ?

There are some great rewards to choose from including:

  • digital copy of the E-Book
  • original and signed limited edition Postcard
  • a signed copy of limited edition Photo book
  • participation in the project as a model
  • participation in the project as a photographer
  • acknowledgment in the book and project's website



Budget

Your contributions will help in:

  Printing photo book
  Postage costs
  Studio rental
  Photo-shoot expenses
  Post-production
  Campaign costs

To make the project properly we will need at least 7,000 USD. The expenses are explained below:


About The Photographers

We are an international photographer’s group founded in 2010 by fashion, fine-art, wedding and 3D photographers from Eastern and Central Europe. Each of us has achieved success in their photographic career through exhibitions, grants and publications. Alex Holz (Saratov) is one of the best 3D photographers in the world.  Carl Miller (Prague), Robert Lindholm (Berlin), Dmitry Babushka (Saratov) are famous fashion, wedding and fine-art photographers. We also have a make-up and body art artist in our team. 

Also, you could participate in the project as a photographer with your model !

How can I get involved ?

If you can, please donate some funds and get awesome rewards!

You could participate in the project as a model !

( select "You are the model" perk and send me your photo )

And you could participate in the project as a photographer with your model !

( select "You are the model" perk and send me a photo )

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.

The Indiegogo share tools can help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
We parked the car in the forest, next to a 2-day dancing event we were attending, so I left my stuff hidden under a bag of fresh laundry in the trunk for a short amount of time, until we would've set up our spot and figured a good place to store the equipment.

Apparently a bit too long.

 

A passenger came in and asked for the owner of a black BMW standing outside.

I kind of knew at that point.

Just a week before I had been putting a lot of thinking into a goal I’ve been after since a long time.

To travel the world again, going from country to country, making my living through photography and video jobs, eventually growing something like a travel blog, to share my adventures with the world.

Destinations were picked, starting with Cape Town.

This challenge was supposed to be starting in October.

It felt like all of that was laying in broken glass fragments in the dirt in front of my feet, when I arrived at the car... to express my feelings in a bit of a dramatic way.

How to create when your tools are gone?

 

Of course, until this day, the police hasn’t turned up any clues and the insurance has done what they do best, found a loophole that keeps them from paying.

I’ve been waiting a couple of months now to get the insurance to cover or instead find another way, but none of that has been working out.

 

As I have nothing to back up my dreams, I am asking for help.

It absolutely feels weird to ask for money, even a bit shameful, but I’m not asking for much.

Everyone who reads this can help and move something. 

 

Ideally, 10-20€s from each of my Facebook friends for example should be enough, to cover

the overall costs. Presupposed, that everyone is reading this.

Of course, 1€ - the full amount, are more than welcome, as probably not everyone will see this.

 

The aim is, to raise 4962,89€, to fund my equipment back, which includes

Canon 5D Mark III

Canon EF 24-70mm 2.8 L II USM

CF Memory Cards

UV Filter

Card Reader

Camera Bag

 

With every small amount you can help getting me back on the road :)

My ever lasting gratitude and love are assured.

Also, of course, if I can ever be of any help, I will sure do my best.

Plus I am offering free photos for my backers, or even free photoshoots / projects in photography, video and motion graphics for people who are able to free up larger sums. 

Feel free to ask me about it :)

 

My first creation on the road to my adventures will be dedicated to everyone, who is willing to help a brother in need.

 

If you are broke as I am but still want to be of help, you can do this with liking and / or sharing this post :)

 

If you’ve just read everything from top to bottom,

Thank you. For taking the time.

Much love.

 

And beware of people with ultrasonic vision, lingering in the forests of Brandenburg.

story:
My Story

As a professional musician I have come to the sad realisation that in this day and age the performing arts lack sufficient funding to provide performing artists with a dignified livelihood. I have therefore decided to dedicate a significant proportion of my time to another passion of mine: photography and photo restoration. I have photographed (non-professionally) numerous events and I have significant experience in photo restoration and retouching using Adobe Photoshop. I now intend to offer these services professionally. In addition, I intend to offer portraiture at either the client’s house, place of work or a studio, as well as photo digitisation services.

The Business

Set-up costs for a business of this type are, however, significant. The camera doesn’t make the photographer, but unfortunately my current equipment is not of a high enough standard to meet the expectations of paying clients. In addition, photo restoration and digitisation requires specific hardware, only part of which I currently own. Although I have sold some of my equipment already to raise the necessary funds to start the business, I am still short a significant amount.

How You Can Help

I therefore appeal for financial support to help me set up a business which will help create and preserve people’s most treasured memories. However, I do not believe in accepting money for nothing, and for that reason I would like to offer some incentives as a token of gratitude to all those donors who will make it possible for me to set up the business. Donors can contribute as much or as little as they wish, but …

A £10 donation will receive a big, big thank you from me and an honourable mention on the business’ website and Facebook page

For a £25 donation I will give you a £30 gift voucher to be used against photo restoration and/or retouching services offered by the business once up and running.

For a £50 donation I will give in return a £60 gift voucher that can be used against photo restoration and/or retouching services offered by the business once up and running.

A £100 will give you a £125 gift voucher that you can use against any of the services offered by the business (photo restoration, photo retouching, photo shoot, photography tutorial) once up and running.

For a £200 donation I will show my gratitude by offering you a half-day photo shoot (portraiture or event) within a reasonable travelling distance from London or Manchester worth between £300 and £400 once the business is up and running.

All who contribute to this start-up will receive an honourable mention on the website (Gammeren.Photography) and regular updates on progress. You may of course opt out of these if you wish to do so. 

Funds will help towards the purchase of camera equipment (camera body and lenses), accessories (lighting and remote triggers) and a film and slide scanner. Any (hopefully) remaining funds will be used to develop the business’ website, to be launched in February-March 2016.

Other Ways to Help the Business Start Up

Any help, no matter how small, would be greatly appreciated. However, if you cannot contribute with money, please share my appeal with your friends and family on social media or via email. Alternatively, bookmark my website (Gammeren.Photography) or follow me on Twitter (@GammerenPhoto) and Facebook (GammerenPhoto) and keep me in mind if you or a friend or relative ever need a photographer or old photographs restored.
story_txt:
My StoryAs a professional musician I have come to the sad realisation that in this day and age the performing arts lack sufficient funding to provide performing artists with a dignified livelihood. I have therefore decided to dedicate a significant proportion of my time to another passion of mine: photography and photo restoration. I have photographed (non-professionally) numerous events and I have significant experience in photo restoration and retouching using Adobe Photoshop. I now intend to offer these services professionally. In addition, I intend to offer portraiture at either the client’s house, place of work or a studio, as well as photo digitisation services.
The BusinessSet-up costs for a business of this type are, however, significant. The camera doesn’t make the photographer, but unfortunately my current equipment is not of a high enough standard to meet the expectations of paying clients. In addition, photo restoration and digitisation requires specific hardware, only part of which I currently own. Although I have sold some of my equipment already to raise the necessary funds to start the business, I am still short a significant amount.
How You Can HelpI therefore appeal for financial support to help me set up a business which will help create and preserve people’s most treasured memories. However, I do not believe in accepting money for nothing, and for that reason I would like to offer some incentives as a token of gratitude to all those donors who will make it possible for me to set up the business. Donors can contribute as much or as little as they wish, but …
A £10 donation will receive a big, big thank you from me and an honourable mention on the business’ website and Facebook page
For a £25 donation I will give you a £30 gift voucher to be used against photo restoration and/or retouching services offered by the business once up and running.
For a £50 donation I will give in return a £60 gift voucher that can be used against photo restoration and/or retouching services offered by the business once up and running.
A £100 will give you a £125 gift voucher that you can use against any of the services offered by the business (photo restoration, photo retouching, photo shoot, photography tutorial) once up and running.
For a £200 donation I will show my gratitude by offering you a half-day photo shoot (portraiture or event) within a reasonable travelling distance from London or Manchester worth between £300 and £400 once the business is up and running.
All who contribute to this start-up will receive an honourable mention on the website (Gammeren.Photography) and regular updates on progress. You may of course opt out of these if you wish to do so. 
Funds will help towards the purchase of camera equipment (camera body and lenses), accessories (lighting and remote triggers) and a film and slide scanner. Any (hopefully) remaining funds will be used to develop the business’ website, to be launched in February-March 2016.
Other Ways to Help the Business Start UpAny help, no matter how small, would be greatly appreciated. However, if you cannot contribute with money, please share my appeal with your friends and family on social media or via email. Alternatively, bookmark my website (Gammeren.Photography) or follow me on Twitter (@GammerenPhoto) and Facebook (GammerenPhoto) and keep me in mind if you or a friend or relative ever need a photographer or old photographs restored.

story:
FRAME: How Asia Pacific feminist filmmakers + artists are confronting inequalities

FRAME is a photographic exhibition that focuses on the critical role feminist filmmakers play in addressing inequalities, starting in the Asia Pacific Region. This exhibition will be featured at the 12th Asia Pacific Screen Awards and the 9th Asia Pacific Triennial of Contemporary Art (APT9) in Brisbane, Australia. Additionally, we plan to broaden the scope of this show to spotlight feminist filmmakers in other regions, and tour the exhibit at other key events and festivals, including the Tribeca Film Festival in NYC. This exhibit carries forward the momentum of the international movement "50/50 by 2020" to bring gender equality to film. Our bigger goal is to create a Feminist Film Academy, which aims to build a community of filmmakers and connect women to financial resources, to key policy forums, and to each other in order to raise diverse narratives and confront inequalities.

Help us get this show on the road!

Photographers Ariel + Sam Soto-Suver (based in California) have spent the year photographing women filmmakers of the Asia Pacific region, in order to mount this exhibition. These powerful images need to be printed, shipped and hung for the grand opening at the Asia Pacific Screen Awards (in Brisbane, Australia), where we will travel to in November. The cost of an international exhibit is high and the photographers need your help to make this show a reality. We will be reaching key influencers and advocating for the importance of gender equality through art, while featuring the work of incredible women filmmakers at this eminent event. The photographers will also use the funds for wrapping the show, and shipping it back to the US, where we plan to tour the exhibit, starting in NYC. We have already photographed women filmmakers in Taiwan, Laos, Vietnam, Thailand, and Canada; and we plan to take more portraits in New York and when we travel to Australia as well. 

The Impact

Cinema is one of the most popular and powerful art forms of the modern world - it dismantles prejudices, inspires creative responses, and connects people across cultures. Yet, no formal community exists exclusively for feminist screen professionals in the Asia Pacific region and project funding remains limited. This is despite cinema playing a vital role in breaking down structural inequality and challenging social norms that perpetuate injustice. The photo exhibition plans to feature eight influential female filmmakers from Bangladesh, Australia, Cambodia, India, Laos, Vietnam, and Thailand—each given the platform to express the role they play as powerful catalysts for change in their own communities, and together, across the region. Some of the filmmakers we will feature have garnered international renown from the Oscars and at Cannes. Other brilliant filmmakers have the chance to expand their reach through the exhibition as well. An exhibition of these marginalized perspectives is critical. We will be signaling to the media, film audiences, and the industry itself, the importance of gender equality in film. The world needs films by women. Everyone benefits from exposure to the diversity of stories that women care about.

story:
1. Introduction

 

Ladies and gentlemen, greeting from Tokyo, Japan.

 

My name is Hiro Ugaya, a Tokyo-based male freelance journalist. I have been working as a full-time journalist ( writer / photographer ) since 1986 as a staff writer of Asahi Shimbun, one of Japanese national dailies, and weekly news magazine "Aera" as well as  freelancing since 2003.

 

Academically I have obtained a master degree of international affairs ( security policy ) from the School of International and Public Affairs of Columbia University in New York, USA,  as a recipient of Rotary International Foundation's scholarship, in the class of 1994. I also served as a foreign correspondent to New York from the Aera Magazine from 1998 to 1999.

 

2. Why is this project  important to me?

 

I have been covering the Fukushima's triple  meltdown accident since the Day One of March 11 2011 and traveled to the affected areas more than fifty times. I shot more than 250,000 photos in total  of the uninhabited communities and the evacuees.

 

Professionally speaking, the Fukushima accident is  gigantic news in both scale of space and time.  230,000 were exposed to the radioactivity and 100,000 lost their homes.  Besides, the nuclear power plant accidents that exposed its neighbors to radioactive fall-put have taken place only three times in the human's history - Three Mile Island in 1979, Chernobyl in 1986 and then Fukushima. The aftermath of Fukushima accident is viewed to last for decades. For instance, decommission of the three melt-down reactors is believed to take at least thirty years.  I believe those facts on the accident's aftermath are worth being informed to the global public in order to consider our future energy and environmental policies.

 

Outside my profession, I believe, as a human being,  the sufferings of the  affected people of Fukushima need more attention from the world. Professionally I am neither pro nor con for nuclear power. Simply I can not turn my eyes away from  the people in need. Some have lost their homes. Some got lethal illness. The reality is too harsh for them. This is a matter of human conscience.

 

3. Why do I need financial support?

 

However, the news of Fukushima is decreasing as time goes by. Newspapers, TV and magazines, the major news  media of Japan, are withdrawing from reporting Fukushima- some for financial and business reason and  some for its  political position of pro-nuclear energy. Anyway news of Fukushima is quickly disappearing from major mass media in Japan.

 

This is causing me  two problems. First, now they hardly publish  reports of Fukushima. Editors and producers are increasingly reluctant to run news story on Fukushima’s aftermath by mentioning  similar excuses such as “the news of Fukushima accident does not sell” or “the disaster stories are too dark and negative” or “our readers want to read ‘Japan is doing OK stories’”. Anyway I am losing traditional media outlet. So I have decided to publish photo report book on internet  by myself to reach the global audience.  Secondly, they do not pay for the reporters' fees and expenses. So I had to decide to report the news by using my own dime and selling them on a pay-per-view blog. In the year of 2016, I managed to publish the first digital photo report titled “Portrait of Fukushima: Life After Meltdowns 2011-2015.”  

 

However, after having worked hard in this way for six years,  the financing model is reaching the limit. In short,  I am running out of money. But I do not want to give up.

 

4. How much do I need to cover Fukushima and to publish a digital book?

 

Seven day travel from Tokyo to Fukushima cost approximately 1,000 US dollars in minimum.

 

*Accomodation: $400

*Transportation ( round-trip train ticket from Tokyo to Fukushima, rent-a-car, gasoline ) : $600  

 

Ideally, I should visit Fukushima once in every season - four times in a year. Thus the annual expenses excluding my own payment cost $4,000.

Meanwhile, the  process of editing a digital photo report book costs;

 

*Hiring an editor : $500

*Hiring a editorial designer: $500 

*Hiring a translator $ 500

 

In total, $1,500 in minimum.

 

Please note those prices do NOT include fee for myself - financial source to make my own living.

 

Therefore, if I wish to publish the report every year, I need $5,500 in total. I set the goal of total donation of $ 15,000 for publication of two years tentatively- expecting some unpredictable  expenses such as more frequent travel to Fukushima in case of emergency.

 

5. How am I going to spend the donated money?

 

Basically, I will spend the money as described in the paragraph 4. In addition,  maintenance of camera equipment may require some additional expense. 

 

6.What kind of perks would donator get?

 

*"Thank you very much note" on e-mail or Indiegogo messages from myself.

*Project up-date news letter.

*Print your names as “supporters”or ”donators” or “producers” on photo report book.

*For large  amount donators, free copy of the book.

*For larger amount donators, autographed physical photo copy from the book.

 

7.Why is this project valuable?

 

There are too many important news from Fukushima that has not obtained good global attention yet. At present of may 2017, 100,000 neighbors are still displaced on evacuation. Two leukemias and thyroid cancers have been officially confirmed among the clean-up workers of the power plant. I firmly believe those facts are worth being informed to the global public in order to shape our future energy and environmental policies.  Once again, professionally I am nor pro nor con of the nuclear energy. My job is not to judge but to inform the public facts so that they can make decision.

 

I am professionally highly motivated and qualified to pursue this project. I have been continuing traveling to Fukushima more than fifty times and published one digital book in English. My thirty-one  year journalist carrier is sure to help me in continuing the report activities ( travels  to the field, shooting photos, writing and editing reports, etc. ) in the future - as my life work. 

 

8.Is there a risk or challenge?

 

Yes. 

*I am 54 years old. The nuclear aftermath will continue for decades. I am going to be an old man. Someday it might get physically challenging  to travel back and forth.

*I might get health problem by being exposed to radioactive dose. In order to avoid that rick, I always manage my own dose by carrying dose meter with me with its alarm sound on. I avoid the risky hot spots. When I return from the contaminated areas, I make it rule to receive public screening.

*Government and TEPCO, the electric company, are least supportive for journalists. Especially entry to the troubled nuclear power plant itself is strictly controlled. They hardly permit journalists to approach the problem zones they are reluctant to show.

 

9. Is there a way to help me other than donating money?

 

Yes. Please spread the words of mouth  to your friends and family members through internet - on Indiegogo, Facebook, Tiwtter, e-mails or whatever. If you would like to see me on internet,  please check the links listed below.

 

Web site: http://www.ugaya.org/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hiromichiugaya

Twitter: https://twitter.com/hirougaya

 

Thank you in advance. I am looking forward to finding your name in donators' list.

 

Best regards;

Hiro Ugaya

May 17, 2017.

Tokyo, Japan.

story:
To keep it short


Hey, my name is Byran and I am a photographer, videographer and all-round creative based in the picturesque kingdom of East London. My background is in TV and Film production, I hold a BA in Scriptwriting for Film and TV and an MA in Producing Film and TV.

More recently I have taken up the art of photography. Any photographer out there will tell you that it can quickly become an expensive hobby and one of the biggest expenses is studio hire. To gain access to a studio you are often look at upwards of £200 a day which most novices and beginners can't afford. I don't think access to a studio should only be viable for full-time photographers.

A lot of people these days just want to create content for their own social media channels or simply for recreational purposes. And to do this, you don't need the latest and greatest equipment. Some times a backdrop, some decent strobes and a camera is all you need.

Even though the primary use will be photo and video centric, we also want it to be a flexible space. Whether you need rehearsal space, recording a podcast or just need a room to yourself then we will do our best to cater to your needs.

ByranCito Space aims to keep studio hire simple, easy and affordable for up and coming creatives.

The Space

The space itself is an 11ftx13ft sized back office in Hornchurch, East London. It is located right next to Hornchurch Underground Station and is very close to local amenities. Access to the space is through a gate and secure door and is one of a handful of office spaces in the property. It has a kitchenette, toilet and is cleaned weekly. There is 24/7 access to the space.

It's a cosy studio that will have a make-up area, seating and backdrop support, perfect for small scale shoots such as:
- Corporate Headshots
- Newborn Baby
- Cake Smash
- Portraits
- Talking Head Videos
- Fashion
- Product

What We Need & What's in it For You

To get the project up and off the ground I am already investing a lot of my own money. Mainly on rent for the space itself. Your donations will go towards kitting out the space with equipment.

This is a scalable project, and to start with, it is only necessary to obtain the essential equipment to get the space up and running. We are looking to raise £2000. (See what I mean about photography being expensive)

This is how your generous donations will be spent.

- Used Canon DSLR (Most Likely a Canon 6D or 5D Mark III)
- 2 x Godox SK400II Strobe with wireless trigger
- 2x Light Stands
- Backdrop Support (autopoles, rollers and clamps)
- Paper roll backdrops of different colours
- Tripod
- Reflectors
- Sound Blankets
- Furniture (Mirror, Tables, Desks, Plants, Decor)
- Advertising

We will be offering a range of perks that include use of the studio once it is up and running and you can hire me for your own personal photoshoot for your portfolio or social media.

If we don't reach our target we will simply use what funds we have and prioritise which equipment to get.

The Impact

Your generosity to the cause will have a profound impact on me and my own creative endeavours. It has always been a dream of mine to have my own creative space but I feel that it is also my duty to share it with others.

Our creativity shouldn't have any bounds and we should be able to express it without having to worry about the financial risk. There are a high concentration of studios in the inner east of London but this is an opportunity to make it more accessible for people who live further out or in the Essex area.

I have experience turning an idea into reality from my film background and when I have something I truly believe in, I will do my best to make it a success. And with most creative projects, I can't do this alone.

Proposed Pricing

We want to keep it affordable. The space isn't out to make huge profits. The main aim is to make it a place where people want to come and be creative.

£50 - Half day booking of 4 hours
£100 - Full day Booking of 8 hours
£15 - For additional hours

These prices are all in. For use of all equipment in the studio. There's no extra charges or hidden costs. Theoretically you can start being creative with no equipment of your own, the space will have everything you need.

We also want to be attentive to people's needs. We will not simply turn someone away who isn't able to afford it, instead we will work with them to see what packages or discounts we can offer.

But with what's on the market today this pricing is very affordable. As we begin to scale up in the future and buy more and better equipment I believe there is room to reasonably increase this price.

More than just a space

The space will be our main focus but in order to maximise our outreach and appeal we will be offering our equipment for hire even if people do not want to use it in the space itself. This will mainly be managed through Fat Llama where creatives are able to book kit in advance and use it for a period of time.

This will be another stream of income and will allow our service to be a little more flexible. Equipment that will be available to hire out will include:
- Cameras
- Lenses
- Microphones
- Tripods

And any other equipment we may acquire in the future that we feel creatives may find a use for.

Seeing as we are aiming this predominantly at beginners, amateurs and novices there is also the opportunity to learn basic camera and video skills from yours truly. I feel as though I have enough knowledge in photography and video production that it may be of use to whoever needs it. It doesn't just have to be a case of giving someone access to the space and leaving them to their own devices.

We want to build a community, a creative hub that can cater to a wide variety of creative needs for the individual. 

Risky Business?

The business ultimately has low risk. The cost of rent for the space is manageable and includes electricity so there will never be any unexpected bills.

My only concern is striking a balance between keeping it simple but still making it a space that is useful to people. We want the equipment and space to be adequate for people's needs but we also do not want it to be overkill.

There is definitely a market for people wanting cheap creative space, the challenge will just be getting the word out and making sure people know about us.

In order for the space to pay for itself it will need at least 4 full day bookings a month.

What About Covid?

The aim is to kit out the studio during the current lockdown restrictions so it is up and running when the guidelines are eased. However we will still aim to make sure the space is as safe as possible. For this we will limit the amount of people in the studio. ensure face masks are worn where appropriate and adequately clean equipment after every use.

The arts will survive this and ByranCito space will be there waiting for people who are eager to get out and start creating again.

Home of the Young and Uneducated Podcast

This idea was born from attempting to find an affordable space to record my new podcast. A lot of spaces were frankly offering too much for what I needed when in reality all I wanted was a room.

This space will act as our dedicated studio to film and record all future episodes of the podcast.

Long Term Plans

The idea is to start off small and test the waters. With good interest and the emergence of a growing creative community we hope to be able to expand and improve the space in any way we can. This may include upgrading equipment, obtaining more equipment or renting out other spaces. We hope to eventually be able to have a space with natural light, plenty of space and the latest equipment that is accessible to your average aspiring content creator.

We also want to eventually be in a position where we can create our own original content using upcoming creatives that have become part of the community. These can be short films, YouTube web series, podcasts, photography projects and much more!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times are difficult and not everyone is in the position to make a monetary contribution.

That's totally ok! We would really appreciate a simple share of this campaign and please give the below Instagram accounts a follow so you can keep up with the progress of the campaign.

@byrancito


@byrancitophoto

@byrancitospace

Also, if you have any old furniture you're looking to get rid of please let us know as we may be able to make use of it in the studio.

Thank you for reading and I hope you're able to join us on this journey!
story_txt:
To keep it short



Hey, my name is Byran and I am a photographer, videographer and all-round creative based in the picturesque kingdom of East London. My background is in TV and Film production, I hold a BA in Scriptwriting for Film and TV and an MA in Producing Film and TV.
More recently I have taken up the art of photography. Any photographer out there will tell you that it can quickly become an expensive hobby and one of the biggest expenses is studio hire. To gain access to a studio you are often look at upwards of £200 a day which most novices and beginners can't afford. I don't think access to a studio should only be viable for full-time photographers.
A lot of people these days just want to create content for their own social media channels or simply for recreational purposes. And to do this, you don't need the latest and greatest equipment. Some times a backdrop, some decent strobes and a camera is all you need.
Even though the primary use will be photo and video centric, we also want it to be a flexible space. Whether you need rehearsal space, recording a podcast or just need a room to yourself then we will do our best to cater to your needs.
ByranCito Space aims to keep studio hire simple, easy and affordable for up and coming creatives.
The Space

The space itself is an 11ftx13ft sized back office in Hornchurch, East London. It is located right next to Hornchurch Underground Station and is very close to local amenities. Access to the space is through a gate and secure door and is one of a handful of office spaces in the property. It has a kitchenette, toilet and is cleaned weekly. There is 24/7 access to the space.
It's a cosy studio that will have a make-up area, seating and backdrop support, perfect for small scale shoots such as:- Corporate Headshots- Newborn Baby- Cake Smash- Portraits- Talking Head Videos- Fashion- Product

What We Need & What's in it For You

To get the project up and off the ground I am already investing a lot of my own money. Mainly on rent for the space itself. Your donations will go towards kitting out the space with equipment.
This is a scalable project, and to start with, it is only necessary to obtain the essential equipment to get the space up and running. We are looking to raise £2000. (See what I mean about photography being expensive)
This is how your generous donations will be spent.
- Used Canon DSLR (Most Likely a Canon 6D or 5D Mark III)- 2 x Godox SK400II Strobe with wireless trigger- 2x Light Stands- Backdrop Support (autopoles, rollers and clamps)- Paper roll backdrops of different colours- Tripod- Reflectors- Sound Blankets- Furniture (Mirror, Tables, Desks, Plants, Decor)- Advertising
We will be offering a range of perks that include use of the studio once it is up and running and you can hire me for your own personal photoshoot for your portfolio or social media.
If we don't reach our target we will simply use what funds we have and prioritise which equipment to get.

The Impact

Your generosity to the cause will have a profound impact on me and my own creative endeavours. It has always been a dream of mine to have my own creative space but I feel that it is also my duty to share it with others.
Our creativity shouldn't have any bounds and we should be able to express it without having to worry about the financial risk. There are a high concentration of studios in the inner east of London but this is an opportunity to make it more accessible for people who live further out or in the Essex area.
I have experience turning an idea into reality from my film background and when I have something I truly believe in, I will do my best to make it a success. And with most creative projects, I can't do this alone.
Proposed Pricing

We want to keep it affordable. The space isn't out to make huge profits. The main aim is to make it a place where people want to come and be creative.
£50 - Half day booking of 4 hours£100 - Full day Booking of 8 hours£15 - For additional hours
These prices are all in. For use of all equipment in the studio. There's no extra charges or hidden costs. Theoretically you can start being creative with no equipment of your own, the space will have everything you need.
We also want to be attentive to people's needs. We will not simply turn someone away who isn't able to afford it, instead we will work with them to see what packages or discounts we can offer.
But with what's on the market today this pricing is very affordable. As we begin to scale up in the future and buy more and better equipment I believe there is room to reasonably increase this price.
More than just a space
The space will be our main focus but in order to maximise our outreach and appeal we will be offering our equipment for hire even if people do not want to use it in the space itself. This will mainly be managed through Fat Llama where creatives are able to book kit in advance and use it for a period of time.
This will be another stream of income and will allow our service to be a little more flexible. Equipment that will be available to hire out will include:- Cameras- Lenses- Microphones- Tripods
And any other equipment we may acquire in the future that we feel creatives may find a use for.
Seeing as we are aiming this predominantly at beginners, amateurs and novices there is also the opportunity to learn basic camera and video skills from yours truly. I feel as though I have enough knowledge in photography and video production that it may be of use to whoever needs it. It doesn't just have to be a case of giving someone access to the space and leaving them to their own devices.
We want to build a community, a creative hub that can cater to a wide variety of creative needs for the individual. 

Risky Business?

The business ultimately has low risk. The cost of rent for the space is manageable and includes electricity so there will never be any unexpected bills.
My only concern is striking a balance between keeping it simple but still making it a space that is useful to people. We want the equipment and space to be adequate for people's needs but we also do not want it to be overkill.
There is definitely a market for people wanting cheap creative space, the challenge will just be getting the word out and making sure people know about us.
In order for the space to pay for itself it will need at least 4 full day bookings a month.
What About Covid?
The aim is to kit out the studio during the current lockdown restrictions so it is up and running when the guidelines are eased. However we will still aim to make sure the space is as safe as possible. For this we will limit the amount of people in the studio. ensure face masks are worn where appropriate and adequately clean equipment after every use.
The arts will survive this and ByranCito space will be there waiting for people who are eager to get out and start creating again.
Home of the Young and Uneducated Podcast


This idea was born from attempting to find an affordable space to record my new podcast. A lot of spaces were frankly offering too much for what I needed when in reality all I wanted was a room.
This space will act as our dedicated studio to film and record all future episodes of the podcast.
Long Term Plans
The idea is to start off small and test the waters. With good interest and the emergence of a growing creative community we hope to be able to expand and improve the space in any way we can. This may include upgrading equipment, obtaining more equipment or renting out other spaces. We hope to eventually be able to have a space with natural light, plenty of space and the latest equipment that is accessible to your average aspiring content creator.
We also want to eventually be in a position where we can create our own original content using upcoming creatives that have become part of the community. These can be short films, YouTube web series, podcasts, photography projects and much more!

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that times are difficult and not everyone is in the position to make a monetary contribution.
That's totally ok! We would really appreciate a simple share of this campaign and please give the below Instagram accounts a follow so you can keep up with the progress of the campaign.
@byrancito
@byrancitophoto@byrancitospace
Also, if you have any old furniture you're looking to get rid of please let us know as we may be able to make use of it in the studio.
Thank you for reading and I hope you're able to join us on this journey!

story:
What is Stripway?

     Stripway is a Social Media Platform that allows you to share photos into personalized Strips. These Strips will enable you to categorize different events, hobbies, sports and life experiences. Your profile will no longer be a cluttered mess. Not only do you benefit from having an organized profile but you will also have the freedom to post as many photos as you'd like since there is no limit to the number of Strips you can create. 

     Oh, yeah? Did we forget to mention you can SWITCH these strips around?  That's right, Stripway allows you to feature any Strip you want in any order you wish. Are you currently on vacation and want to show all the fantastic photos you have taken? You can go ahead and place that strip at the top of your profile for everyone to see. Have you changed your mind? No problem, you can re-arrange your profile to have a fresh new look. 

   


 

How is Stripway different?

     What if you want to share photos of you with friends, family or pets. How about your hobbies or travels? Instead of mixing them all, you can place them in their corresponding Strip. Now when your friends or followers come to view your profile. They can choose which Strip they'd like to explore that interests them. 

     Stripway has an unlimited amount of ways to customize and arrange your profile. Let's say for example you are big into fitness and love to share pictures of your daily routine and workouts. You can have a Strip called "Fitness" and share all your workouts there. That's great; however, there is more to your fitness lifestyle. What about all the food, supplements, or outfits you use that part take in it. You can create a Strip for each of these categories and share more of what you do. Now all your friends and followers who have a similar interest will be able to look into these strips and get a better description of your daily workout or routine. 


 

Who is Stripway for?

Stripway is for everyone. Whether you are an influencer, artist, entertainer, brand or organization. Imagine the endless possibilities and creativity you have to customize your profile. 

As a brand, you can categorize the different items you have for your customers in their own strips. Are you an influencer, artist or entertainer? Create different Strips like "Events" "Photoshoots" "Pictures with Fans" "Sponsors" and more. Your imagination is your limitation. 

 
















 

Move Strips around 

Stripway gives you the ability to move strips around to help you further customize your profile. 


 

Quick Access  

Hold down any post to enter a "quick tool" feature to share a post or DM a user.


 

 

The Impact

     Your pledge will have a significant impact on the development of Stripway. Funding will go towards design and development. Some portions will go into marketing to help users like you connect with people all around the world. Other portions will go into a new features and tools for the app to increase your experience.  
     Android users, we have not forgotten about you guys, Our goal is to release Stripway into the Android store as well but we need your help to get there. Pledging will help speed this process to get you into Stripway. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

​     If you can't pledge, don't sweat it. We are very grateful and thankful you took the time to read our campaign. There are still many ways you can help and support our campign. Stripway can really use your assistance by sharing this link as well as spreading the word about the app which could be downloaded at the Apple App Store. 
Link: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/stripway/id1436...

story: .

„Artysty” is a book project featuring works of photography  students from Filmschool in Łódź (Poland).
The Film School in Lodz, one of the oldest film schools in the world, puts special emphasis on practical work in its teaching programme. The school educates students in film art, television, photography and acting. The greatest graduates: Roman Polański, Andrzej Wajda, Krzysztof Kieślowski, Sławomir Idziak.
 
 
We met in order to plan a publication concept that will combine the resulting photographs. We worked on choosing and editing pictures. Since we started by coincidence, we decided that you all will decide how you would like to view the book, in what order the photos will be, what hangs on the wall, what you will share with others and with what you’ll simply make a paper airplane. The publication appears in the form of a poster – it shows the versatility , randomness and fun that we experienced when we worked on it.
 
 


Who are we?
We are ARTYSTY.
Karolina Golis

Adrian Jaszczak

Weronika Jędrzejczak

Natalia Łączyńska

Monika Łuczak

Sara Morawska

Julia Ożańska

Magda Pietruszka

Agata Puławska

Martyna Strzelczyk

Kamila Winnicka

Karolina Wojtas

Tomasz Wysocki

Anna Zagrodzka

What is our goal?

  • 300 copies of book ARTYSTY

  • A2 size

  • 48 pages full of photographs

 

 

We have prepared some incredible perks for backers. You can choose from several different ideas on how we used our photographs! There are posters, exclusive prints, workshops, useful bags and many others so be careful while backing!

 

 

What will we do if we get less money than we need?

We will just print less amount of books! Don't worry, we want to finish our project anyway!

story:
I am creating a hi-res digital photobook and printed rewards that are affordable and beautiful featuring art nude photography of model Shawna Lee.

See all my work and sign-up for my newsletter in the footer of my website: https://www.orchardartsphotography.com/

On my first Indiegogo campaign I’ve received such positive feedback about the behind-the-scenes videos that I've made the video 80% longer with more camera angles to enjoy. Like my previous backers, you will enjoy the personal connection these videos provide.

For those who want an exclusive keepsake, we have 10 Polaroid images that are one-of-a-kind that no one else in the world will be awarded.

The Model

Born in New England, Shawna is 5'5" and has modeled at locations across America.  Built for art modeling, her stats are a 32D-24-33, dress size 2. Her olive skin and flowing brown hair are a perfect complement to the blue of the sky, green fields, and sandy shore of Rooster Rock.

We have completed our early morning shoot where we hiked around Rooster Rock Park near Portland, Oregon.  Shawna posed nude in multiple locations throughout the park including:

  • Grassy brush area
  • A driftwood fort
  • Playing in the beach sand
  • Walking around the shore
  • Playing in the water

Bonus shots! Shauna doing yoga on the sandy beach including king pigeon pose.

Thanks for your support!

Funds raised will be used to compensate the models and to purchase miscellaneous photography and video supplies so I can continue to create beautiful images for you to enjoy!

Shawna Lee Digital Photobook 

The full digital photobook with 100+ image, presented in a hi-res PDF ebook you can enjoy virtually anywhere. The ebook (high quality, 200 dpi PDF) let's you enjoy the images clearly on your large monitor or TV, or on the go with your phone or tablet.

Behind the scenes HD Video

This is an amazing glimpse into the process of making the images.  I will edit 90 minutes of footage, which was shot on three cameras simultaneously in 1080p full HD video, down to twenty minutes or more. The video satisfies an intellectual curiosity and gives amazing depth to the beauty of the ebook images.  I can't recommend enough choosing a reward that includes this video; it is so well worth it! I will provide some limited commentary that will further enhance the understanding of what is happening during the shoot.  Downloadable or streaming available. Video is only $10 extra with full ebook.

Bonus

Some higher-level reward packages also include a bonus set of an addition 100 images from the shoot. If you want it all you can have it here!

Reward with Printed Items

We are also included exclusive prints with some of our digital reward packages. These are amazing and will be unique to you.

5"x7" Metallic Photo Prints from the best shots of the shoot.  Professionally printed on high-quality metallic photographic paper and signed for authenticity.

Polaroid wide-format images.  Only 10 images were made during the shoot so they are truly one-of-a-kind!  Hurry these rewards are sure to go fast. See Collector A reward.

Deck of Cards. These are so fun and beautiful.  Each card has a different image to enjoy.  A new scene with every hand of BlackJack!

Sample Scene Shots:

Here are a few samples from the 200+ shots you can get:

Beach Brambles 

Waters Edge

Sandy Beach

Grassy Shore

Wading In

Risks & Challenges

Shawna and I have already completed the shoot and captured hundreds of quality images and more than 90 minutes of video! Everything is backed up in two locations.

This is very low risk, and I always add a buffer for issues that might come up. 

Please Spread the Word

If you enjoyed what we see here, I'd really appreciate it if you share our campaign on social media or directly to your friends.  It makes all the difference to us.

story:
I am Hinda Schuman, the photographer and writer. DEAR SHIRLEY is my true story. The book is being published by Daylight Books, a nonprofit dedicated to publishing art and photography books which explore the documentary mode along with the more conceptual concerns of fine art.

I have documented the beginnings and the endings of my relationships, captured in bursts of 1/125th of a second. DEAR SHIRLEY is filled with humor, anger, missed cues and discouragement. It is also about falling in love and the promise and excitement of finding someone to spend my life with. I see 2018 as the right time for a conversation about the hopes for queer marriages and the risks entailed. Like others in the 1970’s and 80’s, I was seeking a new path for myself. Ever been in love? Ever seen it all called into question? By the mid 2000's, the joy was being replaced with frustration, misunderstanding and an inability to crawl out of deep ruts. All the ingredients for a perfect afternoon read. And who doesn’t like to read other people’s mail?

 

Daylight Books is designing, printing, and marketing the book.  However, I must make a substantial contribution to this process. I want to make that contribution with help from friends, old and new. I am asking you to make a contribution either as a cash donation (which includes a perk) or passing along the link to the campaign via email and social media. Your support is crucial to bringing DEAR SHIRLEY to a wide community.    

My personal work has been exhibited locally and internationally. Images from the second chapter of DEAR SHIRLEY, entitled A True Story, were awarded first prize in the open category of the International Pride Photo Awards 2011. 

For twenty years I was a full-time photojournalist at The Philadelphia Inquirer. Currently I teach photography of many genres. You can read student comments on my website. (http://hindaschuman.net).  

Because this book is both so personal and public, I see DEAR SHIRLEY as an opportunity to speak to people who find their way to this story.  It is both a portrait and a visual memoir. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

My share of the publication costs is $32,500. That is an annual salary for many families.  Knowing that, it makes it all the more difficult for me to ask for help for a personal project. But I  have seen that DEAR SHIRLEY  can touch many people. I hope to make people laugh and speak out loud of thoughts kept bottled up inside. I hope it is a catalyst for many discussions.

Perks are a small way for me to thank you for your support. Advanced, signed copies of the book are the top offer. There are also options to own a signed print from the first edition. The sizes are from 8 ½” X 11” to 17”X 22”.  A terrific tote bag with an imprint from the book; an opportunity for an individual 1-hour critique of your photographs via Skype are among the other perks offered. There will also be Secret Perks so stay updated to find out about what I have yet to reveal. I have chosen a flexible goal for my campaign because the thought of not quite reaching my goal and having the momentum slip, and the book not reaching a broad audience seems too much to lose. With your help DEAR SHIRLEY will be in print and available for sale. 

 

Risks & Challenges

I have many friends supporting my Indiegogo campaign. They are truly the spine and spirit of this goal. They advised me about long walks off short piers. They offered marketing tips and created spreadsheets for me to keep track of the financial end of the crowd sourcing campaign. Special thanks and gratitude to the team at 6 Eighteen Studios, Shelagh Byrne and Linda Johnson, who created the video of my Indiegogo campaign.  (http://6eighteenstudios.com). My dear friend Eve has provided invaluable help with the financial calculations and editorial nuts and bolts of this campaign. I have received so much encouragement that I find it fills me with emotion.  With their help and with yours we will reach this goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I so value your acknowledgement that what I am creating is worth the effort – some of that will be via your support with financial contributions. There are many who would like to offer support but can’t do a cash donation. I value cheers and loud proclamations of “yea!” Sending links to social media or letting friends know via email or word of mouth is a most welcome gift. My email address is dear1shirley@gmail.com, for those who want to communicate directly with me. Any funds raised above the $32,500 I will contribute to public libraries and LGBTQ organizations.

It is also about falling in love and the promise and excitement of finding someone to spend my life with. I see 2018 as the right time for a conversation about the hopes for queer marriages and the risks entailed. Like others in the 1970’s and 80’s, I was seeking a new path for myself. Ever been in love? Ever seen it all called into question? By the mid 2000's, the joy was being replaced with frustration, misunderstanding and an inability to crawl out of deep ruts. All the ingredients for a perfect afternoon read. And who doesn’t like to read other people’s mail?
 
Daylight Books is designing, printing, and marketing the book.  However, I must make a substantial contribution to this process. I want to make that contribution with help from friends, old and new. I am asking you to make a contribution either as a cash donation (which includes a perk) or passing along the link to the campaign via email and social media. Your support is crucial to bringing DEAR SHIRLEY to a wide community.    
My personal work has been exhibited locally and internationally. Images from the second chapter of DEAR SHIRLEY, entitled A True Story, were awarded first prize in the open category of the International Pride Photo Awards 2011. 
For twenty years I was a full-time photojournalist at The Philadelphia Inquirer. Currently I teach photography of many genres. You can read student comments on my website. (http://hindaschuman.net).  
Because this book is both so personal and public, I see DEAR SHIRLEY as an opportunity to speak to people who find their way to this story.  It is both a portrait and a visual memoir. 
 
What We Need & What You Get
My share of the publication costs is $32,500. That is an annual salary for many families.  Knowing that, it makes it all the more difficult for me to ask for help for a personal project. But I  have seen that DEAR SHIRLEY  can touch many people. I hope to make people laugh and speak out loud of thoughts kept bottled up inside. I hope it is a catalyst for many discussions.
Perks are a small way for me to thank you for your support. Advanced, signed copies of the book are the top offer. There are also options to own a signed print from the first edition. The sizes are from 8 ½” X 11” to 17”X 22”.  A terrific tote bag with an imprint from the book; an opportunity for an individual 1-hour critique of your photographs via Skype are among the other perks offered. There will also be Secret Perks so stay updated to find out about what I have yet to reveal. I have chosen a flexible goal for my campaign because the thought of not quite reaching my goal and having the momentum slip, and the book not reaching a broad audience seems too much to lose. With your help DEAR SHIRLEY will be in print and available for sale. 
 
Risks & Challenges
I have many friends supporting my Indiegogo campaign. They are truly the spine and spirit of this goal. They advised me about long walks off short piers. They offered marketing tips and created spreadsheets for me to keep track of the financial end of the crowd sourcing campaign. Special thanks and gratitude to the team at 6 Eighteen Studios, Shelagh Byrne and Linda Johnson, who created the video of my Indiegogo campaign.  (http://6eighteenstudios.com). My dear friend Eve has provided invaluable help with the financial calculations and editorial nuts and bolts of this campaign. I have received so much encouragement that I find it fills me with emotion.  With their help and with yours we will reach this goal. 
Other Ways You Can Help
I so value your acknowledgement that what I am creating is worth the effort – some of that will be via your support with financial contributions. There are many who would like to offer support but can’t do a cash donation. I value cheers and loud proclamations of “yea!” Sending links to social media or letting friends know via email or word of mouth is a most welcome gift. My email address is dear1shirley@gmail.com, for those who want to communicate directly with me. Any funds raised above the $32,500 I will contribute to public libraries and LGBTQ organizations.

story:
I love sharing my photos!

I'm passionate about photography and allowing people to see where my adventures take me is a really special part of my life.

Every book comes personally signed.

What I Need From You

  • $25. That's it. $25 is it, that covers taxes, shipping, and printing of the book.
  • I have 25 books ready to order, all I need is the funding for them. My goal is $610.10. 
  • This is an all or nothing campaign. If you donate but I don't raise $610.10, you get your money back.

The Impact

The best way I'm benefitting from this is if the campaign is successful, I know that people are interested in my work, and a physical item is something to share with others

Breaking The Bank?

 

  • Is $25 too much for your wallet? No worries, I understand and get it.  
  • What you can do though if help spread the word on what I'm trying to do, and share my photography with people!

story:
Português:

Este projecto é um culminar de anos de trabalho e um livro único para quem gosta de viajar e de arquitectura. Compre um livro seleccionando uma das opções da barra lateral. Os primeiros 50 livros têm ainda mais desconto, ficando nos 34€! Veja o vídeo com legendas em Português. 

Contribua para este projeto ao mesmo tempo que ajuda na divulgação da arquitectura Portuguesa pelo mundo.

A campanha de crowdfunding funciona como uma pré-venda do livro, ou seja, se atingir a totalidade do financiamento consigo imprimir o livro, se não atingir a totalidade a quantia não chega a ser cobrada. Como fotógrafo que trabalha em projecto independentes e sem financiamento, é muito importante ter o vosso apoio para que possa continuar a trabalhar nestes projectos fotográficos. 

 

English:

This project is a culmination of years of work and a unique book for those who enjoy to travel and enjoy architecture. Buy the book by selecting one of the sidebar options. The first 50 books have even more discount!

Contribute to this project while helping to spread the world's windows! 

The crowdfunding campaign works as a pre-sale of the book. If it reaches the funding goal, I will be able to print the book, if it does not reach the funding goal, the amount is not collected. As a photographer that works with independent projects thare are not financed, it is very important to have your support so that I can continue to work on these photographic projects.

 

 

 

Book & Project Description:

 

In every era, architects have dazzled with their ability to transcend the status quo to achieve timeless beauty coupled with efficient design, it is in the building’s windows that it comes to life. Because they serve as a bridge between nature and the building’s interior, they bring nature’s vitality inside the building. How they create that bridge defines the personality of its builder—and those who commissioned him.

Humility—or a lack thereof—in a building’s original owner often reflects in the building’s windows. The plain, rustic windows of a peasant dwelling contrast with those of a palace, whose royal owners demonstrate their power and wealth with flashy, opulent windows with intricate design and gilt trim. Others, following Frank Lloyd Wright’s lead, create buildings whose windows extend the occupants’ line of sight way beyond the physical boundaries of the home to encompass nature itself.

One small glass pane that separates the exterior from the civilisation inside. Security. A safe place from which one can view the world beyond. The way in which every architect, every owner has visualised that barrier inspired me to showcase the sheer variety of that vision. Across cultures, across time, window designs have evolved and adapted, much as humankind itself. That evolution formed the basis of this work.

Not only do buildings themselves have a distinctive identity, but cities, too, have their own design aesthetic. As in individual buildings, that distinction shows its face best through the city’s various windows. As a result, I chose to showcase the collections city by city, highlighting the subtle differences that separate one city’s windows from another’s.

Gaze into the tiled windows of Lisbon and see the white facades of Alentejo. In the Azores, Sao Miguel’s windows incorporate local volcanic rock into their design—closing the gap between nature and civilisation even more.

It’s not always the most famous windows, nor the most lovely, who tell the best stories. Often, it is the well-worn windows that best reveal a building’s story. The laughs, the loves—the ravages of war—all add to that building’s intrigue.

A far cry from humankind’s earliest windows—simple holes in a shelter’s walls—city windows show the sheer variety into which this design element has evolved. This collection of photographs showcases that variety with its careful study of urban architecture throughout the world. City by city, readers can see the subtle differences in each city’s cultural aesthetic as displayed by windows of the world.

 

Travel around the world without leaving the comfort of your home through the pages of this book. Peer through its windows, and see a glimpse of each city’s history and long-forgotten cultures.

 

Selection of media outlets that published the project:

 

 

I want to personally say thanks to everyone who helped me to keep growing the project! In particular:

 

The photos in the video and in the campaign are just a sample of what the book will be. With dozens of unpublished collections in order to provide a global experience of the diverse Portuguese architecture.

Please continue to support the work by pledging and sharing, so that I can extend the project to other countries and continents! I estimate the book to be ready to distribute in January. Thank you!!

 

Risks and challenges

I spent the last years doing all the photographs, travelling to more than 100 cities, at this point, the collections are done and the book layout is in process. So there's very little risk. Will update backers regularly on each step of the process.
