And as a crowdfunding supporter, you will be provided a discount on future purchases of our work.
Fototropix and Success 
 Realistically in business, failure can be the outcome. We feel the 1st challenge is not to view this project as having our dream funded. Because if a dream never comes to life.  That's fine "it was only a dream, to begin with.". However, we view this project as a real-life means to direct our journey with our family. When it was our determination to move out west. CC and I decided to build a tiny house. With limited building experience. What we didn't know we learned. What we didn't have, we made. The build was successful, driving it from Florida to California. After living in it for 2 years, we sold it to fund our move to NY. Determination and tenacity continue to be the fuel for our success. Other Ways You Can Support the JourneyEach one of you can help with this Campaign. We are sure you have friends you can share our Campaign with. If you have a blog or Youtube channel, mention us there.We appreciate your time and thank you for your support You can follow our progress by clicking the Heart icon aboveShare our Campaign on your Facebook page Send it out on your Twitter feedor simply share the link in emails

story:
作者跋涉天目山崇山峻岭20 多年，
探寻银杏奥秘。


从百余斤底片和nG 的数码照片中，
精选200 多幅图片，
结合科学知识及银杏故事，
历时5 年编辑打磨，精雕细琢，
专业领域更有院士教授鼎力相助。
澳洲双语诗人陈尚慧( 英语82 级）
特别为本书翻译多首银杏古诗。


中英文和谐共生，
相亲相挨，
英文由英国专业人士审读。

 

内容介绍


画册从植物科学为起点，囊括多维度银杏故事，穿插四季银杏风景。进而从老子，孔子，扁鹊，丘处机等中华先贤手植银杏为切入点，讲述具有普世价值观的中国故事，比如‘无为而治’，‘老马识途’，‘敬天爱民’等等。是一部自然与人文相辉映，科学和艺术相融交汇的画册。既是欣赏神奇大自然的艺术书，更是宣传中华文化的‘国书’（关于国树银杏的画册，‘国书’也。National Book, condensed from Book of the National Tree, YMMV)


学术顾问


- 周志炎, 中国科学院院士，古生物学家，中国科学院南京地质古生物研究所，国际上研究古生物包括银杏类植物的权威人物。
- 邢世岩，山东农大林学院教授，中国林学会银杏分会副会长。
- 张照根, 苏州考古研究所所长，对中国历史颇有研究。


出版目的


国务院参事何茂春教授在为本书所作的序中，期许银杏画册能成为‘从中国走出的亲善大使’，为促进中外文化交流作一点小贡献。


为中国制造呐喊，为中国智造助威振声，下次您出访，请向友邦代表递交‘国书’。

 

好评如潮

本书的电子稿在植物界兴起了巨大反响，引起了国际植物园保护协会主席Stephen Blackmore 爵士、澳大利亚植物园联盟主席Stephen Forbes 先生、国际自然保护组织物种生存委员会主席Simon Stuart 先生、英国皇家植物园丘园树木园主任TonyKirkham 博士，加拿大Nova Scotia 博物馆馆长Marian Munro 女士，芝加哥植物园前总裁兼首席执行官Sophia Shaw 女士，美国 Oak Spring Garden 基金会会长，伦敦Kew 皇家植物园园长，耶鲁大学耶鲁森林与环境研究学院前院长Peter Crane 爵士，加利福尼亚科学院全球倡议主任/ 林赛生物多样性科学与可持续性植物研究所主席Margaret (Meg) Lowman 博士等等大咖的关注。


‘It is impossible to pigeonhole this book into any one category. A sensitive blend of the sciences, humanities, and arts, a most remarkable tree is brought to life through spectacular photos and engaging text. At a time of so much biodiversity loss, I wish every species could have a Jimmy Shen, someone to tell its story with admiring words and inspiring images. I have always been fascinated by the Ginkgo. I now have many more reasons to be.’


--Quentin Wheeler, President, College of Environmental Science and Forestry, The Ohio State University, U.S.A. Apr. 04, 2018


‘不可能把这本书归入任何单一科目。一部融合了科学、人文和艺术的著作，通过壮观的照片和引人入胜的文字赋予银杏生命。在生物多样性丧失如此严重的当下，我希望每个物种都有一个沈建明，一个能够用赞美的语言和鼓舞人心的图像讲述它的故事的人。我一直对银杏很着迷。我现在更有理由了。’
——俄亥俄州立大学环境科学与林业学院院长Quentin Wheeler

关于作者


沈建明, 英语82 级，先后师从建筑教育家柳士英之子，城乡规划专家柳道平先生及国画大师潘天寿的高徒于广明先生，从事专业摄影二十年。作品在新西兰的Canterbury 博物馆，举行过为期两个半月的展览，深受好评。准备捐赠广外一批此画册。

这是我3年前众筹的内容：

 

Greetings

Greetings from ancient homeland of ginkgo, a botanical utopia located in grand mountain ranges in east China. 

In 1989, at Yi Ma Formation of Henan province（河南省义马煤矿）, China, a team of paleontologists led by Ziyan Zhou (周志炎) (Prof. Zhou is the academic advisor of this book) and Bole Zhang (章伯乐) unearthed some ginkgo fossils, that they later traced back 170 million years--the oldest ginkgo fossils found to date.

I am Jimmy Shen (沈建明), a professional photographer, brought up at the foot of the TianMu Mountains(天目山), where wild ginkgos have been existing for hundreds of millions of years.

I learned my craft through apprenticeship to an outstanding disciple of the late master Chinese painter Shoutian Pan (潘天寿). My works have been published and exhibited internationally.

 

Why I Created this Book

God created the earth, where dinosaurs and ginkgos flourished. After the biological mass extinction 65 million years ago, plus the Quaternary glaciers which swept across the planet 2 million years ago, most forms of animals and plants disappeared. One species of ginkgo tree survived in sheltered mountainous areas in east China. I am lucky enough to be a native.

The purpose of this book is to promote public awareness towards ginkgo, linked to the primitive nature. Discover and share wonders of Nature.

The oldest ginkgo in the West (in Netherlands) is less than 300 years old, while there are some ginkgos in China over 3,000 years old. Here is one over 1,500 years old, situated at the top of Wuyun Mountain, Hangzhou, China.

So Many Stories about Ginkgo

I recall a treat of my childhood, after my mother cooked rice with wood, I used to throw ginkgo nuts into these hot ashes, and after a short while the nuts cracked like a song, they were delicious. 

Tell You a Secret--How Male and Female Ginkgos Date:

We all know male and female ginkgos are separate trees. There are no bees involved as go-betweens. In spring, pollen cones grow on male trees while the ovule develops on the females. Carried by the wind, pollen travels miles across hills and rivers, meanwhile the ovule sends out a drop of liquid on the top to catch pollen passing by.

After meeting, the drop retreats and leads the way for pollen to settle down in the growing pollen tube, where sperms develop. Later in autumn matured sperms leave the tube and swim to the egg, which is developed in the ovule, making the actual fertilization to produce an embryo.

Due to the environment blessed with so many ginkgos, folks usually live long lives. This 102-year-old great-great-grandma often wins money when playing Mahjong (麻将) with others.

 

Lots more fascinating stories like:

--A 2,000-year-old ginkgo transformed into a smart scholar, he got an engagement with the princess... 银杏变秀才，皇帝找驸马

--An old tomb under a 1000-year-old ginkgo...古银杏树下惊现古墓

--With a couple ginkgos, the dying female (wife) saved the male ginkgo (husband) magically...

危难关头，雌树银杏（妻子）舍身救雄树（丈夫）

...

While designing the book, ginkgo lent me a lot of inspiration. In fact, I imitate a lot of its characteristics, that’s clear, straightforward, and graceful (I wish).

I got invaluable help from a lot of professionals, Australian Chinese bilingual poet Sherry Chan （陈尚慧） contributed the translation of ancient Chinese poems into English, Dr. Yusheng (Christopher) Liu (刘裕生教授),Tenured Professor of Botany at Prairie View A&M University, U.S.A., kindly edited the book. My old Canadian friend, Ernie Grimo, founding president in 1972 and recently re-elected President of the Society of Ontario Nut Growers, has always been a helping hand when in need at early stage of this book several years ago, and many more...

Covering chapters like About Ginkgo, Oldest Ginkgos, Wonders, Poems, Folk Remedies, Symbols, Legends, Memorabilia, etc. The nearly 160 images are extracted from two decades’ work. English-Chinese bilingual edition, measurements: 26 x 25 cm, or 10.23 x 9.84 inches, hardcover, matte paper 200 g, about 192 pages, 1kg. List price will be US$37.99.

All books are signed, both in English and in Chinese. 

 

PDF 

Immerse yourself in the ginkgo story along with year-round scenes. Dig.

This (13 mb) 180+ pages draft PDF contains 150+ images and stories. I reserve full editing rights, the final book may be slightly different. Will send the link for downloading to your email box within one week after claim.

$7 Limited to 500 Backers

For a group of 4, each will have a PDF and 10 print cards (4 x 6 inch) of a set of total 40 ginkgo images, covering most important images of ginkgo, including pollen, ovule, year round scenes. Packed in a box, sent to one address.

For those not in a group, I will group them and pick one at random from every 4 backers, the lucky one will have a book. To be delivered Mar, 2017.

Please inform me your shipping address as well. I will post names of these lucky people in the above UPDATES tab in the first week after this campaign ends, besides notifying you by email.

$10 

For a group of 3, each will have a PDF, and the group will have a book, sent to one address. For those not in a group, I will group them and pick one at random from every 3 backers, the lucky one will have a book.

Please inform me your shipping address as well. I will post names of these lucky people in the above UPDATES tab in the first week after this campaign ends, besides notifying you by email.

 

Book

Printed in China. While browsing quality picture books in a fine bookstore, you may often come across books which state Printed in China on the copyright page, I usually buy a lot of sample books from these printing houses, which cooperate with Western publishers. Actually, for me, they are a good source to study book design. And this book is to be printed at one of these printing houses. Besides, I can always test on the spot before the final production.

$29 for One Copy + PDF​

Besides 20% off list price US$37.99, you are the first to read the book. Leaf through these pages, encounter wonders, along with stories and year-round scenes. For PDF, please refer to the above draft PDF perk. 

$99 for 4 copies + PDF​;

$990 for 50 Copies + PDF​;

Ideal for resell at garden stores, centers...

$1700 for 100 Copies + PDF​

Ideal for resell at garden stores, centers...You could be my agent in your continent. I will forward a big parcel containing individual small parcels, you would distribute to the individuals respectively at my cost. And you will lead a delegation of ginkgo lovers to tour ancient ginkgo forests. There are a lot of ginkgo related products, like ginkgo nuts wine, ginkgo leaves pillows, ginkgo nuts powders, etc. Together with some museums, we would hold a grand exhibition. (银杏嘉年华)

 

 

Posters

8 x 10 inch images printed on 11 x 14 inch hard sheet paper, either to be framed or to be tacked on walls direct. You have your own gallery of ginkgo.

Even you can make your own calendar with these posters. There are posters with 0.8 inch longer, that's 11.8 x 14 inch. On the back there are blank squares to fill the date of the month. And all these 30/50 images are horizontal, with which you can make 2-3 years of calendars without repeat of scenery. 

$50 for a set of 30 posters, $60 for Calendar set of 30 posters;

$70 for a set of 50 posters, $80 for Calendar set of 50 posters

 

Calendars

11.8 x 14 inch, 13 pages

Bring home a touch of the original nature. The 13 pictures are carefully selected and ordered to reflect the changing seasons. In your language and main holidays included.

Please specify which country calendar you order. Kindly note that to guarantee the quality, a minimum quantity of 200 copies for a specific language/country is needed. There are alternative digital solutions, the quality is a bit less ideal. So please shout out in your social media, and I will update the accumulating figure in the UPDATE tab.   

Please click one of the following links and get the digital calendar, for private perusal only.

North America; UK; Australia; France; Germany; Arabian; Netherlands; Italy; Switzerland; Denmark; Sweden, Belgium, Croatia, more countries are coming.

On line review may appear incorrect, downloaded files are flawless.

Learn the story of ginkgo. Order 2 calendars, get a free PDF of the book.

$990 for 100 copies, with your name or logo printed on the front page;

$​1,900 for one copy, printed on fine art archival paper, made to order, in your language, with holidays and personally customized events up to 30 remarks.

 

 

Prints

All prints are open edition, signed fine art archival ink jet prints, which are reported not to fade for decades, size of 8 x 10-in, and prices are subject to change upon end of this campaign. 

A set of 30/50 prints includes pollen, ovule, year round scenes, meanwhile you get two free posters with information about ginkgo and about the photographer (these posters are not ink jet printed,)  

Ideal for exhibition, a treat for nature/botany/ginkgo lovers. No tickets, pls. If you need my assistance or appearance, pls let me know.

Packed in a box. Signed, matted, foam core backed, ready for standard 11 x 14-in frames. Each print is protected by a glassine to the face. 

$50 for One + PDF;

$1,300 for a Set of 30 + PDF;

$2,000 for a Set of 50 + PDF

 

Tour

Homeland of ginkgo, a mecca for nature lovers. Roam ancient ginkgo forests. Dance with falling leaves. Includes meals, lodging, transportation, tour at a ginkgo village, and a ginkgo products factory. International airfare not included. City tours may add up.

$10 Reservation of your adventure next year by order of a book PDF. Seems that we have had too much rain here in the TianMu Shan Mountains these months, this year ginkgos here are not so glorious as they should.

$1,900 for 1 Week Tour

PDF + 3 BOOKS + ONE WEEK'S TOUR IN LAND OF GINKGO, my friends or I will be the guide in and around the Tianmu Mountains, or other ginkgo villages. Be a part of this land of wonders. For PDF, please refer to the above PDF perk. (Families or friends want to come too? Contact me, above.) Books will be sent Mar. 2017.

$4900 for 10 Days' Tour + IN the Film, Limited to 10 Backers

SPECIAL MENTION AT THE END OF THE FILM + PDF + 3 BOOKS + Tour in and around Tianmu Mountains. I will be the guide. I am planning to make a film/documentary (银杏大地纪录片). WALK INTO THE FILM AS FOREIGN TOURISTS. Like to deliver a speech? Maybe, yet to decide. One scene is a team of foreign tourists roam ancient ginkgo forests. Get ready to be a star. Books will be sent Mar. 2017.

 

No Facebook, Twitter, Youtube Account?

Non, I am an internet dummy, besides no access to them here in China. Please spread this campaign with your friends in your social media or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

Well, I have a linked-in account. You could also leave a message on my linked-in:

https://cn.linkedin.com/in/ginkgo

         

My Initial Goal is $12k

If I hit 32k, there will be a slip case.

If I hit 100k, there will be..., yet to decide, what is your opinion? Several ginkgo guest houses in the ginkgo village to receive ginkgo lovers around the world, including you. And there will be Chinese-German, Chinese-French and other languages editions, too.

 

Get a Touch of the Original Nature 

See right if one of the perks fits you, or contact me if you have some other requests, or spread this campaign, please. 

Get a touch of the original nature, traced back hundreds of millions of years ago, when dinosaurs roamed the earth. (回归淳朴的自然)

 

 

What They Are Saying About

'This manuscript offers a wonderful glimpse of the stately ginkgo from its origins in China. The author and photographer show adoration for this most ancient of trees. I was gifted a digital copy to peruse and shall cherish it. The images are touching and the prose poetic. Love the history and folk lore as well as popular references. A wonderful tribute to tree we have only sparingly planted in Nova Scotian cities and towns.'

--Ms. Marian Munro, Curator of Botany, Nova Scotia Museum, Canada

-----------------------------------------------------

‘I also showed it to our librarian, and we both agree that the photography and design are stunning. It is a very lyrical combination of imagery, poetry and information about the treasured ginkgos in China.’

--Ms. Lugene B. Bruno, Curator of Art & Senior Research Scholar, Hunt Institute for Botanical Documentation, Carnegie Mellon University, U.S.A

----------------------------------------------------

 ‘This is a beautiful book about a beautiful and intriguing plant. The photographs and stories are inspiring, and add to our enjoyment of the fascinating ginkgo. Jimmy Shen has created a work of art and science!’

--Tim Entwisle, Professor, Director and Chief Executive of Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria, Australia

‘Your exploration of Ginkgo biloba and the relationship between Chinese people and this remarkable tree through outstanding photographs, careful documentation and poetry is very important. You beautifully illustrate the interconnections between beauty and utility in this enduring relationship. The nature of this relationship over thousands of years is important for our understanding of a sustainable future. This is an important quest for you to continue.’

--Stephen Forbes, Director, Botanic Gardens of South Australia, Adelaide, Chair of the Council of Heads of Australian Botanic Gardens, Australia

'I just LOVE your book about "everything Ginkgo!" You have creatively woven fact with story, technical language with poetry, and amazing legends with dry history. The visuals are extraordinary and truly inspiring to the senses.'

Many thanks for sharing and I know this book will be a huge success once published.

--Margaret (Meg) Lowman, Ph.D., Director of Global Initiatives/Lindsay Chair of Botany, Institute for Biodiversity Science and Sustainability, California Academy of Sciences, U.S.A.

‘This is an amazing book that will find its way onto everyone's bookshelf who is interested in Ginkgos. It has fabulous images of Ginkgos in the wild and cultivation.’

--Dr. Tony Kirkham, Head of the arboretum at the Royal Botanic Gardens Kew, United Kingdom

-------------------------------------------------------

‘Your excellent photographs of our living fossil Ginkgo biloba have brought elegance of the importance of this living fossil. Please promote your creative art to the whole world. We will keep your book in our library.’

--Dr. Ratikanta Maiti,  Ph.D, D.Sc. Chairman, Int Conf on Bio-resource and Stress Management; Chief Editor - IJBSM; Ex Professor, UDLA, Mexico

‘In this labor of love, Jimmy Shen has created a meticulously documented celebration of the majestic gingko and their enduring relation to culture and place. The volume leaves an impression of golden light filtered through autumn leaves.'

--Susannah R. McCandless, PhD, International Program Director, Global Diversity Foundation, Co-organizer, Global Environments Summer Academy, USA

-------------------------------------------------------

‘It is an impressive compilation of information, anecdotes, medical remedies and even recipes from all over China. Some of the illustrations are quite spectacular! It must have taken considerable time and effort to gather all the information and photos from across the country. The book is a valuable resource for anyone wanting to know about Ginkgo and its long heritage. Great job!’

--Prof. Stephen McLoughlin, Swedish Museum of Natural History, Sweden

         

 

‘This is a beautiful and wonderfully complete body of work. I will take time to go through and read thoroughly, it truly deserves time to absorb and reflect. I would love to see this work being showcased in our garden and to be enjoyed by others who appreciate the nature and lore of ginkgo.’

--Kevin Frediani, Inverewe Property Manager at the National Trust for Scotland, Honorary Lecturer Urban Agriculture, The University of Nottingham, U.K.

Concerning your book, it is a delightful balance of art and information. I always love the Ginkgo for its beauty and place in natural history. I wish we were able to grow them in Florida but, alas it is not happy here. I did grow them in Michigan and enjoyed their ancient appeal. Your book really captured their mystique in a thought provoking and artistic manner. I will of course forward any interest your way as, alas as mentioned Florida does not see the tree grown this far south in the sub tropics.

--Steven J. Royer, Professor, Palm Beach State College, U.S.A.

----------------------------------------------------

‘It is fascinating to learn more about the unique history of the ginkgos, as well as how they fit culturally in both artistic and botanical traditions in China. This was clearly a labor of love for you, and you should be applauded for a fine work . . . and for sharing it with others!!’

-- J. Eric Smith, President and CEO, TREE Fund, U.S.A.

----------------------------------

‘The Ginkgo book looks beautiful and extremely interesting. Thanks so much for being the champion for conserving the amazing Ginkgo tree!’

--Simon Stuart, Chair, Species Survival Commission, the International Union for Conservation of Nature

----------------------------------

‘That is a great book! The information on biology, ecology, history, lore, and uses is invaluable.’

-- Christopher J. Earle, Senior Ecologist, www.conifers.org

作者跋涉天目山崇山峻岭20 多年，探寻银杏奥秘。从百余斤底片和nG 的数码照片中，精选200 多幅图片，结合科学知识及银杏故事，历时5 年编辑打磨，精雕细琢，专业领域更有院士教授鼎力相助。澳洲双语诗人陈尚慧( 英语82 级）特别为本书翻译多首银杏古诗。中英文和谐共生，相亲相挨，英文由英国专业人士审读。 内容介绍画册从植物科学为起点，囊括多维度银杏故事，穿插四季银杏风景。进而从老子，孔子，扁鹊，丘处机等中华先贤手植银杏为切入点，讲述具有普世价值观的中国故事，比如‘无为而治’，‘老马识途’，‘敬天爱民’等等。是一部自然与人文相辉映，科学和艺术相融交汇的画册。既是欣赏神奇大自然的艺术书，更是宣传中华文化的‘国书’（关于国树银杏的画册，‘国书’也。National Book, condensed from Book of the National Tree, YMMV)
学术顾问- 周志炎, 中国科学院院士，古生物学家，中国科学院南京地质古生物研究所，国际上研究古生物包括银杏类植物的权威人物。- 邢世岩，山东农大林学院教授，中国林学会银杏分会副会长。- 张照根, 苏州考古研究所所长，对中国历史颇有研究。
出版目的国务院参事何茂春教授在为本书所作的序中，期许银杏画册能成为‘从中国走出的亲善大使’，为促进中外文化交流作一点小贡献。为中国制造呐喊，为中国智造助威振声，下次您出访，请向友邦代表递交‘国书’。 好评如潮本书的电子稿在植物界兴起了巨大反响，引起了国际植物园保护协会主席Stephen Blackmore 爵士、澳大利亚植物园联盟主席Stephen Forbes 先生、国际自然保护组织物种生存委员会主席Simon Stuart 先生、英国皇家植物园丘园树木园主任TonyKirkham 博士，加拿大Nova Scotia 博物馆馆长Marian Munro 女士，芝加哥植物园前总裁兼首席执行官Sophia Shaw 女士，美国 Oak Spring Garden 基金会会长，伦敦Kew 皇家植物园园长，耶鲁大学耶鲁森林与环境研究学院前院长Peter Crane 爵士，加利福尼亚科学院全球倡议主任/ 林赛生物多样性科学与可持续性植物研究所主席Margaret (Meg) Lowman 博士等等大咖的关注。‘It is impossible to pigeonhole this book into any one category. A sensitive blend of the sciences, humanities, and arts, a most remarkable tree is brought to life through spectacular photos and engaging text. At a time of so much biodiversity loss, I wish every species could have a Jimmy Shen, someone to tell its story with admiring words and inspiring images. I have always been fascinated by the Ginkgo. I now have many more reasons to be.’--Quentin Wheeler, President, College of Environmental Science and Forestry, The Ohio State University, U.S.A. Apr. 04, 2018‘不可能把这本书归入任何单一科目。一部融合了科学、人文和艺术的著作，通过壮观的照片和引人入胜的文字赋予银杏生命。在生物多样性丧失如此严重的当下，我希望每个物种都有一个沈建明，一个能够用赞美的语言和鼓舞人心的图像讲述它的故事的人。我一直对银杏很着迷。我现在更有理由了。’——俄亥俄州立大学环境科学与林业学院院长Quentin Wheeler其它评价见https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-picture-bo... 特别报道https://www.global-diversity.org/a-photographer... 画册收到了以下单位/ 个人的订购美国康奈尔大学Karl J. Niklas 教授及其图书馆加州California Polytechnic State University 大学Matt Ritter 教授哈佛大学Arnold Arboretum 图书馆Huntington Botanical Gardens 图书馆Botanical Dimensions Ethnobotany Library 图书馆Wild Foundation 原野基金会主席Vance Martin 先生Global Diversity Foundation 全球生物多样性基金会总裁SusannahMcCandless 博士TREE Fund 树木基金会主席J. Eric Smith 先生Ravensbourne University 大学董事会主席Jonathan Drori 先生英国爱丁堡植物园图书馆奥地利Botanic Garden Meise 图书馆芬兰赫尔辛基大学H L Mikael Fortelius 教授克罗地亚环保署专家组组长Ana Strbenac 女士...... 预订款项请汇至：支付宝/微信：13388607204 沈建明工行：621226 1202046016599 沈建明务请将收货地址告知，单本默认物流为邮局印刷品挂号，海外由代理配送，海外赠品需集中起来寄，可能花费时日。赠送作品（见后），在标明尺寸以内，（因底片老化，无法再扫描）可设其它尺寸，用微喷工艺打印，每幅限量500 张，每张签名编号。
关于作者沈建明, 英语82 级，先后师从建筑教育家柳士英之子，城乡规划专家柳道平先生及国画大师潘天寿的高徒于广明先生，从事专业摄影二十年。作品在新西兰的Canterbury 博物馆，举行过为期两个半月的展览，深受好评。准备捐赠广外一批此画册。广外回忆录链接https://pan.baidu.com/s/1ID44s7_tMmBxaOGlClopsQ在校时, 作文经常被老师选读；100 米测试跑25 秒，体育从来没及格过，每次都补考，每次都投篮，每次都是投10 个中9 个，最后1 个进去了反胃冒出来，弧形空心球，篮球只接触篮网......531433590@qq.com， 0571-8595.3073， 133.8860.7204杭州市西湖区留下镇外东穆坞13 号南3 栋 邮编310023 部分画册页面部分书稿内容链接：https://pan.baidu.com/s/1W0QKMXDegpdlJ1ARHbFMBA 赠送作品任选一幅买一送一， 或预定7 本，赠送作品任选一幅，在标明尺寸以内，（因底片老化，无法再扫描）可设其它尺寸，用微喷工艺打印。 以下尺寸为18x 12 in 寸，47.5x 31.7 cm 厘米          以下尺寸为 11 x 8 in 寸，  29 x 19 cm 厘米   以下尺寸 10 x 8 in 寸， 25.4 x 20.3 cm 厘米                 我们都身不由己，在红尘中苟且，又坚守着那一丁点脆如薄冰的理想。  田野里飞来很多小鸟， 它们长着白色的翅膀， 是来自外星的精灵， 也是水彩的题材。以下图经电脑优化而成。以下尺寸为16 x 11in 寸， 42 x 28 cm 厘米             上述图片也可以通过百度网盘下载：https://pan.baidu.com/s/1wwMKVNTZQDO7dqivt4mPVw--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 这是我3年前众筹的内容： GreetingsGreetings from ancient homeland of ginkgo, a botanical utopia located in grand mountain ranges in east China. In 1989, at Yi Ma Formation of Henan province（河南省义马煤矿）, China, a team of paleontologists led by Ziyan Zhou (周志炎) (Prof. Zhou is the academic advisor of this book) and Bole Zhang (章伯乐) unearthed some ginkgo fossils, that they later traced back 170 million years--the oldest ginkgo fossils found to date.I am Jimmy Shen (沈建明), a professional photographer, brought up at the foot of the TianMu Mountains(天目山), where wild ginkgos have been existing for hundreds of millions of years.I learned my craft through apprenticeship to an outstanding disciple of the late master Chinese painter Shoutian Pan (潘天寿). My works have been published and exhibited internationally. Why I Created this BookGod created the earth, where dinosaurs and ginkgos flourished. After the biological mass extinction 65 million years ago, plus the Quaternary glaciers which swept across the planet 2 million years ago, most forms of animals and plants disappeared. One species of ginkgo tree survived in sheltered mountainous areas in east China. I am lucky enough to be a native.The purpose of this book is to promote public awareness towards ginkgo, linked to the primitive nature. Discover and share wonders of Nature.The oldest ginkgo in the West (in Netherlands) is less than 300 years old, while there are some ginkgos in China over 3,000 years old. Here is one over 1,500 years old, situated at the top of Wuyun Mountain, Hangzhou, China.So Many Stories about GinkgoI recall a treat of my childhood, after my mother cooked rice with wood, I used to throw ginkgo nuts into these hot ashes, and after a short while the nuts cracked like a song, they were delicious. Tell You a Secret--How Male and Female Ginkgos Date:We all know male and female ginkgos are separate trees. There are no bees involved as go-betweens. In spring, pollen cones grow on male trees while the ovule develops on the females. Carried by the wind, pollen travels miles across hills and rivers, meanwhile the ovule sends out a drop of liquid on the top to catch pollen passing by.After meeting, the drop retreats and leads the way for pollen to settle down in the growing pollen tube, where sperms develop. Later in autumn matured sperms leave the tube and swim to the egg, which is developed in the ovule, making the actual fertilization to produce an embryo.Due to the environment blessed with so many ginkgos, folks usually live long lives. This 102-year-old great-great-grandma often wins money when playing Mahjong (麻将) with others. Lots more fascinating stories like:--A 2,000-year-old ginkgo transformed into a smart scholar, he got an engagement with the princess... 银杏变秀才，皇帝找驸马--An old tomb under a 1000-year-old ginkgo...古银杏树下惊现古墓--With a couple ginkgos, the dying female (wife) saved the male ginkgo (husband) magically...危难关头，雌树银杏（妻子）舍身救雄树（丈夫）...While designing the book, ginkgo lent me a lot of inspiration. In fact, I imitate a lot of its characteristics, that’s clear, straightforward, and graceful (I wish).I got invaluable help from a lot of professionals, Australian Chinese bilingual poet Sherry Chan （陈尚慧） contributed the translation of ancient Chinese poems into English, Dr. Yusheng (Christopher) Liu (刘裕生教授),Tenured Professor of Botany at Prairie View A&M University, U.S.A., kindly edited the book. My old Canadian friend, Ernie Grimo, founding president in 1972 and recently re-elected President of the Society of Ontario Nut Growers, has always been a helping hand when in need at early stage of this book several years ago, and many more...Covering chapters like About Ginkgo, Oldest Ginkgos, Wonders, Poems, Folk Remedies, Symbols, Legends, Memorabilia, etc. The nearly 160 images are extracted from two decades’ work. English-Chinese bilingual edition, measurements: 26 x 25 cm, or 10.23 x 9.84 inches, hardcover, matte paper 200 g, about 192 pages, 1kg. List price will be US$37.99.All books are signed, both in English and in Chinese.  PDF Immerse yourself in the ginkgo story along with year-round scenes. Dig.This (13 mb) 180+ pages draft PDF contains 150+ images and stories. I reserve full editing rights, the final book may be slightly different. Will send the link for downloading to your email box within one week after claim.$7 Limited to 500 BackersFor a group of 4, each will have a PDF and 10 print cards (4 x 6 inch) of a set of total 40 ginkgo images, covering most important images of ginkgo, including pollen, ovule, year round scenes. Packed in a box, sent to one address.For those not in a group, I will group them and pick one at random from every 4 backers, the lucky one will have a book. To be delivered Mar, 2017.Please inform me your shipping address as well. I will post names of these lucky people in the above UPDATES tab in the first week after this campaign ends, besides notifying you by email.$10 For a group of 3, each will have a PDF, and the group will have a book, sent to one address. For those not in a group, I will group them and pick one at random from every 3 backers, the lucky one will have a book.Please inform me your shipping address as well. I will post names of these lucky people in the above UPDATES tab in the first week after this campaign ends, besides notifying you by email. BookPrinted in China. While browsing quality picture books in a fine bookstore, you may often come across books which state Printed in China on the copyright page, I usually buy a lot of sample books from these printing houses, which cooperate with Western publishers. Actually, for me, they are a good source to study book design. And this book is to be printed at one of these printing houses. Besides, I can always test on the spot before the final production.$29 for One Copy + PDF​Besides 20% off list price US$37.99, you are the first to read the book. Leaf through these pages, encounter wonders, along with stories and year-round scenes. For PDF, please refer to the above draft PDF perk. $99 for 4 copies + PDF​;$990 for 50 Copies + PDF​;Ideal for resell at garden stores, centers...$1700 for 100 Copies + PDF​Ideal for resell at garden stores, centers...You could be my agent in your continent. I will forward a big parcel containing individual small parcels, you would distribute to the individuals respectively at my cost. And you will lead a delegation of ginkgo lovers to tour ancient ginkgo forests. There are a lot of ginkgo related products, like ginkgo nuts wine, ginkgo leaves pillows, ginkgo nuts powders, etc. Together with some museums, we would hold a grand exhibition. (银杏嘉年华)  Posters 8 x 10 inch images printed on 11 x 14 inch hard sheet paper, either to be framed or to be tacked on walls direct. You have your own gallery of ginkgo.Even you can make your own calendar with these posters. There are posters with 0.8 inch longer, that's 11.8 x 14 inch. On the back there are blank squares to fill the date of the month. And all these 30/50 images are horizontal, with which you can make 2-3 years of calendars without repeat of scenery. $50 for a set of 30 posters, $60 for Calendar set of 30 posters;$70 for a set of 50 posters, $80 for Calendar set of 50 posters Calendars11.8 x 14 inch, 13 pagesBring home a touch of the original nature. The 13 pictures are carefully selected and ordered to reflect the changing seasons. In your language and main holidays included.Please specify which country calendar you order. Kindly note that to guarantee the quality, a minimum quantity of 200 copies for a specific language/country is needed. There are alternative digital solutions, the quality is a bit less ideal. So please shout out in your social media, and I will update the accumulating figure in the UPDATE tab.   Please click one of the following links and get the digital calendar, for private perusal only.North America; UK; Australia; France; Germany; Arabian; Netherlands; Italy; Switzerland; Denmark; Sweden, Belgium, Croatia, more countries are coming.On line review may appear incorrect, downloaded files are flawless.Learn the story of ginkgo. Order 2 calendars, get a free PDF of the book.$​35 for 2 copies;$60 for 4 copies;​$600 for 50 copies, with your name or logo printed on the front page;$990 for 100 copies, with your name or logo printed on the front page;$​1,900 for one copy, printed on fine art archival paper, made to order, in your language, with holidays and personally customized events up to 30 remarks.  PrintsAll prints are open edition, signed fine art archival ink jet prints, which are reported not to fade for decades, size of 8 x 10-in, and prices are subject to change upon end of this campaign. A set of 30/50 prints includes pollen, ovule, year round scenes, meanwhile you get two free posters with information about ginkgo and about the photographer (these posters are not ink jet printed,)  Ideal for exhibition, a treat for nature/botany/ginkgo lovers. No tickets, pls. If you need my assistance or appearance, pls let me know.Packed in a box. Signed, matted, foam core backed, ready for standard 11 x 14-in frames. Each print is protected by a glassine to the face. $50 for One + PDF;$1,300 for a Set of 30 + PDF;$2,000 for a Set of 50 + PDF TourHomeland of ginkgo, a mecca for nature lovers. Roam ancient ginkgo forests. Dance with falling leaves. Includes meals, lodging, transportation, tour at a ginkgo village, and a ginkgo products factory. International airfare not included. City tours may add up.$10 Reservation of your adventure next year by order of a book PDF. Seems that we have had too much rain here in the TianMu Shan Mountains these months, this year ginkgos here are not so glorious as they should.$1,900 for 1 Week TourPDF + 3 BOOKS + ONE WEEK'S TOUR IN LAND OF GINKGO, my friends or I will be the guide in and around the Tianmu Mountains, or other ginkgo villages. Be a part of this land of wonders. For PDF, please refer to the above PDF perk. (Families or friends want to come too? Contact me, above.) Books will be sent Mar. 2017.$4900 for 10 Days' Tour + IN the Film, Limited to 10 BackersSPECIAL MENTION AT THE END OF THE FILM + PDF + 3 BOOKS + Tour in and around Tianmu Mountains. I will be the guide. I am planning to make a film/documentary (银杏大地纪录片). WALK INTO THE FILM AS FOREIGN TOURISTS. Like to deliver a speech? Maybe, yet to decide. One scene is a team of foreign tourists roam ancient ginkgo forests. Get ready to be a star. Books will be sent Mar. 2017. No Facebook, Twitter, Youtube Account?Non, I am an internet dummy, besides no access to them here in China. Please spread this campaign with your friends in your social media or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested.The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!Well, I have a linked-in account. You could also leave a message on my linked-in:https://cn.linkedin.com/in/ginkgo         My Initial Goal is $12kIf I hit 32k, there will be a slip case.If I hit 100k, there will be..., yet to decide, what is your opinion? Several ginkgo guest houses in the ginkgo village to receive ginkgo lovers around the world, including you. And there will be Chinese-German, Chinese-French and other languages editions, too. Get a Touch of the Original Nature See right if one of the perks fits you, or contact me if you have some other requests, or spread this campaign, please. Get a touch of the original nature, traced back hundreds of millions of years ago, when dinosaurs roamed the earth. (回归淳朴的自然)  What They Are Saying About'This manuscript offers a wonderful glimpse of the stately ginkgo from its origins in China. The author and photographer show adoration for this most ancient of trees. I was gifted a digital copy to peruse and shall cherish it. The images are touching and the prose poetic. Love the history and folk lore as well as popular references. A wonderful tribute to tree we have only sparingly planted in Nova Scotian cities and towns.'--Ms. Marian Munro, Curator of Botany, Nova Scotia Museum, Canada-----------------------------------------------------‘I also showed it to our librarian, and we both agree that the photography and design are stunning. It is a very lyrical combination of imagery, poetry and information about the treasured ginkgos in China.’--Ms. Lugene B. Bruno, Curator of Art & Senior Research Scholar, Hunt Institute for Botanical Documentation, Carnegie Mellon University, U.S.A---------------------------------------------------- ‘This is a beautiful book about a beautiful and intriguing plant. The photographs and stories are inspiring, and add to our enjoyment of the fascinating ginkgo. Jimmy Shen has created a work of art and science!’--Tim Entwisle, Professor, Director and Chief Executive of Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria, Australia‘Your exploration of Ginkgo biloba and the relationship between Chinese people and this remarkable tree through outstanding photographs, careful documentation and poetry is very important. You beautifully illustrate the interconnections between beauty and utility in this enduring relationship. The nature of this relationship over thousands of years is important for our understanding of a sustainable future. This is an important quest for you to continue.’--Stephen Forbes, Director, Botanic Gardens of South Australia, Adelaide, Chair of the Council of Heads of Australian Botanic Gardens, Australia'I just LOVE your book about "everything Ginkgo!" You have creatively woven fact with story, technical language with poetry, and amazing legends with dry history. The visuals are extraordinary and truly inspiring to the senses.'Many thanks for sharing and I know this book will be a huge success once published.--Margaret (Meg) Lowman, Ph.D., Director of Global Initiatives/Lindsay Chair of Botany, Institute for Biodiversity Science and Sustainability, California Academy of Sciences, U.S.A.‘This is an amazing book that will find its way onto everyone's bookshelf who is interested in Ginkgos. It has fabulous images of Ginkgos in the wild and cultivation.’--Dr. Tony Kirkham, Head of the arboretum at the Royal Botanic Gardens Kew, United Kingdom-------------------------------------------------------‘Your excellent photographs of our living fossil Ginkgo biloba have brought elegance of the importance of this living fossil. Please promote your creative art to the whole world. We will keep your book in our library.’--Dr. Ratikanta Maiti,  Ph.D, D.Sc. Chairman, Int Conf on Bio-resource and Stress Management; Chief Editor - IJBSM; Ex Professor, UDLA, Mexico‘In this labor of love, Jimmy Shen has created a meticulously documented celebration of the majestic gingko and their enduring relation to culture and place. The volume leaves an impression of golden light filtered through autumn leaves.'--Susannah R. McCandless, PhD, International Program Director, Global Diversity Foundation, Co-organizer, Global Environments Summer Academy, USA-------------------------------------------------------‘It is an impressive compilation of information, anecdotes, medical remedies and even recipes from all over China. Some of the illustrations are quite spectacular! It must have taken considerable time and effort to gather all the information and photos from across the country. The book is a valuable resource for anyone wanting to know about Ginkgo and its long heritage. Great job!’--Prof. Stephen McLoughlin, Swedish Museum of Natural History, Sweden          ‘This is a beautiful and wonderfully complete body of work. I will take time to go through and read thoroughly, it truly deserves time to absorb and reflect. I would love to see this work being showcased in our garden and to be enjoyed by others who appreciate the nature and lore of ginkgo.’--Kevin Frediani, Inverewe Property Manager at the National Trust for Scotland, Honorary Lecturer Urban Agriculture, The University of Nottingham, U.K.Concerning your book, it is a delightful balance of art and information. I always love the Ginkgo for its beauty and place in natural history. I wish we were able to grow them in Florida but, alas it is not happy here. I did grow them in Michigan and enjoyed their ancient appeal. Your book really captured their mystique in a thought provoking and artistic manner. I will of course forward any interest your way as, alas as mentioned Florida does not see the tree grown this far south in the sub tropics.--Steven J. Royer, Professor, Palm Beach State College, U.S.A.----------------------------------------------------‘It is fascinating to learn more about the unique history of the ginkgos, as well as how they fit culturally in both artistic and botanical traditions in China. This was clearly a labor of love for you, and you should be applauded for a fine work . . . and for sharing it with others!!’-- J. Eric Smith, President and CEO, TREE Fund, U.S.A.----------------------------------‘The Ginkgo book looks beautiful and extremely interesting. Thanks so much for being the champion for conserving the amazing Ginkgo tree!’--Simon Stuart, Chair, Species Survival Commission, the International Union for Conservation of Nature----------------------------------‘That is a great book! The information on biology, ecology, history, lore, and uses is invaluable.’-- Christopher J. Earle, Senior Ecologist, www.conifers.org  Here are a Few Spreads...

story:
Thanks for visiting my campaign

I appreciate you taking the time to view this campaign. I'm Nathan, an American photographer working in the southern United States. I've been in this business for about eight years now and have a degree in digital photography. I have been privileged over the years to get to make many beautiful images, but now for the first time I'm taking a stab and doing this full-time. It has been my dream ever since I started exploring this field to be a full time nude photographer, and now I think I have an opportunity to make it my reality. 

My ultimate goal is to launch a Patreon for my nude work, a place where fans can find a full collection of my work online, as well as behind-the-scenes features, lighting and editing tutorials, prints, posters, wallpapers, and more. The content on my Patreon site will be full and varied: black and white nudes, full-color, art, glamour,steamy boudoir, cosplay and superheroes, and anything else that sparks my imagination. But before I can launch the Patreon, I've got to start making the content, which is the purpose of this campaign. I would like to launch with no fewer than eight full sets complete and ready to go, with at least two more in production at the time of launch, and I hope to launch by the end of the year. I could use some help meeting that goal.

I decided to do this for several reasons, the biggest and most important being because I love to shoot nudes, but there's more to it than just that. I have a gift and I intend to share it. Art isn't created in a vacuum, and it is meant to be shared with an audience. This will give me a perfect platform for doing that. I've gotten tired of being able to make the things that I can make and simply not being able to do it, whether it be from lack of time, locations, or money. This is an opportunity for me to do something different. To exercise autonomy, to put my time and effort into making things that are, first and foremost, creatively fulfilling, and secondly, my own and to my own benefit. It means living and creating on my terms.

Contributions to this campaign will help me do that. Art takes energy and passion and, unfortunately for most artists, it often takes money, too. If I can completely fund this campaign it will mean that I can throw myself fully into the creative process and not be constrained or hampered by lack of time, resources, or funding. That's huge. Ask any artist. Ask them what it's like when all the things they have restraining them are taken away and they can simply create. It leads to really powerful works of art. I'm going to do this one way or another, but with help from you I can do it much sooner, and that's what I'm asking for with this campaign. Help me get from where I am now to where I'm going. 

What's in it for contributors?

As you can see from the top of the page, my campaign goal is $7,000. Almost all of that money will go towards actually doing the photoshoots necessary to create my content. I already have most of the gear required to get this done, there are only two specific and relatively inexpensive pieces of gear that I'm looking to add. One is an Instax camera so that I can offer unique, one-of-a-kind instaprints to contributors to this campaign and future patrons, the other is a GoPro for doing behind-the-scenes videos of my shoots, which will be available as extras later on if I can get the funding. Everything else goes directly into the shoot budget, which breaks down into three areas: model fees, hair and makeup services, and location rental (when applicable). Full funding will allow me to create the eight sets I want to have in place at launch, as well as a few sets of additional post-launch content.

So what do you get if you contribute? Full details of the reward tiers are listed to the right, but everyone who donates gets access to all of the sets I shoot for this content ramp-up, everything I make to prepare for launch. What about post-launch content? Anyone who makes a contribution of $10 or more to help me get this initial content created gets access to everything I shoot, pre- and post-launch, for life. So that's not just the initial eight or so sets, but every set I shoot for  Patreon, at no extra charge, forever. Higher tier donors will also get things like prints, posters, behind-the-scenes content, and even tutorials for you photo enthusiasts out there. Check the reward tiers on the right for full details.

One of the great things about this type of project is that it doesn't have to reach full funding to get rolling. Even if I don't meet my total goal I can still start creating photos, sharing them with contributors, and preparing the site for launch. Everything goes into getting pictures and extra content made, and I can start sharing it out with contributors even before I launch my Patreon.

The Impact

Making photography can be funding-intensive, and the funding required can vary differently from shoot to shoot. I can expect to spend $500 minimum per shoot, and many times more than that. Going it alone will be slow, but I'll get it done. However, with your support I can work much faster and much more frequently, which will help me to maintain creative flow and put plenty of sexy art in your hands. I'm very excited by the prospect of spending the fall shooting and creating art, and if you would help me do that I would be so grateful.

When do we start?

Almost everything I need to achieve these goals is in place. I have the equipment, I have plenty of wonderful models ready to work, I live in an area with a wealth of great shooting locations. All that's missing is the funding to get it underway. I'm really looking forward to shooting my pictures and connecting with fans, sharing what I create, and seeing where all of this takes me. Please do become a donor, get yourself some cool rewards, and be a part of my creative process. If you've already made a contribution, or if you simply can't right now but want to see this project succeed, help me out by sharing it on social media. The bigger the audience I can reach the sooner I can start shooting. Do something kickass today and help me out.
story_txt:
Thanks for visiting my campaign
I appreciate you taking the time to view this campaign. I'm Nathan, an American photographer working in the southern United States. I've been in this business for about eight years now and have a degree in digital photography. I have been privileged over the years to get to make many beautiful images, but now for the first time I'm taking a stab and doing this full-time. It has been my dream ever since I started exploring this field to be a full time nude photographer, and now I think I have an opportunity to make it my reality. 
My ultimate goal is to launch a Patreon for my nude work, a place where fans can find a full collection of my work online, as well as behind-the-scenes features, lighting and editing tutorials, prints, posters, wallpapers, and more. The content on my Patreon site will be full and varied: black and white nudes, full-color, art, glamour,steamy boudoir, cosplay and superheroes, and anything else that sparks my imagination. But before I can launch the Patreon, I've got to start making the content, which is the purpose of this campaign. I would like to launch with no fewer than eight full sets complete and ready to go, with at least two more in production at the time of launch, and I hope to launch by the end of the year. I could use some help meeting that goal.
I decided to do this for several reasons, the biggest and most important being because I love to shoot nudes, but there's more to it than just that. I have a gift and I intend to share it. Art isn't created in a vacuum, and it is meant to be shared with an audience. This will give me a perfect platform for doing that. I've gotten tired of being able to make the things that I can make and simply not being able to do it, whether it be from lack of time, locations, or money. This is an opportunity for me to do something different. To exercise autonomy, to put my time and effort into making things that are, first and foremost, creatively fulfilling, and secondly, my own and to my own benefit. It means living and creating on my terms.
Contributions to this campaign will help me do that. Art takes energy and passion and, unfortunately for most artists, it often takes money, too. If I can completely fund this campaign it will mean that I can throw myself fully into the creative process and not be constrained or hampered by lack of time, resources, or funding. That's huge. Ask any artist. Ask them what it's like when all the things they have restraining them are taken away and they can simply create. It leads to really powerful works of art. I'm going to do this one way or another, but with help from you I can do it much sooner, and that's what I'm asking for with this campaign. Help me get from where I am now to where I'm going.

So that's not just the initial eight or so sets, but every set I shoot for  Patreon, at no extra charge, forever. Higher tier donors will also get things like prints, posters, behind-the-scenes content, and even tutorials for you photo enthusiasts out there. Check the reward tiers on the right for full details.

story:
What is the "Fortress Bulgaria" travel book?

The unique travel book presents 77 antique and medieval fortresses and Roman towns in Bulgaria, Southeast Europe. With detailed historical info and over 560 color photos, it will guide you through the epochs of the Middle Ages and Antiquity. In this book, you will discover unique travel destinations, amazing fortresses and antique towns, historical museums and breathtaking landscapes.

In addition to the book, you can get the unique travel map which includes short fortress descriptions, directions how to reach them and GPS coordinates. The map contains all 77 landmarks from the book plus 22 more small fortifications. Special QR code is implemented to help travelers reach the destination easily.

The book is already a bestseller in Bulgaria and won 2 awards:

By funding our campaign we will be able to translate the 400 pages book and map in English, publish it and ship it worldwide. The funding will also help us to improve the mobile app for the augmented reality and record more videos, which will be included in the book.

 

THE AUGMENTED REALITY EXPERIENCE

We have developed a mobile app (for Android and iOS) which uses augmented reality to make the travel guide much more interesting. It scans photos in the book, recognizes them and plays different videos from the tourist sites - aerial videos shot with drones and ground level videos. This is the first of its kind augmented reality travel guide!

Augmented reality experience demo:

By using the mobile app you will feel like you are there on the real place!

 

What can you expect to see in the book?

In this amazing book, you will find photos and historical info about Bulgaria and it's ancient medieval and antique fortresses and Roman towns. The book is 50% images and 50% text. It covers 77 amazing historic monuments which are related to different years in the history of the country - the ancient Thracians, Romans, Byzantines, Slavic, and Bulgarians. All photographs are made by professional landscape photographers.

Take a  brief look on some of the photos inside the book:

Panorama from the Ovech fortress.

Small cross on a chapel near the Kaliakra fortress, Cape Kaliakra, Black Sea

Part of the basilica from the fortress at Cape Saint Atanas, near Byala town, Black Sea

Ruins of the great antique Roman town - Nicopolis ad Istrum

The "Baba Vida" Fortress near the Danube river.

Medieval church in the Tsar Assen's fortress.

Old walls of the Anevsko Kale fortress.

Panoramic view of the great ancient Thracian town and fortress - PERPERIKON

 

Book Details:

Book Pages: 400 pages
Photos in the book: 560+ full-color images
Book Size: 160mm x 260mm (Landscape)
Soft Cover

 

Travel Map Details:

Scale: 1: 540 000
Map Size: 12.5 x 22.5 см

 

    THE PERKS:

    We're offering our book for pre-order purchase as well as numerous other perks at a discount. We will not offer these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so now's the time to order!
     

     

    		  

    PERK 1: "The Hastatus" [MAP]

    This perk includes the Travel Map only. On the map are marked all 77 fortresses and antique towns. In addition, there are 22 more historic fortifications to visit. The map includes a short description and directions to the sites, GPS coordinates.
    Get the map for only 10$!

     

    		  

    PERK 2: "The Princeps" [BOOK]

    This great perk includes only the Interactive Travel Book. All 77 tourist sites have detailed historic info, directions how to reach them, GPS coordinates, Breathtaking photographs. Most of them have Augmented Reality feature, which you can see with our free mobile app (for Android and iOS). Get the Book for 20$.

     

    		  

    PERK 3: "The Legionary" [BOOK+MAP]

    A perfect match: the Travel Map and the Interactive Travel Book. Get it for only 25$.  Everything you need to explore the amazing historical fortresses and Roman towns in Bulgaria. Best Choice!

     

    		 

    PERK 4:  "The TSAR"  [BOOK+MAP] x 2

    If you want to have this unique book and also want to surprise a friend or a family member - this is your choice. The perk includes 4 items: 2 Interactive Travel Books + 2 maps. 
    Get this perk for only 40 $.


    The Impact

    The main goal of our campaign is to present more tourist information about Bulgaria. With our book, we will promote tourism in our country. 

     

    Where your money will go:

    All money raised in this campaign will go towards the following:

    • The actual printing costs for 1,000 copies of the book
    • Costs for English translation
    • Final mobile app development, record, and edit of the videos
    • The cost of fulfilling perks (packaging, shipping)
    • Indiegogo fees

    We will do our best to send the rewards to you at the estimated time - October 2017 or earlier. If there are delays in production I will promptly inform you.

    Due to the many pages - 400, and the complexity of the project, we will need at least 8600$ to start production. If we do not reach the full amount needed to finalize the project we will not be able to translate, publish and deliver the book. 

     

    Other ways you can help - Share!

    Last, but certainly not least, we understand that it's not possible for everyone to donate, so we'd appreciate you sharing this campaign with your friends, family and on social media. We feel that sharing is just as valuable as monetary contributions.

     

    Thank you for your support!

    Contact Us/Learn More:

    Our email: info@travelbooks.bg
    Our books website: www.travelbooks.bg

story:
I’m in an altered state in the midst of bizarre earth forms: in hoodoo-populated badlands, on rock beaches, standing over breathtaking canyons, exploring the tafoni on the California coast, wandering in sandstone wonderlands—I’ve actively sought such places out around the world.

Fortunately, I know my way around my camera, and the kind of light I’m looking for, so I manage to express my wonder and amazement in photographic art. Actually, I've been doing photography since 1960 and been a professional since 2002, with many gallery shows and publications to my credit.

I've finally compiled my best images of earth forms into my dream book. It’s big: 12x12-inch hard cover, 120 pages with four fold-out panoramas. This book collects photos from the most amazing geological sites in Wales, Newfoundland, Arizona, the Dakotas, California, Alaska, New Mexico, Idaho, Utah, Colorado, Wyoming, Cappadocia (Turkey), Jordan, Madagascar, Tibet, Mongolia, Vietnam, Italy, Iceland, and Ireland. 

The Earth is a continuous wonder for me and has been all my life (through two other professions, academia and jazz piano). One of my missions is to spread appreciation of the spectacular lesser known treasures of the planet. I want more people to travel to see these natural wonders and to appreciate the small scale as well as the large scale ones, and to be willing to explore on their own, outside of organized tours, and make their own discoveries (even right around the corner).

And I want this love, admiration, respect and awe for our planet to fuel our efforts to preserve her for future generations—and preserve us, too. This often means opposing extractive or development projects undertaken for large profits that damage the environment.

Now, the people who are on the cutting edge of this preservation effort and frequently in conflict with the developers are often indigenous peoples around the world. Although they make up only about 22% of the world’s population, they watch over 85% of its environmental diversity. The most dramatic recent confrontation has been at the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota starting in November 2016. Along with millions of others, I was deeply moved by the courage of the Water Protectors, who peacefully protested, standing up up to the state militia and private military contractors who branded them “jihadist terrorists” and attacked them mercilessly. They were arrested en masse for their trouble, and now the Lakota People’s Law Project, run by the Romero Institute, a public interest non-profit out of Santa Cruz, CA, has undertaken to defend them and to dispel the lies that framed them by simply bringing out the truth. The director of the Romero Institute, public-interest super-lawyer Daniel Sheehan, has contributed an extended essay that tells the whole story of the Water Protectors and the mendacity of the oil company. Lakota lawyer Chase Iron Eyes has contributed a powerful poem; NY Times photography critic Lyle Rexer evaluates the originality of my work; and British science writer John Farndon contributes a powerful appeal to support environmental causes—since our life depends on them—and the Water Protectors in particular, suggesting that the images in the book will help inspire us to do so.

I will be donating about a third of funds raised to create the book, minus administrative costs, to defend the Water Protectors. Danny Sheehan is confident that the power of truth will prevail against money and bought political power, so a contribution to their defense will most likely bring very tangible results in the struggle. Their vindication of the Water Protectors will be a major step in the preservation of the integrity of the Earth and the fight against climate change.

A contribution of $35 plus shipping gets you this beautiful book,  and $10 of that supports the Water Protectors' legal defense fund (the Lakota People's Law Project) at the same time, thereby helping to preserve the Earth that is celebrated in the book.

A larger contribution can get you breathtaking art prints to beautify your space and share some of my altered state whenever you contemplate them.

I’m setting my goal at $20,000, since that’s the minimum of what I’d need to have the first 1000 copies printed. If I exceed the goal in this 30-day campaign, then I can begin to fulfill my pledge to the Lakota People’s Law Project. If not, then I’ll do that through sales after the campaign ends.

My largest project before this one was an encyclopedic CD-ROM on the history of jazz piano, featuring the great multi-stylist, Dick Hyman (b. 1927). It came out in 1999 and sold worldwide (and the NY Times named it one of the 13 best CD-ROMs of that year). Before that, I got my PhD in comparative literature at Brown, and after that I curated a 325-work show featuring 125 photographers in 2007 at the Williamsburg Art and Historical Center in Brooklyn. Called “Sun Pictures to Mega-Pixels.” It featured original photographic processes, mostly from before and after the standard silver-gelatin process. So I have some experience in large-scale original art projects. (The CD-ROM catalogue is still available for $20, including shipping).

So if you love photography that shows what you've never seen before, if you’re fascinated by earth forms, if you like to be amazed and surprised by the natural world, if you love to get lost in photo art books that make you dream and take you on vicarious journeys, if you feel that it’s urgent to work to limit our fossil fuel consumption and prevent climate change, if you support the rights of indigenous people to live unmolested in integrity with their environment, if you believe we have much to learn from both the spirituality and sustainability strategies of Native peoples, then you will probably really enjoy this book.

I’ve also include a geological time scale with page reference numbers to each of the land form subjects depicted in the book, as well as an explanation of the geological origins of each formation in the end next to a thumbnail of the image.

To see a sample of of the book, go here. (Make the screen image as large as you can to be able to read the essays).

story:
UPDATE:

I made the mistake to not create enough buzz before I started this campaign. I will try to publish the book next year. If you want to be notified when I maybe achieve this, drop me a message to info@tinozimmermann.com and will get back to you :-)

Thank you :-)

 

Short Summary

I started taking photos when I had a psychosis, a serious mental condition one usually doesn't recover from. In my case it was partly caused by drugs. I got involved with drugs very early - around the age of 12 - and things went downhill from there.

With 21 I turned myself in to the psychiatric hospital and the prospects they gave were basically life-long medication. I didn't want that and left the hospital against the doctors recommendation.

Living back with my parents in the same small town I grew up in, I couldn't work a job but needed something to do and by chance I started taking photos with an old camera a friend had gifted me.

The following years I obsessed myself with taking photos and reading about photography as it helped me to cope with my condition. In 2016 I got accepted for studying photography, which was a huge achievement for me, and there I started to sort and edit the huge archive of photos I had taken over the last years. The idea to make a book out of it started to grow upon me and so I spent the last 3 years doing that.

Book Specifications:

456 Pages, 632 Images, Text. Hardcover, Sewn Binding, High Quality Printing

Dimensions: approx 32 x 21 x 4 cm (DIN A4), weight approx 1,6 kg.

The book itself is a reflection about growing up, about raising and supporting children, about learning photography and about change.

You can find an in-depth description and more details below.

What I Need & What You Get

To realize this book in a small edition of around 300 copies I need around 15.000 € to cover the costs of printing, shipping and distributing, which is an insane amount of money to me. 

I don't want to accept any donations, I just want people who are into this kind of art/photography to get a really good book which they can look at often and maybe get inspired by frequently. I wanted this book to have the quality of a huge collections of prints, so the print quality is quite good and the feel of the book is like huge photo-album.

Below, there is also a full video of the complete book.

More Details About the Book and this Projects Background

 

                                                                                                                                                              (Page 6-7)

I grew up in Germanys least populated region, in a small town in former East-Germany, shortly after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

I had actually a really good childhood but around the age of 11 or 12 I made first contact with drugs and things went downhill from there.

 

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 86-87)

When I had a psychosis, with 21, I tried to recover from it and by chance I started getting into photography. I buried myself with trying out every aspect of it and learning about it. I bought and sold used cameras off of ebay with the little money I had and even build my own cameras.

I looked for good photographers but couldn't find much that appealed me so I spent most of my time on Flickr, looking at other amateur photographers work.

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 100-101)

 

                                                                                                                                                     (Page 122-123)

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 128-129)

                                                                                                                                                            (Page 134-135)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 166-167)

 

                                                                                                                                                        (Page 190-191)

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 224-225)

                                                                                                                                                       (Page 252-253)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 256-257)

                                                                                                                                                        (Page 282-283)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 294-295)

                                                                                                                                                    (Page 382-383)

                                                                                                                                                    (Page 442-443)

 

               

                                 (Full Video of the Book)

About Me

My Name is Tino Zimmermann and since last year I'm studying Art at the Academy of Arts in Karlsruhe, Germany. Before that, I briefly studied Photography (for 2 years) and before that I didn't do much except trying to recover from my, let's call it, 'unlucky youth'.

I spend the last 3 years working on this book and it's an incredible feeling that this is finally done. I want to become an artist and this is kind of like my first work so I would be happy if you support me and get yourself a copy.

I won't be making a huge profit off this, the whole thing is actually more about putting a very unique type of book out there. I decided to make this book as good as it gets, no matter how long that might take. Professional publishers have to cut costs everywhere and things like print quality tend to suffer from that. I am self publishing and distributing it because I want to avoid these things.

The Impact

A photo book is not the best medium to raise awareness on topics because it is kind of niche product but I think that this book might change the way you look at your children growing up and following their passions, even if it seems like it is about an entirely different topic.

Risks & Challenges

There's not much risk involved. When the campaign is over I will look at how much has been raised and look if the book can go into production regardless. Even if the funding goal hasn't been met fully, it might still enable me to get a credit from my bank to fund the production. And if everything fails, you'll simply get your money back and a 'thank you' nontheless.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know people who are into this kind of photography/art/book-style, it would be huge help to me if you recommend my work and maybe encourage them to support this project.

I don't expect much over all but sometimes little miracles happen.

Thank you!! :-)

Please Note: I thought of almost everything but I didn't realize that indiegogo only accepts credit card payments. If you would like to pre-order a copy and pay with PayPal, SOFORT, or other payment processors, please head over to:  https://tinozimmermann.com/produkt/developments... and get it there. I know this involves a lot of trust but you can be sure that for the unlikely case this project doesn't get realized, you'll get a full refund. Thank you so much!!
story_txt:
UPDATE:
I made the mistake to not create enough buzz before I started this campaign. I will try to publish the book next year. If you want to be notified when I maybe achieve this, drop me a message to info@tinozimmermann.com and will get back to you :-)
Thank you :-)
 
Short Summary
I started taking photos when I had a psychosis, a serious mental condition one usually doesn't recover from. In my case it was partly caused by drugs. I got involved with drugs very early - around the age of 12 - and things went downhill from there.
With 21 I turned myself in to the psychiatric hospital and the prospects they gave were basically life-long medication. I didn't want that and left the hospital against the doctors recommendation.
Living back with my parents in the same small town I grew up in, I couldn't work a job but needed something to do and by chance I started taking photos with an old camera a friend had gifted me.
The following years I obsessed myself with taking photos and reading about photography as it helped me to cope with my condition. In 2016 I got accepted for studying photography, which was a huge achievement for me, and there I started to sort and edit the huge archive of photos I had taken over the last years. The idea to make a book out of it started to grow upon me and so I spent the last 3 years doing that.
Book Specifications:
456 Pages, 632 Images, Text. Hardcover, Sewn Binding, High Quality Printing
Dimensions: approx 32 x 21 x 4 cm (DIN A4), weight approx 1,6 kg.
The book itself is a reflection about growing up, about raising and supporting children, about learning photography and about change.
You can find an in-depth description and more details below.

What I Need & What You Get
To realize this book in a small edition of around 300 copies I need around 15.000 € to cover the costs of printing, shipping and distributing, which is an insane amount of money to me. 
I don't want to accept any donations, I just want people who are into this kind of art/photography to get a really good book which they can look at often and maybe get inspired by frequently. I wanted this book to have the quality of a huge collections of prints, so the print quality is quite good and the feel of the book is like huge photo-album.
Below, there is also a full video of the complete book.

More Details About the Book and this Projects Background
 

                                                                                                                                                              (Page 6-7)

                                                                                                                                                     (Page 122-123)

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 128-129)

                                                                                                                                                            (Page 134-135)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 166-167)

 
                                                                                                                                                        (Page 190-191)

                                                                                                                                                         (Page 224-225)

                                                                                                                                                       (Page 252-253)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 256-257)

                                                                                                                                                        (Page 282-283)

                                                                                                                                                           (Page 294-295)

                                                                                                                                                    (Page 382-383)

                                                                                                                                                    (Page 442-443)

story:
http://romanovapictures.store

Hi world!

I’m Nadia Romanova, photographer and graphic designer. I’m a Modern Art and Nature lover, born in Lithuania, so have spent lots of time near the Baltic sea. One day I realised that the surrounding Nature creates pure Art  and often better than Art created by humans. Since I’m a photographer, I'm started to capture it with my camera before it disappears. Mother Nature is the greatest artist and creates infinite works of art in various styles and techniques. It can be abstract, minimalist, surrealism etc. All I needed was to see it and put it into a frame. So was born my first image collection of Nature Art “Sea and Sand games”. I printed some pictures on canvas for my apartment and visiting friends started asking me to make pictures for them too, to help refresh their houses and offices. Later I made the site romanovapictures.com to make it for them to choose pictures for their interiors. Today I’m happy to present you with some pictures from my Nature Art collections. I want to share with world the works of art created by the biggest Artist – Nature itself. I would be happy if you would support my project and add artworks created by our beautiful Earth to your interiors.

Choose your picture

Enjoy 17 artworks created by Nature, presented in different shapes and proportions to fit various interiors.Choose yours from the limited edition of 300 pictures. Maybe I'm a dreamer, but... if I reach the limit of pictures - I'll add extra images here for you! Now you can see them on my site.

High quality detailed prints

Choose size and medium

Pictures can be printed in two ways and sizes:

1. NATURAL CANVAS prepared for gallery wrapping with added edges +4cm on each side with reflected image for continuous seamless look.

2. FINE ART PAPER POSTER with added white edges +4 cm on each side - for you to decide to leave them for framing or cut off.

BIGGER OR SMALLER  each picture is availaible in two sizes. It's determined by shipping costs, to make it worldwide free. If you need bigger - please write me. And that's why in this project I send pictures only, without wooden frames for canvas to gallery wraps.

Square:

80x80cm + 4cm each side (whole 88x88cm)

40x40cm + 4cm each side (whole 48x48cm)

Vertical and horizontal:

80x100 + 4cm each side (whole 88x108cm)

40x50cm + 4cm each side (whole 48x58cm)

 All pictures are limited edition of 300 each, signed and numbered by hand.

Where will money go?

1. To share Art by our beautiful Nature further and louder and make an expo.

2. To add e-store to my site www.romanovapictures.com to make people comfortable buy pictures for their interiors. Because now they have to drop me a mail with name of picture and wanted size and medium. So lets simplify it!

3. To upgrade my photo equipment  to catch more creations of Nature better and better.

4. I'm planning upcoming new big projects with Art by Nature and hope you will soon see them here. And it requires a lot of investments to make them come true.

5. To jump all over the world and find beautiful art of different places. Thats why I want to buy lowcosters one year travelcard and abonement to hostels :)

 

Risks & Challenges

What could be risks and challenges of this project? Hmmm...let's see.. Canvas and paper are bought and stocked, printer is loaded by water-based ecosolvent inks, turned on and ready, package tubes are waiting in a post and seems no articles about upcoming postmen strikes in newspapers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any support is highly appreciated! Please share if you like what you see.

BIG Thank You!
