story:
WE ALL WANT THOSE NATURAL SHOTS

Do you  photograph children? Has it ever been challenging getting natural poses of a client who isn’t used to being in front of the camera? Has a photography session with a child ever taken longer than planned?

Imagine what our MOCK the POSE app would mean not only to school photos, kindergarten and daycare photos, but to every single family shoot, including children’s birthday photos.

We have come up with an exciting, new tool to make sure your photos of children turn out amazing every time. Children will look natural, parents will love the photos, and photographing children will instantly become easier for you!

We need your help.

This is a win-win. Photographing becomes easier for you and we get to make this happen thanks to you!

LIVE VIDEO GUIDE DURING THE SESSION?

Yes, because for children it's easier and more fun to mimic each other. Children are used to interacting with screens and relate well to other children. Mock the Pose feels like a fun game!

This is a  Posing Guide for kids, starring kids! The Mock the Pose app is the solution to get shy or not so motivated children to easily cooperate!

GET READY TO HAVE FUN PHOTOGRAPHING CHILDREN!

NOT ONLY A CREATIVE SOURCE BUT A GENUINELY HELPFUL TOOL!

Between each pose there are pauses long enough for you to verbally fine tune the pose and give additional instructions if needed. For teens or for the less shy kids, you can find the poses in slideshow versions!

Multilingual

The first posing guide for photographing children will be available in English. Multilingual posing guides will be available in 2018.

Versions

Collection 1.  POSING GUIDE FOR PHOTOGRAPHING CHILDREN

Collection 2.  POSING GUIDE FOR PHOTOGRAPHING ADULTS & COUPLES

                         (COMING  IN  2018)

Pre-order the Posing Guide AT THE LOWEST PRICE!

  • $15  Indiegogo Exclusive Pricing: you not only support the project but you will get the fully functioning Posing Guide for Children in English!
  • $25 price: you not only support us make it happen, but also you will receive the Posing Guide for Children and later on in 2018 the Posing Guides for Adults!
  • $30 price: you support our project and get the Posing Guide for Children and later on in 2018 the Posing Guides for Adults + 5 wonderful digital backdrops for composites! Scroll down to see the 5 backdrops! $90 value!!

SHARE THE PROJECT!

PHOTOGRAPHERS, WE ARE COUNTING ON YOU! HELP US TO BUILD THIS NEW USEFUL TOOL! Please share this project with your photographer friends!

OUR TEAM

 

 

 

Don't worry if you can't contribute, you can still help!

Please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

GET READY TO HAVE FUN PHOTOGRAPHING CHILDREN!

 

These are the gift Digital Backdrops of the $30 special deal for the ultimate WOW factor! If you are a Family & Newborn Photographer, this package is just perfect for you! These beautiful digital backdrops are made for newborn composites! All five high-resolution images are captured with Canon 6D.  If you purchase the $30 deal, the backdrops will be sent to you by email inside 72 hours!

HELP US TO GET THE WORD OUT - SHARE OUR PROJECT!

GET READY TO HAVE FUN PHOTOGRAPHING CHILDREN! These are the gift Digital Backdrops of the $30 special deal for the ultimate WOW factor! If you are a Family & Newborn Photographer, this package is just perfect for you! These beautiful digital backdrops are made for newborn composites! All five high-resolution images are captured with Canon 6D.  If you purchase the $30 deal, the backdrops will be sent to you by email inside 72 hours!HELP US TO GET THE WORD OUT - SHARE OUR PROJECT!

story:
Indonesian experience  

Welcome to this fundraising page of my first ever photo book - "The Land".

My name is Stanislav Strilets, and I am a professional photographer and journalist from Ukraine. 

Last 2 years I've spent in Indonesia, learning batik, traditional painting, and crafts in both Java and Bali. Living in Indonesia made a huge impact on my professional life. Being a student at the Institute of Arts, I had a great opportunity to explore the traditional life and farming process of Javanese farmers. During my field studies, I faced a complicated universe, consisting of deep philosophy, authentic methods of labor and vast knowledge of the natural environment. Still being away from the influence of civilization, Javanese farmers follow animistic cults and consider the Land as a sacred gift of the Universe.

The main driving force of this photo-book is an interest in a unique connection with Mother Nature and a human being. I have found photography to be the perfect gateway to discover peculiarities and what makes Javanese land and its people exclusive. Through my months-long journey and a significant number of travels, I did my best to illustrate the special traditions and rituals of harvesting that are still alive in remote parts of Java, Indonesia.

  Why it is important to publish a book

Currently, peasants of Central Java face lots of challenges: climate changes, the rapid increase in population, the usage of modern cultivating techniques. Virgin, almost untouched world of rural Java will disappear in a few decades. On the pages of "The Land" photobook, we can see, probably, the last generation of farmers, who use ancient calendars, wear traditional dresses and treat the land as a living being. By printing and distributing the book we can preserve this extraordinary culture and lifestyle for the next generations. 

Personally, for me, this project plays a vital role as a giving back to a beautiful country, where I lived and professionally thrived for several years. In this way, by creating and publishing The Land photobook, I say big “Thank you” to the authentic land of Central Java. 

YOU can help ME make this dream come true!

 

What We Need 

Your backing will help me to cover the following expenditures:

  • Printing - 2200$ 

  • Superb paper & print quality

  •  Design, lay out and editing - 300$

  • Translation - 300$

    • Professional proofreading and translation (Ukrainian to English)

  • Packaging, marketing, operating costs - 400$

The book will be printed in October 2018 and in November 2018 it will be ready for shipping

 

 What You Get

"The Land"  is going to be an exclusive, hardcover photobook of 145 pages. It will feature the excellent selection of more than 160 full-color high-quality pictures following the by text in English and Ukrainian  Much attention will be given to the overall superior quality of the book: color correction, printing attributes, and paper characteristics.

The edition will be 200 best quality photobooks.

 

 

 Challenges

This is going to be self-published photo book and it is not the easiest process.

Yet we are ready to Bring It On!

To provide you with the best quality images and the book just like I want and imagine, our team really need your help. We are ready to commit money and a lot of effort, yet without your support, it would be nearly impossible. If we will be successful and will raise the appropriate amount,  the incredible spirit of rural Java will be revealed to the whole world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If at this stage, you can’t afford to help us financially you can still help our project!  Please, share and spread this campaign on social media and tell about it to your friends & family. Thank you very much!

You can follow us on the Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/The.Land.photobook

Follow my page on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/stanislav.strilets/

story:
ご挨拶

こんにちは！！

生まれて此の方ずっと北海道に住んでいるものです。

 

北海道のあらゆる場所を周り北海道を熟知しているものだからこそ撮れる景色があると考えます。

 

私が皆様が知らない北海道をお届けできればと思います。

 

1年プロジェクトなので、支援者様が北海道の四季を感じることができる写真を撮ります。

 

Hello! !!

I was born and have lived in Hokkaido for a long time.

 

I think that there are scenery that can be taken because you are familiar with Hokkaido around every place in Hokkaido.

 

I would like to deliver Hokkaido that you do not know.

 

Since this is a one-year project, we will take pictures that supporters can feel the four seasons of Hokkaido.

 

プロジェクトを立ち上げた理由

「北海道に行ってみたいけどなかなか日本に旅行することができない。」

「コロナ禍の影響で諦めた北海道旅行・・・」

 

そんな方々のために１年間かけて北海道の様々な場所に行き写真を撮りプレゼントしようと思いつきました！！

 

食の文化や、景色・・・様々な点で北海道の素晴らしさを画像を通して伝えることができると確信しております。

 

"I want to go to Hokkaido, but I can't easily travel to Japan."

"A trip to Hokkaido that I gave up because of the corona wreck ..."

 

I came up with the idea of going to various places in Hokkaido for a year to take pictures and give them as gifts! !!

 

We are confident that we can convey the splendor of Hokkaido in various ways, such as food culture and scenery.

 

これまでの活動

・登山経験

・北海道一周

 

・ Climbing experience

・ Around Hokkaido

 

資金の使い道

 

写真を撮る場所にいくための資金として使用させていただきます。

 

We will use it as a fund to go to the place to take a picture.

 

実施スケジュール

 

2021年4月1日〜2022年3月31日まで

様々な場所に行き景色、食べ物の写真撮影

 

その後、終了次第メールにて画像受け取り方法を発信します。

 

From April 1, 2021 to March 31, 2022

Go to various places and take pictures of scenery and food

 

After that, as soon as it is finished, we will send you the image receiving method by e-mail.

 

リターンについて

 

北海道の景色の写真を１年間撮り貯め、支援者の皆様一人一人にメールで発信します。

 

春コース　50枚

夏コース　50枚

秋コース　50枚

冬コース　50枚

 

全部コース　200枚

 

支援者様全員に対して著作権フリーとします。

自由に使用していただいてOKです。

 

We will take pictures of the scenery of Hokkaido for one year and send them to each supporter by e-mail.

 

Spring course 50 sheets

Summer course 50 sheets

Autumn course 50 sheets

Winter course 50 sheets

 

All courses 200 sheets

 

Copyright-free for all supporters.

You can use it freely.

 

最後に

支援者様全員が幸せになるような北海道らしい写真をお届けするべくプロジェクトを立ち上げました。

 

北海道を感じられるように全力で写真を取らせていただきます。

 

支援のほどよろしくお願いします。

 

We have launched a project to deliver Hokkaido-like photos that will make all the supporters happy.

 

I will do my best to take pictures so that I can feel Hokkaido.

 

Thank you for your support.

I will do my best to take pictures so that I can feel Hokkaido.
 
Thank you for your support.

story:
Summary

I have spent much of my retirement traveling around south Texas photographing denizens of the "Brush Country", as we Texans call it.  This diverse region makes a home for hundreds of plants and animals, many that can be found nowhere else north of Mexico.

My hope is to share these images with others (especially children) so that they might be inspired to greater appreciation of the wild treasures all around us.

The first toe-in-the-water is the creation of a 2018 Wildlife Calendar using 13 of my recent nature photographs.  I have kept this campaign modest in both its goals and in its required funding.

Please read on to get a full understanding of what we can achieve together.

Present Status of the Project

The hard work of the project is complete.  The photography is done and the post processing of the images is finished.  A printing company has been selected and all the images have been resized to match the printer's guidelines. The complete calendar layout has been uploaded to the printing company and proofed and is ready for me to fill in the number of calendars that I need and click on the "Purchase" button.  Below, is a screen capture image of what the January Page will look like (of course the actual calendar will have much higher resolution).

I have included images that will appear on the cover (and for all the month-pages) at the end of this section.

Goals and Objectives

Goal:  My goal is to use my nature photography to gently nudge others toward a closer relationship with the wild animals and plants all around us.

Objective (1 - completed):  To select 13 images from my recent field work that present animals and plants in an up close and personal way.

Objective (2 - completed):  To select a high-quality printing company that specializes in calendars and prepare a prototype version of a 28-page 2018 calendar using the 13 wildlife images.

Objective (3 - completed):  To create a compelling Indiegogo campaign to raise the funds to have the calendar printed.  Of course whether the campaign is "compelling" will be measured by the level of funding provided by my backers.

Objective (4):  After the minimum funding level has been reached, to get the calendars in the hands of, and before the eyes of, my backers.

Objective (5):  To raise funding as far as possible above the minimum necessary to fulfill my obligation to the backers.  This extra funding will allow me to provide the calendars "free of charge" to many schools and libraries in my state.  Young people are the future and they are the individuals I most want to engage with my photography.

If these five objectives are completed successfully, much progress toward satisfying my goal will be assured.

What I Need & What You Get

I have calculated the cost of this project and established a break even point ($1600).  The break even point will be the fixed funding level target for this campaign.

As mentioned above, there are two groups I hope to reach and enrich with this campaign.  The backers are vital and without them the project will not go forward.  Even if just the funding target is reached, 200 calendars will be printed and provided to the backers as perks.  My hope is that the calendar's wildlife images will nudge their lives (and the lives of others that happen to flip through its pages) toward a deeper connection to the natural world.

If backers embrace the concept and provide funding over and above the minimum target level, then marvelous additional benefits will be possible.  I will be able to print more calendars and provide those to teachers, students, and libraries around Texas.  If only a few young people are inspired to connect with their natural environment and then help protect it through their actions, my efforts will be rewarded.

Note on Budget:

The 10% platform (and other) fees are the fees charged by Indiegogo and by credit card companies and PayPal.

The printing company advises me that the cost of printing varies (slightly) as the cost of paper, ink, and other commodities change.  I've added a 5% factor to anticipate such changes.

The management fee of $1.13 per calendar is my calculation of the combined costs of organizing and implementing the project.  These costs include transportation, utilities, and communications (phone, Internet, etc.).

 

Risks & Challenges

I do believe the proposed project is without high risk.  Sometimes unforeseen problems arise and those have to be solved.  I am a retired university physics and astronomy professor and a past director of a Texas A&M University Center.  I am used to facing and solving problems.  I have been successful at problem solving over the years and will bring my experience to bear if challenges do slow the progress toward my goal.

Other ways you can help

Please do alert your friends and relatives about this opportunity and ask them to become backers here at Indiegogo.  Help me get the word out through social media too.  Please consider increasing your support level (beyond just one calendar) and pick a perk that offers five or 10 calendars.  These will make great gifts during the holiday season.

Images that will be used in the calendar

story:
• English version below •

Versione italiana

Due anni fa, un po’ per gioco, abbiamo deciso di aprire un profilo Instagram che raccontasse la città di Milano in tutte le sue sfaccettature. Creammo quindi @milandreamin, che a distanza di due anni raccoglie più di 3000 follower provenienti da tutto il mondo e ci ha permesso di conoscere centinaia di persone e di realtà.

Quotidianamente, girando per la città, carichiamo foto in alta qualità per condividere il nostro amore per Milano con gli altri utenti.

Certo, sarebbe più facile prendere foto altrui e caricarle sul nostro profilo, ma da sempre ci siamo impegnati a caricare solo ed esclusivamente foto scattate da noi.


Perché fare un libro, allora?

@milandreamin è diventato quello che è solo grazie all’interesse e alla partecipazione dei nostri follower. 

Grazie a questo gruppo speciale di persone che ogni giorno ci seguono, commentano e condividono con noi un po’ della loro giornata, abbiamo pensato che questa passione non dovesse rimanere solo immateriale ma bensì tangibile e concreta attraverso le pagine di un libro.

Quindi ... è un libro di foto?

Si! Ma non solo. Quando ci vengono mostrate foto emozionanti della nostra città, o della città di cui ci siamo innamorati e abbiamo sempre sognato di visitare, si crea in noi qualcosa che va oltre l’osservare passivamente una fotografia e vengono mossi dei sentimenti che non ci saremmo aspettati di provare.

Ma allora perché raccogliere fondi?

La possibilità di creare è nel nostro DNA. Ma in questi casi la sola passione non è sufficiente. Presentare le foto nel modo migliore possibile, attraverso la stampa di un libro, è costoso. Ma ciò non ci impedisce di credere fermamente in questo progetto.

Nel libro vogliamo inserire non solo le foto più belle già caricate sul profilo di Instagram, ma anche e soprattutto nuove foto esclusive e particolari di Milano, per le quali è necessaria un’attrezzatura fotografica adeguata, che speriamo di poter acquistare grazie al vostro contributo.

Quali sono i perks? 

I perks sono delle ricompense per la vostra generosità ed essi variano in base alla somma di denaro donata.

Sappiamo che una campagna Indiegogo non sarebbe completa senza perks.

Ecco qualche informazione in più su alcuni dei perks che abbiamo pensato per voi:

Grazie mille

Ringraziamento pubblico sul libro insieme a tutti gli altri donatori.

LINK AL PERK - 5 EUR

Cartolina con la copertina del libro

Stampata su carta di qualità, la cartolina ritrarrà la copertina del libro che sarà pubblicato.

Con il suo formato 10 x 15cm è perfetta da inviare ad un vecchio amico, scrivere un biglietto d’amore, o semplicemente attaccarla alla parete.

LINK AL PERK - 10 EUR

Una tua foto sul nostro fotolibro!

La community per noi è davvero importante: su Instagram abbiamo centinaia di persone che giornalmente ci seguono e vorremmo dar loro spazio di esprimersi con le loro foto magnifiche.

Creeremo una sezione nel fotolibro contenente il collage di tutte le foto ricevute, scrivendo sotto ogni immagine il nickname di Instagram.

Attenzione però perchè queste foto dovranno avere delle limitazioni*:

  • devono riguardare la città di Milano (es. luoghi d'interesse, per intenderci non vogliamo foto di gattini pelosi o dei vostri selfie in piazza Duomo)
  • devono essere di ottima qualità (almeno 1400x1400px) e in formato quadrato, proprio come le avete postate!
  • qualora ritraessero persone bisognerà inviare via e-mail anche la liberatoria

La quota di 15 euro ci aiuterà a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo e di conseguenza a pubblicare il fotolibro.

Dopo aver aderito al perk, scegliete la foto da inviarci, verrete contattati nel più breve tempo possibile!

*qualora le foto inviateci non rispetteranno una delle 3 limitazioni, ci riserviamo la possibilità di richiederne un'altra

LINK AL PERK - 15 EUR

TONKI

TONKI è il perk più originale della campagna! Puoi scegliere la foto di Milano che ti piace di più  e verrà stampata su cartone riciclato, pronto per essere appeso o messo sulla scrivania! 
Dona 25€ per scoprire quanto è bello e originale!

LINK AL PERK - 25 EUR

That's Milano fotolibro

Fotolibro di ottima fattura che ospiterà le foto splendide scattate in giro per la città di Milano. È sicuramente un oggetto unico e emozionante da tenere in mano e sfogliarlo in tutta tranquillità. 

Caratteristiche:

  • formato 20 x 25cm (7.87 x 9.84 inches)
  • stampato su carta fotografica premium opaca a 148 g/m2
  • copertina rigida rivestita

  • il numero di pagine varierà a seconda della disponibilità di fondi

SCONTO 15% SU 10 PEZZI - LINK AL PERK - 60 EUR

Stampe su tela

Fotoriquadri ad altissima qualità di stampa con profilo in legno, con immagine scelta a vostro piacimento tra quelle che vi proporremo al termine della campagna.

Sono un’idea originale per arredare le pareti delle vostre case, stanno bene dappertutto, in cucina, in salotto e soprattutto in camera da letto, per avere Milano a portata dei vostri occhi.

Disponibili in vari formati: 

  1. 30x40cm
  2. 70x100cm
  3. quattro tele 40x40cm cad. (tot. 83 x 83cm)
  4. tre tele 57x100cm cad. (tot. 177 x 100cm)

30 x 40 cm, LINK AL PERK - 100 EUR

70 x 100 cm, SCONTO 25% SU 5 PEZZI - 200 EUR

83 x 83 cm, SCONTO 20% SU 3 PEZZI - 400 EUR

177 x 100 cm, SCONTO 20% SU 1 PEZZO - 800 EUR 


Perché questo progetto è così importante?

Siamo venuti a Indiegogo perché la comunità qui è fenomenale. Non è sempre facile chiedere il sostegno finanziario per un progetto, ma pensare al denaro come un'altra risorsa per valorizzare la creatività, in un certo modo, è il più grande obiettivo che speriamo di realizzare.

Abbiamo scelto la modalità di finanziamento fisso: tutto o niente. Ciò vuol dire che qualora non dovessimo raggiungere il nostro obiettivo, fissato a 8000 €, le somme che avrete donato vi torneranno indietro e il progetto non verrà completato.

Una frase di un comico inglese ci ha ispirato:

"Ho imparato che il denaro può essere un sacco di cose. Può essere qualcosa che viene accumulato, conteso, protetto, rubato e trattenuto. Oppure può essere come un'energia, alimentata dal desiderio, dall'interesse creativo, dal bisogno di ridere di grandi gruppi di persone. E può essere condiviso e donato per alimentare un interesse comune".

Questo è uno dei primi grandi progetti a cui abbiamo mai lavorato e non vediamo l'ora di raggiungere il traguardo.

Se hai letto fino a questo punto, grazie per la lettura.

Se non puoi contribuire donando, continua a seguirci su Facebook, Twitter e su thatsmilano.altervista.org condividendo la nostra campagna di crowdfunding con la tua cerchia di amici. In questo modo la nostra campagna potrà raggiungere un maggior numero di persone. 

Significa davvero molto per noi

Grazie ancora.

Matteo e Camilla


English version

Two years ago, just for fun, we decided to open an Instragram account to describe the city of Milan in all its facets. Therefore, we created @milandreamin, which, 2 years later, collects more than 3000 followers from all around the world and it allows us to meet hundreds of people and realities.

Daily, walking in the city, we upload high quality photographs to share our love for Milan with other people.

Surely, it would be easier to take pictures of others and upload them to our account, but we have always dedicated ourselves to use only our own photos.


Why make a book then?

@milandreamin has become what it really is only through the interest and the participation of our followers.

Thanks to this special group of people who follow us every day, comment and share a little of their life with us, we’ve decided that this passion must not remain only immaterial, but rather tangible and concrete through the pages of a book.

So… is it a book of photos?

YES! But not only that. When we are shown exciting pictures of our city, or the city that we love and we dream to visit, it creates in us something beyond the passive observation of a photo and feelings that we would not expected to try are moved.


Why raise money?

The ability to create is in our DNA. However, in these cases, the mere passion is not enough. Presenting the photos in the best way possible, through the press of a high quality book, is expensive. Nevertheless, it does not stop us from firmly believing in this project.

We want to put in the book not only the most beautiful photos already uploaded to the Instagram account, but also new exclusive and particular ones, for which an adequate camera equipment is necessary, and we hope to buy it thanks to your contribution.


What about perks?

Perks are rewards for your generosity and they change according to the sum of money donated.

We know that an Indiegogo campaign wouldn’t be complete without perks.

Here there are some more information of some of the perks we have thought about for you:

Thank you very much

Public thanks on the book with all the contributors.

LINK AT PERK - 5 EUR

Post card of the book cover

Printed on high quality paper, the post card portrays the cover of the book that will be published.

With its size ..., it is perfect for saying hello to an old friend, writing a love letter or just hanging on your wall.

LINK AT PERK - 10 EUR

Your photo on our photobook!

The Community is very important for us: on Instagram every day thousand of people follow us and so we decided to give them the space to express themselves with their wonderful pics.
We are going to create a section in our photobook containing a big collage with all the photos we will receive, and we'll write the Instagram's nickname under every pic.

Pay ATTENTION! Pic has some limitations:

  • it must concern city of Milan (ex. points of interest of the city, we don't want photos of your pet or selfie)
  • it must be in high quality (almost 1400x1400px) and it must be in square seize
  • if there are people in your pic, you must also send an e-mail with the photo release form

15 EUR fee will help us reach our goal and therefore publish the photobook.

After joining the perk, choose the photo you will send to us, and we will contact you as soon as possible!

* if the photos sent do not respect one of the three limitations, we reserve the right to request another one

LINK AT PERK - 15 EUR

TONKI

TONKI is the most original perk of the campaign! You can choose one of our photo of Milan and it will be printed on recycled cardboard, ready to hang or prop! 
Donate 25€ to discover how great it is!

LINK AT PERK - 25 EUR

That's Milano photobook

High quality photobook which will host the wonderful photos of Milan. It’s certainly an unique and exciting object to hold in your hands and read in tranquillty.

Features:

  • size 20 x 25 cm (7.87 x 9.84 inches)
  • printed on premium matt photographic paper of  148 g/m2
  • hardcover coated

  • the number of pages will change according to the funds raised

15% DISCOUNTED 10 PIECES - LINK AT PERK - 60 EUR

Prints on canvas

High quality prints with wood profile, with a photo chosen by you among the ones we will propose at the end of the campaign.

They are an original idea to decorate the walls of your home, they are beautiful everywhere, in the kitchen, in the living room, and especially in your bedroom, to see Milan in front of your eyes whenever you want.

Available in different sizes: 

  1. 30 x 40 cm (11,81 x 15,75 inches)
  2. 70 x 100 cm (27,55 x 39,37 inches)
  3. four canvas 40 x 40 cm each (tot. 83 x 83 cm - 32,68 x 32,68 inches)
  4. three canvas 57 x 100 cm each (tot. 177 x 100 cm - 69,68 x 39,37 inches)

30 x 40 cm, LINK AT PERK - 100 EUR

70 x 100 cm, DISCOUNTED 25% 5 PIECE - 200 EUR

83 x 83 cm, DISCOUNTED 20% 3 PIECES - 400 EUR 

177 x 100 cm, DISCOUNTED 20% 1 PIECE - 800 EUR 

Why this project is so important

We came to Indiegogo because the community here is phenomenal.

It’s not always easy asking for financial support for a project, but thinking of money as another resource for creating and nurturing creativity, in some ways, is the greater goal we hope to accomplish.

We have chosen the fixed funding: all or nothing. It means that if we don’t reach our aim, fixed on 8000 €, the money you will have donated will come back to you and the project won’t be completed.

Comedian Louis C. K. inspired us when he said:

“I learned that money can be a lot of things. It can be something that is hoarded, fought over, protected, stolen and withheld. Or it can be like an energy, fueled by the desire, will, creative interest, need to laugh, of large groups of people. And it can be shuffled and pushed around and pooled together to fuel a common interest.”

This is one of the biggest projects we've ever worked on and we can't wait to take it across the finish line. 

If you have made it this far, thanks for reading. 

If you cannot contribute by donating money, keep on following us on Facebook Page, Twitter and on thatsmilano.altervista.org, sharing our crowdfunding campaign with your friends. In this way our campaign will reach a greater number of people.

It really means a lot to us.

Thank you again. 

Matteo and Camilla
story_txt:
• English version below •Versione italiana
Due anni fa, un po’ per gioco, abbiamo deciso di aprire un
profilo Instagram che raccontasse la città di Milano in tutte le sue
sfaccettature. Creammo quindi @milandreamin, che a distanza di due anni
raccoglie più di 3000 follower provenienti da tutto il mondo e ci ha permesso
di conoscere centinaia di persone e di realtà.
Quotidianamente, girando per la città, carichiamo foto in
alta qualità per condividere il nostro amore per Milano con gli altri utenti.
Certo, sarebbe più facile prendere foto altrui e caricarle
sul nostro profilo, ma da sempre ci siamo impegnati a caricare solo ed
esclusivamente foto scattate da noi.


Perché fare un libro,
allora?
@milandreamin è diventato quello che è solo grazie
all’interesse e alla partecipazione dei nostri follower. 
Grazie a questo gruppo
speciale di persone che ogni giorno ci seguono, commentano e condividono con
noi un po’ della loro giornata, abbiamo pensato che questa passione non dovesse
rimanere solo immateriale ma bensì tangibile e concreta attraverso le pagine di
un libro. 
Quindi ... è un libro
di foto?
Si! Ma non solo. Quando ci vengono mostrate foto emozionanti
della nostra città, o della città di cui ci siamo innamorati e abbiamo sempre
sognato di visitare, si crea in noi qualcosa che va oltre l’osservare
passivamente una fotografia e vengono mossi dei sentimenti che non ci saremmo
aspettati di provare.


Ma allora perché raccogliere
fondi?

La possibilità di creare è nel nostro DNA. Ma in questi casi la sola passione non è sufficiente. Presentare le foto
nel modo migliore possibile, attraverso la stampa di un
libro, è costoso. Ma ciò non ci impedisce di credere fermamente in questo
progetto. 

Nel libro vogliamo inserire non solo le foto più belle già
caricate sul profilo di Instagram, ma anche e soprattutto nuove foto esclusive
e particolari di Milano, per le quali è necessaria un’attrezzatura fotografica
adeguata, che speriamo di poter acquistare grazie al vostro contributo.

Quali sono i perks? 
I perks sono delle ricompense per la
vostra generosità ed essi variano in base alla somma di denaro donata.
Sappiamo che una campagna Indiegogo
non sarebbe completa senza perks.
Ecco qualche informazione in più su
alcuni dei perks che abbiamo pensato per voi:
Grazie mille
Ringraziamento pubblico sul libro
insieme a tutti gli altri donatori.

LINK AL PERK - 5 EUR

Cartolina con la copertina del libro
Stampata su carta di qualità, la cartolina ritrarrà
la copertina del libro che sarà pubblicato.
Con il suo formato 10 x 15cm è perfetta da
inviare ad un vecchio amico, scrivere un biglietto d’amore, o semplicemente
attaccarla alla parete.


LINK AL PERK - 10 EUR
Una tua foto sul nostro fotolibro!

La community per noi è davvero importante: su Instagram abbiamo centinaia di persone che giornalmente ci seguono e vorremmo dar loro spazio di esprimersi con le loro foto magnifiche.
Creeremo una sezione nel fotolibro contenente il collage di tutte le foto ricevute, scrivendo sotto ogni immagine il nickname di Instagram.

Attenzione però perchè queste foto dovranno avere delle limitazioni*:


devono riguardare la città di Milano (es. luoghi d'interesse, per intenderci non vogliamo foto di gattini pelosi o dei vostri selfie in piazza Duomo)

devono essere di ottima qualità (almeno 1400x1400px) e in formato quadrato, proprio come le avete postate!
qualora ritraessero persone bisognerà inviare via e-mail anche la liberatoria


La quota di 15 euro ci aiuterà a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo e di conseguenza a pubblicare il fotolibro.
Dopo aver aderito al perk, scegliete la foto da inviarci, verrete contattati nel più breve tempo possibile!
*qualora le foto inviateci non rispetteranno una delle 3 limitazioni, ci riserviamo la possibilità di richiederne un'altra




LINK AL PERK - 15 EUR
TONKI
TONKI è il perk più originale della campagna! Puoi scegliere la foto di Milano che ti piace di più  e verrà stampata su cartone riciclato, pronto per essere appeso o messo sulla scrivania! Dona 25€ per scoprire quanto è bello e originale!

LINK AL PERK - 25 EUR

That's Milano fotolibro
Fotolibro di ottima fattura che ospiterà le foto splendide scattate in giro per la città di Milano. È sicuramente un oggetto unico e emozionante da tenere in mano e sfogliarlo in tutta tranquillità.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi my name is Julie Shoults and I am an explorer. I've been all around the world in search of untouched ecosystems and adventure.  
  • This campaign is important to me for many reasons. The project will allow me to push myself as a photographer, freediver, and slackliner. More importantly I will be able to share inner peace that these sports have granted me. This year I was diagnosed with PTSD. These sports truly help my mind relax and this project will help me heal. 
  • Contributors will help me achieve unique images that reflect something many people in today's society are missing: Peace of Mind. 

What We Need 

  • I need 7,000 dollars to capture all the images I have in mind. This will go towards gear. I need an underwater housing for a DSLR camera, underwater strobes, a monofin, and new equipment to set up a slackline at elevation.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal I will still be able to purchase some equipment and create some amazing images!

The Impact

  • In an era of ocean acidification, climate change, overfishing, pollution, etc., it is uncertain how long marine life will be able to survive. Coral reefs are particularly vulnerable. It is important to preserve these ecosystems in photos before they disappear completely.
  • This photo series will focus on Peace of Mind. I want to create these images to help others with PTSD. 
  • I have been focusing on wildlife photography, so this project will literally help me dive out of my comfort zone. Here is a link to my photography portfolio: www.julieshoults.com 

The Project:

  • This photography series is an exploration into peace of mind. It will focus on two extreme adventure sports.

  • The first is freediving. This is when divers plunge into the ocean without SCUBA gear. Participants train to increase their depth and breath hold time. Although freediving may seem like an exhilarating rush for adrenaline junkies, it is actually quite peaceful. Beneath the surface, without loud breathing equipment, with one breath, I find peace. I want to share this peace with others through photography. I am a PADI SCUBA Instructor and avid amateur freediver. I will be relocating to Siargao, a remote island in the Philippines, to hone my craft and become an AIDA Freediving Instructor. 

  • The other sport is slacklining. It is a sport invented by climbers. A thin piece of webbing unites two trees and slackliners walk upon the line. It requires great focus, balance, and concentration. I was fortunate enough to learn slackline skills in the circus. Siargao seems like the perfect setting to create awesome slackline set ups and photos. 

  • Both sports may seem different, but they exercise the same core muscle: the mind. Focus is necessary to stay atop a thin line and to sink into the ocean's depths. Participants must only exist in the present moment or they will fail at their sport. This peaceful presence is what I aim to capture. 

  • My photos will focus on simplicity. I want my audience to feel like they are underwater or in the air with me. Composing shots in the deep blue of the Pacific will help me capture the mystery of the oceans. Slacklining will also give me a chance to compost unique, elegant shots. I will recruit a drone pilot and an underwater photographer to capture these sports. We will work as a team. we will discuss the composition, lighting, and mood of the shots, so they work together in one cohesive series. I want to unite land and sea, ocean and air in one compelling series of portraits and landscapes. 
     

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • If you can't contribute use the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary

Hi my name is Julie Shoults and I am an explorer. I've been all around the world in search of untouched ecosystems and adventure.  
This campaign is important to me for many reasons. The project will allow me to push myself as a photographer, freediver, and slackliner. More importantly I will be able to share inner peace that these sports have granted me. This year I was diagnosed with PTSD. These sports truly help my mind relax and this project will help me heal. 
Contributors will help me achieve unique images that reflect something many people in today's society are missing: Peace of Mind. 

What We Need 

I need 7,000 dollars to capture all the images I have in mind. This will go towards gear. I need an underwater housing for a DSLR camera, underwater strobes, a monofin, and new equipment to set up a slackline at elevation.
If I don't reach my entire goal I will still be able to purchase some equipment and create some amazing images!

The Impact

In an era of ocean acidification, climate change, overfishing, pollution, etc., it is uncertain how long marine life will be able to survive. Coral reefs are particularly vulnerable. It is important to preserve these ecosystems in photos before they disappear completely.
This photo series will focus on Peace of Mind. I want to create these images to help others with PTSD. 
I have been focusing on wildlife photography, so this project will literally help me dive out of my comfort zone. Here is a link to my photography portfolio: www.julieshoults.com 


The Project:

This photography series is an exploration into peace of mind. It will focus on two extreme adventure sports.
The first is freediving. This is when divers plunge into the ocean without SCUBA gear. Participants train to increase their depth and breath hold time. Although freediving may seem like an exhilarating rush for adrenaline junkies, it is actually quite peaceful. Beneath the surface, without loud breathing equipment, with one breath, I find peace. I want to share this peace with others through photography. I am a PADI SCUBA Instructor and avid amateur freediver. I will be relocating to Siargao, a remote island in the Philippines, to hone my craft and become an AIDA Freediving Instructor. 
The other sport is slacklining. It is a sport invented by climbers. A thin piece of webbing unites two trees and slackliners walk upon the line. It requires great focus, balance, and concentration. I was fortunate enough to learn slackline skills in the circus. Siargao seems like the perfect setting to create awesome slackline set ups and photos. 
Both sports may seem different, but they exercise the same core muscle: the mind. Focus is necessary to stay atop a thin line and to sink into the ocean's depths. Participants must only exist in the present moment or they will fail at their sport. This peaceful presence is what I aim to capture. 
My photos will focus on simplicity. I want my audience to feel like they are underwater or in the air with me. Composing shots in the deep blue of the Pacific will help me capture the mystery of the oceans. Slacklining will also give me a chance to compost unique, elegant shots. I will recruit a drone pilot and an underwater photographer to capture these sports. We will work as a team. we will discuss the composition, lighting, and mood of the shots, so they work together in one cohesive series. I want to unite land and sea, ocean and air in one compelling series of portraits and landscapes.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
If you can't contribute use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A Little about Ankit

Namaste! family from the world, I am a photographer who shares a love for creating images that tell stories of nature, mountains, and people from different cultures.  I was born and raised in a small city called Bhiwani, Haryana in Northen India. Trained as an engineer by education I decided to take an unconventional path by choosing to travel and volunteer as a photographer for humanitarian organizations. 

From Past two years, I had been volunteering in Nepal with non-profit organizations like Conscious impact and All hands and hearts which are working on projects that are working towards Sustainability, Education, Agriculture and Rebuilding schools, homes, toilets and community awareness after the earthquake.

What is this project about?

The motive of this project is to preserve the ancient culture of the Himalayas ,connect with its people , learn about their life, community , issues that are arising due to changing times, climate and conditions , As a photographer i feel a need to preserve cultures which are on a verge of extinction on this ancient land and share those stories with people around the world .

With your contribution, I will be able to create a unique photographic documentation of Himalayas after the earthquake which is one of its kind of record for art, history, and beauty which will continue to create a sense of beauty and awareness for not only this generation but generations to come. 

 

What motivates me to do this?

I want to live a life that allows me to be kind to people and do work that adds value to peoples lives.

With that intent, I wish to create photos that are able to evoke emotions, that have an essence of the human element and have the ability to move people. Stories that show our beauty as a culture, beauty that lies in natural formations, something that reminds us and make us understand.

I am a person with curiosity who wants to know about other people and their land and share that knowledge in form of images. It's a beautiful feeling when you are invited by people with their kind and welcoming spirit, whom you have never met before to their homes where they share their life and way of doing things. 

Spending past two years in Nepal working with nonprofits allowed me to live in rural villages and learn the nepali language. This lead to a better understanding of the mindset and culture of nepal as I was able to make stronger connections. Working in development i also got to learn about sustainability and needs of a community . The joy that i experienced on the handover of completed school projects and home is worth all the hard work done so far by our teams. With all this, I wish to move in a direction to pursue the creation of artful images and sustainable work.

 

 

Great Himalayan Trail 

 

 

I want to overpasses on the Great Himalayan trail starting from the far Western region in Simikot towards the eastern and photograph Rara, Humla, Mugu, Jumla and Dolpo regions (trails shown in pink).

This journey would take me to interact with less known cultures and communities in remote regions of Nepal and create a photographic record of their history, beliefs, art, and stories. 

 

Collaborations and Connections

Over the past two years working with Organizations like Conscious Impact and All hands have allowed me to connect with individuals from all walks of life, filled with kindness and motivation to work towards good for others. 

Different people from all over the world came together to these projects to offer their time, money, skills and hard work.

Together we have built, homes, schools, toilets, shelters and greenhouses in affected regions at Sindhupalchowk and Nuwakot. 

 I have learned if we have an attitude of kindness and service, any goal can be achieved.

 

The Impact from your contributionsFundings 

  • it will Allow me to get involved with Conscious impact in Takure community development projects.

  • Plant more trees to recover the damage from environmental change
  • understand about agriculture, work with farmers and work towards sustainable agriculture
  • Join all hands and hearts to help build schools in rural areas where schools got destroyed in the earthquake 
  • Engage in meetings and dialogues with the community

 

Risks & Challenges

As you are aware of creating images for non-profits, getting involved in development projects, volunteering as much as it is rewarding it comes with its own challenges. It requires money, resources, equipments and an enormous amount of energy to work in remote rural settings.

 Your love and support will allow me to cover the financial needs required to continue what I am passionate about and develop my skills and continue to carry on the good work.

 

Where do Fundings go?

The funds raised for this project would cover the cost camera equipment, travel, permits, and food supplies during on the travels and allow me to continue photographing and helping out with conscious impact for about 7-8 months.

last year my camera got completely damaged due to monsoon rains that poured on my camera bag and it got damaged beyond repair.

The funding breaks down is like this

the first priority would be to buy a camera body and lens:  1500 $

Flights to Nepal: 250$

Flights within Nepal (Simikot and permits ): 550$

Food supplies ,gear,travel  : 1000 $

Exhibitions : 500 $

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand sometimes it's not possible to contribute by donation, but you can support me by sharing my campaign with your friends and family over social media networks. or you can help by arranging an photography exhibition in your community to raise funds via donations.

 

What do you get in return?

It fills me with a deep gratitude to able to have your support and i would like to return in any possible way that I can.  I will send you your favorite selection of images digitally via email .

All the selected beautiful photographs would be shared across my social media platforms with everyone along with update posts from my travels

You can Join my journey also or if you have any questions please feel free to reach out 

 

You can see more of my work on

Instagram: ankit_tanu

Facebook :photographer.tanu

email:lettersforankit@gmail.com

 

also, check out Conscious Impact

 website: www.consciousimpact.org

Instagram: conscious impact

Facebook: Conscious Impact

story:
Short Summary

Meet Paul, abject poverty describes his life. Here is his story. He was born in the rural part of Kenya, his parents died as a result of the HIV/ AIDS scourge that was sweeping the village mercilessly sparing no one on its path.

Their home is made of mud walls and grass thatch on the roof. It stands on a government land because the family sold all their assets so as to provide medical care for the parents. Here he lives with his smaller sister and his grandmother.
His grandmother cooks using firewood in the small house and as a result coughs loud and hard. It is hard.

His sister is highly malnourished because they can barely have three balanced meals and instead rely more on maize porridge and maize meals in order to survive from day to day.

Paul thought of trying to help his grandmother in finding money for the family to use and help stop the sister's nutritional problem. He migrated to the big city Nairobi to look for income. He unfortunately had a brush with the law enforcers because he ended up being a scavenger for items to sell to the industries. Those he called friends fooled him and he ended up stealing things to sell.

Desperation pushed him hard and he ended up in a juvenile detention center

With good behavior, Paul was released from the center and he took to sports, boxing to keep himself busy by training young children in self defense mechanisms and life skills.

As we speak Paul's sister is in dire need of good nutrition and currently admitted at a nutrition center in the community with the home that the situation will be reversed before she clocks 2 years. The granny still coughs and she cannot afford medicine.

Paul wants an opportunity to tell his story to the world through the camera. Many more share a similar story.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $74,722 which will go towards purchase of 50 cameras, 50 computers and procure professionally trained photographers and bloggers to help us tell a similar story of 50 more youths. when they learn photography, Paul and others will start earning from their acquired skills and therefore he will be able to afford medicine for grandma, proper meals for the sister and improved housing structure for grandma.



We do want to tell our story, it is a stepping stone towards creating awareness on the plight of juvenile children and the challenges they go through to survive.



The Impact

The anticipated impact out of this project is that:

1. 50 learners will be able to better and positively express themselves, through basic skills in blogging and photography, on issues affecting their lives and recommend solutions to these problems.

2. 50 learners are able to focus and engage in positive activities.



Previous Successful Track Record

1.  Selection of 20 learners. The students were between the ages of 14 to 22 and 5 are girls.

2.  20 project consents signed.

3.  All project equipment purchased.

4.  Development of a project curriculum and a master calendar (To aid in effective planning of the workshops.)

5.  All scheduled workshops completed. All students attended most classes and actively participated in both theoretical and practical lessons on blogging and photography.

6.  Learners email accounts, blog accounts and accounts for online photo were shared created.

7.  Learners able to blog and use a computer and camera at a basic level. The blogging was done internally and is yet to be posted online.



Risks & Challenges

1.  Availability of only three cameras has posed a challenge as the learners had to share them among themselves,

2.  The learners have only been able to develop very basic photography and computer skills as the children did not handle the cameras and computers on a daily basis,

3.  Slow and unreliable Internet connection at Internet cafés slowed the process and frustrated the students,

4.  Limited funds resulted in overstretching the funds to meet all necessary requirements of the project,

5.  Limited or no resources to hold a local exhibition and,

6.  Limited or no time or resources to hold the TOT (Training of Trainers) in this phase

Having had prior experience in digital photography we are better placed to implement a second phase of the project with a higher degree of success. The challenges faced previously will now be mitigated through proper planning and project implementation with a monitoring and evaluation component.



Other Ways You Can Help

With your help, we can fulfill the wishes of children like my daughter, who is just from rehabilitation for reasons influenced by me as a parent and my bad choices in life. Let us tell their story to help improve our parenting skills.

Please share widely with others if you have a daughter with similar challenges and use the Indiegogo share tools.








Please contact me directly. I'm happy to tell you more!



Email Address: ​ 42plusfoundation@gmail.com



Website: www.42plusfoundation.webs.com

story:
Hey! I’m Karolina and that’s my story 

For over a decade I’ve been organizing my life around travel and photography. It all began when I was 13 and out of thin air came the idea of becoming a photographer. I got my first camera from my parents who have ever since been encouraging my arts interests. I read countless books and attended many lectures to learn how a good photograph is done. Finally, I was very lucky enough, right after finishing high school and having passed all the exams I was enlisted into the most important and respected film school in Poland - Polish National Film School in Łódź. And this is where my actual photographic adventure started.

During my university years, most of my output has been about people and some sort of documentary road projects. So was my life. Split into two - photographing and traveling.

How did I collect money for that?

Along with my studies, I have been doing a lot of commercial work - shooting stills for the movies, sets or some lookbook fashion pictures for small enterprises. Some of my photographs have even won cash prices so I could pay for my next travel costs. I’m used to a tight budget life as a rule, usually do a secondhand shopping and avoid eating out in fancy restaurants. When traveling, I quite often choose a hitch-hike or couch surfing. Once I even hired myself out for a 6-month contract as a ship photographer for Carnival Cruise lines. All of the money I have been making so far, helped me finance my travels and passion for photography in general. This year is the biggest challege I have ever faced, therefore it needs careful preparations. I want everything to be perfectly organized. This is going to be an advanture of a lifetime, so I count on your support !

This year is special for me, because it’s the last semester and I have to prepare my own photographic Master’s Degree creative project. I have always had this dream about „Into the Wild” road project. And this is what my diploma topic is about. I want to go across Canada, towards Alaska and than back to the USA; following masters of American road photography, Alec Soth or Ryan McGinley. I want to construct my own vision of the places I’m about to see and people I will meet. I'm also very inspired by Jack Kerouac stories, all that simplicity and levity of being on the road. I wish I could join him just for a while, Im sure it would be the story of my life. The dreaming is for the dreamers.

 I am really thrilled by the prospects of meeting new folks, listening to their stories, exploring new places, and finally, being able to put it all into visual documentary. Beside experiencing the trip as itself, having an exhibition and passing my MD exams.

 

 

I’m definitely too curious about the world and its people to sit quietly at home, in Warsaw. Because of my final exams and written Master’s Degree thesis schedule, I decided to do something much bigger than i did before, that’s why I need YOU! I hope I’m gonna make my dream come true with your help!!!!

 

I estimate overall cost at $5800,

  • Flight expenses : Poland - USA - Poland, $1000
  • Flight expenses : Anchorage - Seattle, $ 200,
  • Train and/or bus travel costs : $ 700,
  • Sometimes I will take longer stops, to have batteries charged or just take a shover . Cheap hostels or motels as an extra option where couch-surfing facilities are not available or I’m in the middle of nowhere: $ 700,
  • Additional, unexpected costs, € 700,
  • Polaroid 600 refills: $ 500,
  • Health and gear insurance: $ 300,
  • Prints and materials needed to prepare my final Exhibition: $ 1500,
  • around $ 200 for indiegogo ;)
  • So far I have collected $ 1000, so to reach the goal, I need $ 4800 MORE

 

My Portfolio

www.karolinagrabowska.com

instagram - @karolinagrabowska

 

Other ways you can help

  • Some of you undoubtedly are not able to contribute financially. That's fine! If you like what I'm doing here, perhaps you can help in other ways?
  • Email people you think would find this project interesting!
  • Share this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share buttons!
  • Maybe you are living somewhere near my route so you can offer me a place to sleep
  • Perhaps some of your friends live near my American trail. If so, ask them if they could be of any help. If needed. Just in case.

story:
INTRO
Hello everyone!
My name is Martina, 27, from Croatia. Recently I decided to take my passion for photography to the next level. As a hobbyst and freelancer, I don't earn much money here, sometimes nothing, also I am unemployed mother of one year old daughter. There were so many times I wanted to save some money, but it's impossible, there is always emergency situation in which you have pay some amount of money as soon as possible. Seven years ago , when I started with photography I didn't have my own camera, I borrowed one from time to time, four years ago i got my first camera, we were going for a low budget one, it served me well and I give 100% of me and camera to make solid photographs. Recently I was thinking of opening small busines, doing wedding and family photography, which is really hard with my camera. Everything I know I learned by myself, loving it and giving the most of me, but I feel kind of limited with my eqpuipment when it comes to wedding and family jobs.
That's the kind of photography I love to do and mostly doing it for myself and my joy.

PERKS

I am offering you few prints to choose:
20x30cm for 5$
30x40cm for 10$
 




FAMILY AND WEDDING PHOTOGRAPHY
Last year I started freelancing as a family and baby photographer, now and then there were few small weddings, as unemployed person, this was great to earn something. 
This made me think to run a small business and try to save some money for new camera, but it's not that easy as it looks like.  Hoping that things will get better and I will give all of me to make it!


Photos of my baby Erika
More photos are avaiable at my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/m.spoljaric.photography/
story_txt: INTROHello everyone!My name is Martina, 27, from Croatia. Recently I decided to take my passion for photography to the next level. As a hobbyst and freelancer, I don't earn much money here, sometimes nothing, also I am unemployed mother of one year old daughter. There were so many times I wanted to save some money, but it's impossible, there is always emergency situation in which you have pay some amount of money as soon as possible. Seven years ago , when I started with photography I didn't have my own camera, I borrowed one from time to time, four years ago i got my first camera, we were going for a low budget one, it served me well and I give 100% of me and camera to make solid photographs. Recently I was thinking of opening small busines, doing wedding and family photography, which is really hard with my camera. Everything I know I learned by myself, loving it and giving the most of me, but I feel kind of limited with my eqpuipment when it comes to wedding and family jobs.That's the kind of photography I love to do and mostly doing it for myself and my joy.PERKSI am offering you few prints to choose:20x30cm for 5$30x40cm for 10$ FAMILY AND WEDDING PHOTOGRAPHYLast year I started freelancing as a family and baby photographer, now and then there were few small weddings, as unemployed person, this was great to earn something. This made me think to run a small business and try to save some money for new camera, but it's not that easy as it looks like.  Hoping that things will get better and I will give all of me to make it!Photos of my baby ErikaMore photos are avaiable at my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/m.spoljaric.photography/

story:
I’m just one person, but my Life matters and I’m happy to be alive today. I’m able to share my story to now make a difference and possibly help save another Life. Unfortunately, on average there are 129 suicides per day.

http://www.health.com/condition/depression/suicide-attempt-survivors

http://www.webmd.com/mental-health/mental-illness-basics#1

Millions of others suffer from PTSD, Depression, Anxiety, Phobias and other psychiatric disabilities or mental illnesses. Sinderella is a Psychiatric Service Dog which has helped my loneliness and phobias start to disappear and has given me the will to focus on my family and success. Sinderella signals when I engage in harmful behaviors, plus provides companionship all the time.

http://thirdeyekennels.com/breedings.html

There's a greater purpose for her; as she’s proven through magnificent online engagement on Instagram and Facebook. Sinderella and those who believe in saving lives should help fund this campaign.  

Sinderella could help much more than me and her social media followers.

SinderellasAcademy Platform will simply remain engaged on Social a Media, but also increase engagement and execute vision.

Sinderella is a PureBred Ghost Lilac Tri XXL American Bully, a true beauty and beast who has the genetics and pedigree to start a truly AMAZING Platform of Luxury Emotional Support American Bullys. By Luxury, meaning, this appearance and personality of this exquisite animal promote and stimulate living your Life virtually and physically.  Sinderella’s Instagram has generated successful positive influence from the start. Her Instagram and Facebook have received multiple responses of people admitting her contact has benefited them in multiple positive ways.

During research & decelopment, SinderellaTheBully’s posts have motivated people to do better in life, focus on their work responsibilities, better their relationships, engage in physical activities, overcome sadness, get out of bed, leave negative situations, laugh, smile and feel happiness. There has been so much appreciation show towards Sinderella’s abilities, they can not go unnoticed. Aside from overcoming my own personal difficulties and her followers sharing theirs, this dog’s abilities should reach more people online. 

This is why we have created Sinderella’s Academy, to help suffering from from suicidal thoughts, self-injury, physciatric diabilies, or mental illness through promoting positive activism. Dogs with a pedigree such a Sinderella’s will form our platforms initial Online ESA American Bully website and social media.

 

SINDERELLA 3 MONTHS OLD

 

Sinderella's Emotional Support American Bully Academy will help people who with struggle with suicidal thoughts or even attempted suicide, self-injury or suffer psychiatric disabilities or mental illnesses, or just need an online companion. 

Reminding you, that you're never alone!

http://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/ironshrink/201109/why-people-commit-suicide

Love More Life!

http://afsp.org/about-suicide/suicide-statistics/

 

Each dollar contributed to this fund, will be used for but not limited to: 

  • Official Sinderella’s Academy LLC Business Registration
  • Additional training and supplies 
  • Website domain and hosting registration and development
  • Ignite Team
  • Research & Development  Sinderella’s Academy
  • Instagram/Facebook Marketing & Content creation
  • High Quality Photography
  • Building an all-around solid foundation for Sinderella's Finest ESA American Bully Academy which will consistent communicate with audience.
  • Recruiting/Breeding like Bullys expand from one dog and one social media following to multiple
 

 

#SinderellasAcademy

 

 

One Life At A a Time, Virtually & Physically

Program Objectives

 

 

Mom & Dad from http://Topdogbullies.com

http://breedingbusiness.com/what-is-the-american-bully-standard-xl-pocket/

 

Maximizing Sinderella’s current audience of over 11,000 people on Instagram and Facebook will be Sinderella’s ESA American Bully Academy’s initial campaign growth focus. Multiplying this audience through our Kickstarter campaign will give us the tools, capital and resources we NEED to start reaching out to this market of people who have attempted suicide or self-injury or suffer from psychiatric disabilities or mental illness through influence.

 

ALL HYPERLINKS ARE FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

 

 

 

 

 

 

http://Instagram.com/sinderellathebully

story:
Who is my friend Iva?

Iva Tanacković was born in Belgrade in 1983 and besides being a dedicated concert photographer, she's also a web designer and blogger. Even though we both attended the Faculty of Philology in Belgrade (the Department of Italian studies) it wasn't until 2018 that we actually met in person and realized we share a similar grim history - we couldn't make any decent money after college, we became depressed and later on we started working in the field of digital media (including photography) in order to somehow ''survive'' (financially speaking).

Luckily, becoming a photographer wasn't just a way of surviving  for either Iva or me - we both quite enjoy it, but I can say that Iva is definitely much more passionate about what she does than me. Whenever I attend some rock concert here in Belgrade, she's always in the front row, making sure not to miss any important moment and any interesting facial expression or gesture of performers.

Iva never looks bored or jaded with what she does - there's always this childlike enchantment she radiates when she's behind the camera. This is the main reason I really want her to get a top gear and explore her passion further!

You can check out Iva's portfolio on Flickr.

What made me launch this campaign?

A few weeks ago, Iva's favorite lens fell apart (50mm) and I realized that she really needs new gear.  Since I know that her family is barely making ends meet, it's a big expense for Iva to repair the lens or buy a new one.

Having in mind Iva's huge enthusiasm for photography as well as her financial hardship, I think she deserves a new camera (or at least a new lens!) more than any other photographer I know.

Why Iva needs a full-frame camera?

Iva's current camera (Canon EOS 60D) is quite outdated (it's from 2010) and it doesn't allow her to capture top-notch concert photos because this camera can't produce impeccable images at high ISO.

Since Iva usually shoots in low light, it's crucial for her to have a reliable camera that can work well in less than ideal lighting conditions.  

Fun facts about Iva:

  • She has shot more than 100 concerts in 2018.
  • Her video footage was used in a documentary ''Amy'' directed by Asif Kapadia in 2015.  Kapadia filmed ''Amy'' based on singer Amy Winehouse and this movie has become the highest grossing documentary of all time in the United Kingdom and won him an Academy Award and Grammy Award in 2016. 
  • Iva looks through the camera viewfinder with her left eye, because her right eye is affected by strabismus.
  • She's not an aspiring photographer - her work is already recognized by many musicians in Serbia and it's quite popular on social media such as Facebook and Instagram.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The new location is roughly 5 minutes from our NOTO studio. It has 14-foot ceilings and plenty of room for shooting with a long lens.  The "garage" area has two 12-foot doors (one on each side) for driving a vehicle in or letting in tons of natural sunlight.  It has acres of land where we can build anything we want and includes beautiful foliage in the spring, summer and fall.

We need your help to make this happen and we're in a hurry, or we could lose it.  Any donation you can make, even if it's just $10, will help us reach our goal.

Here's what we need...  $2,000 to cover the initial lease.  $500 to cover deposits for utilities.  $750 to cover move-in expenses.  $1000 to cover some minor work on the space.  The remaining amount covers the Indiegogo fees and expenses.

If you would like to be a partner in the space (partnership gets you a key, priority when making reservations, and no reservation fees) the initial fee is $100 for the first month and $50/month afterwards. You would need to give us 60 days notice before dropping your membership to give us time to find a replacement.

The cost for renting this space will $10/hour if you are not a member. You can pre-purchase hours for $5/hour through this fundraiser. When making your donation, please note that is what you want to do.

If you are not a photographer (or even if you are) we are offering a very special deal...  A 30 minute photo session with an amazing Studio Partner for $50.  You and your immediate family can get your pictures taken in our new studio space.  You will receive edited photos from the photographer sized for social media delivered to your Email. Optionally, you can purchase print sized photos and a print release. Some photographers also offer beautiful prints.  The $50 session fee is being donated to the studio by the photographers, so that is what you would pay now... $50.

Please, even $10 would help us reach our goal, so consider a small donation.  Whether you donate or note, PLEASE SHARE this with everyone you know.  You can help us tremendously by getting the word out to as many people as possible.

Our deadline for raising the initial $2000 is Wednesday, March 28th. I know that is super soon, but it can't be helped.

If we do not reach our goal and we miss out on this opportunity, I will refund donations.

story:
About the author 

My name is Bakang Baloi. I am a Botswana-trained molecular biologist and self-taught cultural and nature photographer currently based in Brisbane Australia. My photography is mainly about different aspects of life in Botswana. I also do wildlife photography and commissioned conceptual and abstract work. My photography is in private collections worldwide and has been exhibited in group and solo exhibitions in Botswana. I was the 2016 winner of the Thapong Artist of the Year (Photography Section). I have worked as a professional safari guide, environmental consultant, and cultural advisor to the movie industry and a researcher in vaccine development. Since 2007 I have photographed performances of San trance healing festivals and collected thousands of images in the process. The photographs have been collected into a large format coffee table book. 

About the book

The glossy hard covered book was printed in Singapore by Tien Wah Press Pte, is 308 pages thick and contains over 200 images. It is a visual celebration of the soul of cultural identity of the San that aims to honour our diverse cultural heritage by showcasing evocative images of traditional dance events in their most authentic settings. The book promotes San culture by creating awareness of the rich cultural offering of the San people to a local and international audience. The book is divided into six chapters, arranged to tell the story of the role traditionally played by art, music and dance in the life of San people. This includes influence of dance on such areas as Hunting, Gathering and Trance healing among others. The photography captures the essence of a legacy of one of the world’s oldest surviving cultures.

Faces of Botswana brings due recognition to custodians of this culture, and provides a platform to reward the performers for their commitment to the message of cultural identity. The book weaves San cultural identity into the tapestry of Botswana’s national and international brand. It allows one to peel the layers of a rich cultural history and look longingly into a long bygone era. 

The book was generously funded by CIPA (Botswana's Copyright and Intellectual Property Authority) and produced in collaboration with Letloa Development Trust; a Not-for-Profit Organisation based in the township of Ghanzi. Faces of Botswana aims to benefit San communities by contributing royalties from the sale of the book to the Trust to help tackle the different challenges faced by San communities.

What the money will be used for

The costs of design and layout, printing and binding, and purchasing of the ISBN have already been borne. This means that the book is printed and bound and ready for shipping. The monies raised will be for order fulfilment. 

The Impact

Royalties from the sales of Faces of Botswana will be contributed to Kuru Development Trust: a Not-for-profit organisation involved in San development issues. By supporting this campaign you will be helping spread joy and contributing to poverty reduction in one of the most rural areas in Botswana. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contributions and involvement are highly encouraged. You can be part of this campaign by following us on social media platforms. Our Facebook page is regularly  updated with current information on native people in Africa and all over the world. You can learn more about the Faces of Botswana project at https://www.facesofbotswana.com.

story:
简短的摘要

贡献者资助他们可以对自己信任的人充满热情的想法。这是本节中要做的一些事情：

  • 介绍您自己和您的背景。
  • 简要描述您的广告系列及其重要性。
  • 表达出哪些贡献者将帮助您实现目标。

记住，要简洁明了，但要与众不同。问问自己：如果有人停止在这里读书，他们准备贡献自己的力量吗？

我们需要什么和您得到什么

为人们更详细地分解：

  • 说明您需要多少资金以及资金的去向。保持透明，专一的人需要信任您才能为您提供资金。
  • 告诉人们您独特的待遇。让他们兴奋！
  • 如果您没有达到自己的全部目标，请描述资金的去向。

影响

随意解释有关您的广告系列的更多信息，并让人们知道他们的贡献将产生的变化：

  • 解释为什么您的项目对贡献者和整个世界都很有价值。
  • 指出您在类似项目中的成功记录（如果有的话）。
  • 使之成为真人并建立信任。

风险与挑战

人们重视您的透明度。通过洞察实现目标的过程中可能面临的风险和障碍，保持开放并脱颖而出。

  • 分享使您有资格克服这些障碍的条件。
  • 描述您解决这些挑战的计划。

其他方式你可以帮忙

有些人就是无能为力，但这并不意味着他们无能为力：

  • 要求人们说出话来，并为您的竞选活动制造噪音。
  • 提醒他们使用Indiegogo共享工具！

这就是全部。
story_txt:
简短的摘要
贡献者资助他们可以对自己信任的人充满热情的想法。这是本节中要做的一些事情：

介绍您自己和您的背景。
简要描述您的广告系列及其重要性。
表达出哪些贡献者将帮助您实现目标。

记住，要简洁明了，但要与众不同。问问自己：如果有人停止在这里读书，他们准备贡献自己的力量吗？

我们需要什么和您得到什么
为人们更详细地分解：

说明您需要多少资金以及资金的去向。保持透明，专一的人需要信任您才能为您提供资金。
告诉人们您独特的待遇。让他们兴奋！
如果您没有达到自己的全部目标，请描述资金的去向。


影响
随意解释有关您的广告系列的更多信息，并让人们知道他们的贡献将产生的变化：

解释为什么您的项目对贡献者和整个世界都很有价值。
指出您在类似项目中的成功记录（如果有的话）。
使之成为真人并建立信任。


风险与挑战
人们重视您的透明度。通过洞察实现目标的过程中可能面临的风险和障碍，保持开放并脱颖而出。

分享使您有资格克服这些障碍的条件。
描述您解决这些挑战的计划。


其他方式你可以帮忙
有些人就是无能为力，但这并不意味着他们无能为力：

要求人们说出话来，并为您的竞选活动制造噪音。
提醒他们使用Indiegogo共享工具！

这就是全部。

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brittney Horth. I'm currently a student at Full Sail University. I've made several short films and have been working on various photography projects for about a decade.  I've struggled with suicidal ideation and major depression for as long as I can remember. Photography was my first method of coping and I've been working on a very specific personal project for years, Collecting self portraits and pictures I've taken in the pits of my depression. I hope to finish the project this summer with a final shoot depicting the hope that is always present under the depression. Along, with the taboo way society views people with mental illness. It would be a huge goal reached to finally showcase this project outside of my own viewings and if fully funded turn this into a photography book. 

I'm asking for: $3500. 

$1500:  to upgrade my equipment, including new editing systems I need to finish up the pictures I have already taken. Along with new lens', stands, more lighting and filters to complete the final portion of my project.

$1000:  for costume materials and makeup including detailed practical makeup (latex, molds, plus basic beauty makeup.

$1000: hiring models, securing locations, funding for showings, and creating and printing the book.

Your contribution: will help me complete a project I have been working on and creating for the past 6 years of my life. I'm finally in head space to finish this project and any little bit you can do help would be greatly appreciated. I got inspired to finish this project for school and am on a little bit of a time crunch. I have to have it funded and completed by the end of the summer. If you can't contribute financially if you could spread the word around and tell your friends and family. Every little bit counts. 

If I don't meet my goal the money will be used to finish the project with the equipment I already have to the best of my ability. As well as makeup, costumes, and securing locations.
