story:
Hi everyone :),
my name is Katia Chausheva - born in Plovdiv, Bulgaria, where I live and work.
You can find my work on flickr, facebook and artlimited.


Photographer "amateur": 6 exhibitions until now.

In Plovdiv : Beyond the words, 2006
In Sofia : Sibank art gallery,The theatre of the body, 2007
in Woodstock (NY), USA : Photosensualis gallery, Anima, 2009
In Sofia : Art gallery Anima, Flauto in Dicembre, collaboration with Antonio Palmerini.
In Sofia : SFUMATO  - Exhibition with Iva Jauss and Arslan Ahmedov, 2013
In Sofia : Synthesis gallery, Solo exhibition Little white magics, 2015

2007, May - Portfolio in the EYEMAZING magazine, for the contemporary photography
2010, September - Portfolio in the EYEMAZING magazine, for the contemporary photography
2006 - Winner of the Grand Prix by Lumix Awards in Sofia

Portfolio, including nine archival pigment prints by Paul Cava




*

After all these years, I'm about to publish my first book, named Mirror.

A fine arts album with photography works all based of the world of the mirrors.


I'm not so good with the words... I can't express myself with them..I do this with my pictures. But here, with some lines, I will try to introduce what happens in the book. It is all about my passion for the mirrors. All photographs inside are shot in the mirror, or with the presence of a mirror. I love to make portraits of my models into
the mirror, to be the witness of this meeting - kind of déjà-vu. I think that we have, deep inside us, the knowing of who we are,in our previous lives... every time we look at the mirror, we search for our eternal presence now, unconsciously. Making this connection, we feel ourselves immortal as the time is - finding unexpected sides of us, always...

*

Now...
In order to realize this project, I will need some help. The funds I will try to raise are for the print of 1000 copies of the book. It includes all charges and I will be able to finish this long awaited and prepared project thanks to your help!

I will need to get 570 perks of 30 € each (or 33 $) so I can finance it entirely.
I have already prepared everything and I am finishing the test/proof prints.
Soon I will be able to show you more from it -  some pics and paper with prints on it.

You have a small preview of what the book will look like here - (without the texts)

Mirror example

The book itself contains 160 pages and 120 photographs. The print technique I chose is the offset print which delivers really the highest quality print and the paper will be semi-matt, 160 gr/m. The book will be with hardcover. The book size  - 24 x 28 cm (9,4 x 11 inch).
There will be also text essays from Iva Jauss, Roberto de Mitri, Arslan Ahmedov...





During the campaign /2 months/ - the price of the book including the shipping charges will be 30 euros / 33 US dollars.
After the campaign - the book will be sold for a price of 35 €/38 $ + shipping charges (around 15 €/17 $).

IMPORTANT : If you want to make a donation bigger than 30 euros and want to get also the book, please leave your shipping address!


If I ever succeed to raise the necessary funding, I will get the book printed in
February 2016 and begin to send it to all my supporters in March 2016!

NB. If the campaign is not successful, every supporter will be reimbursed with the exact amount he/she gave!
Thank you all!

story:
Μια έκθεση αποτελούμενη από 30 έγχρωμες φωτογραφίες 30 διαφορετικών νησιών της Ελλάδας. Ο σκοπός της έκθεσης είναι να γνωρίσει το ευρύτερο κοινό, αλλά και πιθανοί συνεργάτες ή αγοραστές, τη δουλειά μου πάνω στα ελληνικά νησιά. Το έργο αυτό, που βρίσκεται σε εξέλιξη εδώ και δυο χρόνια, έχει ως στόχο να δημιουργήσει μια φωτογραφική συλλογή των σπάνια καταγεγραμμένων στο φακό τοπίων των ελληνικών νησιών καθώς και της κληρονομιάς τους. Επιπλέον, το έργο μου επιδιώκει, μέσω της συνεργασίας με τις τοπικές κοινότητες και τις επιχειρήσεις τους, να αποτελέσει πρόσκληση στους ταξιδιώτες της Ελλάδας και του κόσμου.

The Islands of Greece Photography Project

Researching places I plan to photograph is an important part of my work. After dedicating myself to photographing Greek islands, I soon began to realize surprisingly how little landscape work has been done on the subject. While the famous places are overphotographed, less visited islands remain relatively unknown. The current state of the photography market in Greece, and the economy of the country in general, in combination with the geographic challenges of the region are an obstacle for both local and international photographers in changing the situation.

The absence of a large coherent body of work was a strong motivation for me to dedicate myself to this project on Greek islands. Out of approximately 270 inhabited islands and up to 6,000 islands in total, I selected approximately 80 islands representing all of the main inhabited islands. My goal is to portray the natural landmarks as well as the cultural and historical heritage of these places and bring them to a broader audience. My work seeks to help promote travel industry of the “overlooked” islands by establishing collaborations with local businesses and communities which would allow them to use my work for achieving their objectives.

By supporting this project, you will help me realize the first milestone of a long term schedule. The exhibition is an important tool of communication to this audience. It is also an important stepping stone in establishing collaborations with parties which could benefit from my work and at the same time, by supporting this project, you will help me continue creating new material.

The exhibition

The exhibition, designed for the exhibition space of the Blank Wall Gallery in Athens, will  take place in the gallery for one week on dates that are subject to availability. It will be booked after the end of the campaign. The exhibition will consist of 30 photographs of 50 x 70 cm. The photographs will be printed on a 260 gsm paper and framed in a black frame of 53.5 x 73.5 cm dimensions with a white mat. Every photograph will portray a different island.

Why Your Support Matters

This exhibition is not an end in itself, but serves as a means for further creation. It is especially the landscapes and natural landmarks of Greek islands which I feel deserve more attention and which provide a unique opportunity for creating fresh and unparalleled landscape work.

The world economic crisis followed by a Greek economic crisis caused a considerable downturn of the photography market in Greece. Other than a few exceptions, there have been very few photography books on Greek landscape published recently; other segments of the photography industry have experienced similar stagnation. Generally, the conditions for creating new work are very unfavorable.

This situation also prevents advancement of landscape photography as one of the powerful tools of supporting travel industry of less known Greek islands. I believe that images have the power to engage people and help reinforce both national and international public interest in parts of Greece for which travel industry is a key economic sector. I believe that photography has the power to impact and benefit whole communities.

Present Stage of the Project

To date, I have managed to visit 50 islands out of approximately 80 islands representing the main inhabited islands of Greece and the subject of the project. In the following stage of the project, I will be working towards completion of the initial coverage of the selected islands as well as expanding the existing material on the already photographed islands. This will culminate in the publication of a coffee table book covering all the main inhabited islands of Greece. The focus of the publication will be on the creation of rare imagery of natural landmarks and landscapes of the islands as well as of their cultural and historical heritage. This exhibition is meant to help engage local publishers in talks about publication of a coffee table book on the subject. It is also meant to gain the attention of local photography and travel magazines and to facilitate the publication of selected images in this medium. The exhibition is also meant to encourage general interest in the project and secure collaboration with other involved parties, be it local businesses or communities. Last but not least, it is meant to produce a set of high quality large prints which could be used for exhibitions in other art spaces around Greece.

What I Need and What You Get

This exhibition is highly important to me as a stepping stone to publishing a book on this subject and engaging possible clients and audience. For these reasons I chose to use the services of Blank Wall Gallery in Athens in order to maximize the potential this exhibition might have for my project. Blank Wall Gallery is a modern exhibition space dedicated to contemporary photography providing a full service regarding organization and promotion of photography exhibitions. Although such standards, of course, increase the cost of the exhibition, I consider them to be essential for my goal.

So far, I have been managing to cover my expenses related to running this project, however I do need some assistance with funding the cost of the exhibition. In case the campaign will not achieve its goal, I will try to obtain further funds through licensing my work or other sources. In case it is not possible to secure sufficient funds in order to organize the exhibition at this point, the money raised will be used to cover travel and accommodation expenses necessary for creating new work. In this case I will continue looking for alternative ways of carrying out the exhibition because I consider it to be a crucial step in the development of my project and my career alike.

If you decide to contribute to this campaign, you will help to create work which aspires to capture Greek landscapes through perspectives seldom used before. If you choose to support this Indiegogo campaign, you may do so in a form of:

  • donation                                                            
  • greeting cards or prints (choose here)   
  • photography workshop                                
  • photography services for your business

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t in a position to contribute financially or to purchase prints, please put in a good word for this project and post and share this page. All help is appreciated. And also, whenever possible, please, use the Indiegogo sharing tools.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me, I'd be glad to hear from you

You can get in touch by email at milangondaphotography@gmail.com

Thank you for all your support.

story:
I am a Tacoma based published photographer. I have a passion for black and white film photography the most. This project is shot with black and white film, then developed in house with my own hands, a labor of love.

This past year I have been putting together "BUSH" a coffee-table book: a fine art photography exhibition of art nudes. This collection celebrates the beauty of the natural female form, with an emphasis on pubic hair. With your contribution I would be able to focus on finishing the book and getting it in your hands! 

Contributions will towards:

  • Subjects
  • Printing Publication
  • Film
  • Chemicals

Thank you for your time and consideration,

Hollis Hall

story:
About the project

Hi, I am Gábor Kasza, photographer. I took a photo series two years ago. The title is:

“Concrete passages about closeness and coldness… and a couple of songs"

 I decided to make a photo-book with a special coherence of theme, design and form; at the intersection of these they create a whole new piece of art, a book. The unfinished concrete building structures and the grey concrete surface lead us through the pages. I designed a piece to echo its content, somewhere between a damaged, unfinished volume and a contemporary minimalistic shape. The look of the book gives the same unfinished impression as the buildings.

The soft cover has exactly the same weight, as the next pages. The back cover is a simple grey paper board. I used the red-coloured pages in a ratio corresponding to the red in the photographs. The Japanese Fukuro Toji binding style (bound-pocket books), the double-folded pages allude to the human couple story.

My decision to use real concrete as a material, that would be great to touch and to sense, turned out to be pretty tough. The designers, whom I presented the idea always gave me the same answer: “Who has time to do this? It’s not a business. It’s too thin and complicated, maybe even impossible.” Impossible? That sounded like a challenge, so I became interested in doing it myself. It is almost impossible to make, but not completely. I had to learn to work with concrete, learn how it works, what its edges are. I searched for a solution. It took over a year just to develop the prototype. Here is the result! I would like to publish, to reproduce and to spread it.

 

About the photo series

This is a poetic photo series about relationships. It is as if we are strolling amongst the pieces of a contemporary opera set. Just, the stories take place in concrete spaces.

There are smaller abstract compositions positioned between the figurative pictures. These compositions fill up with particular emotions, which progress on to other emotive qualities. Geometric patterns also draw the story on, as they return from image to image and in this way help to establish coherence in the series. There are some diptychs shot in the same space from two different points of view. Also, one pair of photographs was taken at exactly the same moment.

As the viewer will begin to appreciate, this photo series has no linear story. The connection between the images is unusual. It better resembles a wave or a musical composition. For this reason, we might consider this series to be a kind of “visual symphony”.

In contrast, the book format does indeed impose a linear experience on the viewer. That is to say the page position determines the point in time at which the viewer will encounter with a particular photograph. When we experience this linear time we encounter different elements, moods and tones. These are created by the fusion of many images that flow from start to finish.

And definitely, a book has a beginning, middle and end.

 

About the special edition

This is a limited edition, a signed book. The edition size is only 50 pieces. It has a shell which is a 4 millimeter thin, a concrete slipcase mould with a red paper lining. It is neither too fragile nor too heavy, weighing only 1425 grams. A paper case would be more fragile. The concrete slipcase is solid, protecting the book from physical effects. It is waterproof, oil-proof, UV and radiation resistant. The title of the book can be found as an imprint on the spine.

 

Technical information

Size: 290 mm x 205 mm (9.84 in. x 8.07 in.)

Print: offset, stochastic screening dots

Paper: matte coated 150 g and double bended pages 170 g

Hard cover at back

56 pages

16 images

 

Conception and design: Gábor Kasza 

Graphic design: Dániel Kozma, Diaméter Collective

Cast: Emese Cuhorka, Ilka Bardóczy, Árpád Forgó, Gyula Francia,

            Orsolya Kaincz, Anna Kudron, Csaba Molnár, Gáspár Téri, 

 

As seen in

The campaign goal

This is a fixed goal campaign which means it will only receive funds if at least €7000 is raised until the end of the 45 day campaign. This is the amount that can cover the printing, manufacturing & packaging costs of the minimum production volume.

 

Team

Special thanks: Judit Gellér, Márk Győri, Christopher Owtram, Mark Richards, Artbázis - Gabi Halász and Marianna Kiss, Meetlab - Biosz and Mátyás Csiszár, S'39 Hybrid Design Manufacture - Anna Baróthy and Bálint Tóth, Tripont kft - Péter Peti, 

There are framed works as well however the concept of the exhibited version is not exactly  the same.

 

Please, help us to share and spread it. We really need publicity for the success of this project. We love the articles about it or a social media post  ( Instagram, Facebook etc. ) Feel free to share this webpage with your colleagues, friends or anybody who might be in for a concrete book.

If you have any questions or need further information, please don't hesitate to contact me. info[at]gaborkasza.com

Thank you for your support!
story_txt: About the projectHi, I am Gábor Kasza, photographer. I took a photo series two years ago. The title is:“Concrete passages about closeness and coldness… and a couple of songs" I decided to make a photo-book with a special coherence of theme, design and form; at the intersection of these they create a whole new piece of art, a book. The unfinished concrete building structures and the grey concrete surface lead us through the pages. I designed a piece to echo its content, somewhere between a damaged, unfinished volume and a contemporary minimalistic shape. The look of the book gives the same unfinished impression as the buildings.The soft cover has exactly the same weight, as the next pages. The back cover is a simple grey paper board. I used the red-coloured pages in a ratio corresponding to the red in the photographs. The Japanese Fukuro Toji binding style (bound-pocket books), the double-folded pages allude to the human couple story.My decision to use real concrete as a material, that would be great to touch and to sense, turned out to be pretty tough. The designers, whom I presented the idea always gave me the same answer: “Who has time to do this? It’s not a business. It’s too thin and complicated, maybe even impossible.” Impossible? That sounded like a challenge, so I became interested in doing it myself. It is almost impossible to make, but not completely. I had to learn to work with concrete, learn how it works, what its edges are. I searched for a solution. It took over a year just to develop the prototype. Here is the result! I would like to publish, to reproduce and to spread it. About the photo seriesThis is a poetic photo series about relationships. It is as if we are strolling amongst the pieces of a contemporary opera set. Just, the stories take place in concrete spaces.There are smaller abstract compositions positioned between the figurative pictures. These compositions fill up with particular emotions, which progress on to other emotive qualities. Geometric patterns also draw the story on, as they return from image to image and in this way help to establish coherence in the series. There are some diptychs shot in the same space from two different points of view. Also, one pair of photographs was taken at exactly the same moment.As the viewer will begin to appreciate, this photo series has no linear story. The connection between the images is unusual. It better resembles a wave or a musical composition. For this reason, we might consider this series to be a kind of “visual symphony”.In contrast, the book format does indeed impose a linear experience on the viewer. That is to say the page position determines the point in time at which the viewer will encounter with a particular photograph. When we experience this linear time we encounter different elements, moods and tones. These are created by the fusion of many images that flow from start to finish.And definitely, a book has a beginning, middle and end. About the special editionThis is a limited edition, a signed book. The edition size is only 50 pieces. It has a shell which is a 4 millimeter thin, a concrete slipcase mould with a red paper lining. It is neither too fragile nor too heavy, weighing only 1425 grams. A paper case would be more fragile. The concrete slipcase is solid, protecting the book from physical effects. It is waterproof, oil-proof, UV and radiation resistant. The title of the book can be found as an imprint on the spine. Technical informationSize: 290 mm x 205 mm (9.84 in. x 8.07 in.)Print: offset, stochastic screening dotsPaper: matte coated 150 g and double bended pages 170 gHard cover at back56 pages16 images Conception and design: Gábor Kasza Graphic design: Dániel Kozma, Diaméter CollectiveCast: Emese Cuhorka, Ilka Bardóczy, Árpád Forgó, Gyula Francia,            Orsolya Kaincz, Anna Kudron, Csaba Molnár, Gáspár Téri,  As seen inThe campaign goalThis is a fixed goal campaign which means it will only receive funds if at least €7000 is raised until the end of the 45 day campaign. This is the amount that can cover the printing, manufacturing & packaging costs of the minimum production volume. TeamSpecial thanks: Judit Gellér, Márk Győri, Christopher Owtram, Mark Richards, Artbázis - Gabi Halász and Marianna Kiss, Meetlab - Biosz and Mátyás Csiszár, S'39 Hybrid Design Manufacture - Anna Baróthy and Bálint Tóth, Tripont kft - Péter Peti, There are framed works as well however the concept of the exhibited version is not exactly  the same. Please, help us to share and spread it. We really need publicity for the success of this project. We love the articles about it or a social media post  ( Instagram, Facebook etc. ) Feel free to share this webpage with your colleagues, friends or anybody who might be in for a concrete book.If you have any questions or need further information, please don't hesitate to contact me. info[at]gaborkasza.comThank you for your support!

story:
Projekt «Zentralschweiz abgelichtet»

Die Zentralschweiz liegt im Herzen der Schweiz und ist seit einem knappen viertel Jahrhundert meine Heimat. Währendem in den Metropolen Luzern und Zug, sowie am Zürichseeufer eine extrem hohe Besiedlungsdichte herrscht, findet man im südlichen und östlichen Teil der Zentralschweiz verlassene Täler mit wilder Natur.

Diese Vielseitigkeit möchte ich festhalten, weshalb ich Ende 2014 das Projekt Zentralschweiz abgelichtet ins Leben rief. An über 100 Tagen werde ich in diesem Jahr unterwegs sein um die Zentralschweiz bei bestem Licht fotografisch einzufangen.

Das Projekt durfte bereits eine grosse Aufmerksamkeit in den Medien geniessen. So berichtete beispielsweise  bereits die 20 Minuten, der Bote der Urschweiz und Radio Sunshine darüber.


Kalender 2016

Gemeinsam mit den zwei regionalen Partnern, der Druckerei Triner AG und Calendaria AG, ist ein Kalender für 2016 geplant. Der Kalender wird in der Grösse 53x30cm im Querformat erscheinen und 13 Blätter bzw. Motive (Titelblatt + 12 Monatsblätter) beinhalten. Die Blätter werden mit glänzendem Dispersionslack veredelt. Der Kalender geht im Herbst für 39 CHF (42 USD) pro Stück in den Verkauf.

Die 13 Motive, welche für den Kalender verwendet werden, stehen noch nicht fest, da ich nach wie vor fast täglich für das Projekt fotografiere. Die definitive Motive werden ähnlich wie unter Galerie aufgeführt ausfallen.


Verwendung des Geldes

Der gesammelte Betrag ist ein Teilbetrag der Druckkosten. Der Restbetrag werde ich investieren um meinen Traum definitiv zu verwirklichen.


Fotograf Sascha Krähenbühl


Zwei Stunden nach dem schweizweiten Sirenentest am 6. Februar 1991 erblickte ich das Licht der Welt. Ich erhielt bereits als kleiner “Knirps” eine eigene Kamera, mit der ich die “Welt” entdeckte.

Ab dem 16. Lebensjahr durfte ich für diverse Veranstalter und Clubs das Nachtleben fotografisch festhalten. So lichtete ich Wochenende für Wochenende feierwütige Menschen in toller Atmosphäre ab.

Als gelernter Informatiker geniesse ich die Stunden abseits der virtuellen Welt.

story:
Introduction

My name is Gonzalo Manera and I’m an action and lifestyle photographer based in Madrid. I have been snowboarding for over 22 years (more than half my life!) and I love it deeply. It has given me so much that I wanted to give back to the sport. In 2013 I created The Eight with that idea in mind.

On one side I wanted to offer the photographers a completely free outlet to show their photography to the world. On the other side I also wanted to have every snowboarder enjoy the best photography in the world. My main goal with the project is to inspire people to go out to the mountains and get more creative there and hopefully throughout their lives as well.

The book

Each book features eight photographers (thus the name!) and each has a number of pages to show their work as they envisioned it, without any editorial or creative constrains. This is the real value of the book, photographers showing their vision to the world on their own way, through their own eye.

The books are printed on the best quality paper for photography and we keep the price low so everyone can afford it. The book quality is amazing and we want it to be on people’s book collections for years to come. Be a part of snowboarding history.

If someone still can’t afford to purchase the books they always have the free digital version so nobody is left out. The goal is to have every snowboarder enjoy amazing photography, right?

These are all the book details:

  • 132 pages
  • Offset-printed and perfect bound
  • Full color on uncoated paper
  • Printed in Europe
  • Cover. Rives Design Bright White 250gr.
  • Interior. Olin Absolute White 160gr.
  • Size. 185mm x 245mm / 7.28in x 9.65in

    • Photographers & Colors

    Each The Eight book has a color instead of a number. We think photography is timeless, so no book is supposed to go before or after the other, they all stand on the same level. Without numbering we achieve this and give a little spin to the design on every book.

    All the images you see here for the new book are mockups. We still haven’t decided the color this book will be. The decision is based on the cover photo and we still have a couple of photographers who have not submitted their photos. The photographers who will be featured on this book are:

  • Dice-K Maruyama
  • E-Stone
  • Embry Rucker
  • Lorenz Holder
  • Marc Gasch
  • Oli Gagnon
  • Tero Repo
  • Vanessa Andrieux

    • We are really looking forward to seeing this book printed! It's going to be epic!

    The Black Volume

    On November 2013 we released the Black Volume, our first book. We printed 1,500 copies of it. Since the book has no sponsors or ads we had to finance the whole thing out of our own pockets and it was a huge investment. The idea was to finance the new book with the sales of the previous one, but as happy as we are with the how things have gone we haven't sold nearly as many as we would have needed. If you want to check it out you can download the Black Volume here. The photographers who were featured on the Black Volume are:

  • Dean Blotto Gray
  • Neil Hartmann
  • Carlos Blanchard
  • Cyril Müller
  • Daniel Blom
  • Jérôme Tanon
  • Matt Georges
  • Thomas Stöckli

    • The work on this book is amazing and each photographer gave a very personal and different look on snowboarding. We still have many copies of the Black Volume and we are offering a few perks with this volume in them. These two photos below are real photos, not mockups.

    Funding & timeline

    The funding we need is 12,000€. Most of it is for printing expenses and shipping. the rest is for design and layout of the book, web development, etc. The numbers might shift a little bit depending on the shipping costs to different countries but this is more or less how we are spending the money:

  • 8,000€ are for printing expenses. Good paper is expensive!
  • 1,500€ are for design, layout and web development
  • 2,500€ are for shipping

    • The timeline for this project is easy as we have a lot of things done. Most of the photographers have already submitted their content, so when the campaign gets funded we have to finish putting all the content together and send it to print. The printer takes usually less than a month, so we’ll be ready to ship by early May, 2015. That's just at the end of the season, so with the book you will get enough energy to make it through the summer!

    Support us!

    We hope you liked our project. If you want to find out more, below you have the links to all our social media outlets and our website. Feel free to check them out, connect with us and ask us any questions you might have. We won't be able to make this book without your support, so please help us make snowboarding a little more creative! Thanks!

Offset-printed and perfect bound
Full color on uncoated paper
Printed in Europe
Cover. Rives Design Bright White 250gr.
Interior. Olin Absolute White 160gr.
Size. 185mm x 245mm / 7.28in x 9.65in



 Photographers & Colors
Each The Eight book has a color instead of a number. We think photography is timeless, so no book is supposed to go before or after the other, they all stand on the same level. Without numbering we achieve this and give a little spin to the design on every book.
All the images you see here for the new book are mockups. We still haven’t decided the color this book will be. The decision is based on the cover photo and we still have a couple of photographers who have not submitted their photos. The photographers who will be featured on this book are:
Dice-K Maruyama
E-Stone
Embry Rucker
Lorenz Holder
Marc Gasch
Oli Gagnon
Tero Repo
Vanessa Andrieux

We are really looking forward to seeing this book printed! It's going to be epic!

On November 2013 we released the Black Volume, our first book. We printed 1,500 copies of it. Since the book has no sponsors or ads we had to finance the whole thing out of our own pockets and it was a huge investment. The idea was to finance the new book with the sales of the previous one, but as happy as we are with the how things have gone we haven't sold nearly as many as we would have needed. If you want to check it out you can download the Black Volume here. The photographers who were featured on the Black Volume are:
Dean Blotto Gray
Neil Hartmann
Carlos Blanchard
Cyril Müller
Daniel Blom
Jérôme Tanon
Matt Georges
Thomas Stöckli

The work on this book is amazing and each photographer gave a very personal and different look on snowboarding. We still have many copies of the Black Volume and we are offering a few perks with this volume in them. These two photos below are real photos, not mockups.






Funding & timeline
The funding we need is 12,000€. Most of it is for printing expenses and shipping. the rest is for design and layout of the book, web development, etc. The numbers might shift a little bit depending on the shipping costs to different countries but this is more or less how we are spending the money:
8,000€ are for printing expenses. Good paper is expensive!
1,500€ are for design, layout and web development
2,500€ are for shipping

The timeline for this project is easy as we have a lot of things done. Most of the photographers have already submitted their content, so when the campaign gets funded we have to finish putting all the content together and send it to print. The printer takes usually less than a month, so we’ll be ready to ship by early May, 2015. That's just at the end of the season, so with the book you will get enough energy to make it through the summer!


Support us!
We hope you liked our project. If you want to find out more, below you have the links to all our social media outlets and our website. Feel free to check them out, connect with us and ask us any questions you might have. We won't be able to make this book without your support, so please help us make snowboarding a little more creative! Thanks!

story:
This year, I got to meet some of the refugees living in Paris. Over the course of 3 months I developed a trust by sharing a sandwich with them over lunch, once a week. It was evident during my correspondence with them, that they are more than the sum of their current situation. While all of them have their own hardships in their story, it is the tenacity and aspirations of the human spirit which shines through. Ultimately, we all share the same needs and wants, no matter where we come from. 

Why CHRYSALIS?

"Chrysalis is the hard skin that is left behind when a caterpillar emerges from its cocoon fully formed as a butterfly". 

Each of the refugees partaking in this project is in a state of chrysalis,
waiting to break out of the hardened shell of its past, transitioning to freedom and bracing to soar.

The 3 Stages Of CHRYSALIS

The Interviews ( Accomplished. )
The Photoshoots ( To be shot after crowdfunding is over. )
The Presentation ( when postcard/booklet is printed after the photoshoots, a little get together will be held to deliver the copies and money to the Refugees. Donators who have selected this perk can take this opportunity to come and meet them in person to see the lives they helped.  )

100% of the proceeds from the sales of the postcard/booklet will be split equally amongst the seven Refugees. Watch their individual interviews below.

The Refugees

The Refugees In Depth Interviews

 

Assad Noori

 

 

Tsering Yang Chen

 
 

Saki Parviz

 
 

Basir Haji Oglu

 
 

Mohammad Ismail

 

 

What the Refugees are doing now?

Interview with coordinator Marie Nore

 

 

The Objectives Of CHRYSALIS And Its Importance:

* To depict the profile of Refugees in a positive light through imagery and storytelling, in ways that will transcend different cultures and languages with a core message of humanity, inclusivity and love. 

* 100 % of the proceeds generated by the sales of CHRYSALIS will be shared equally amongst all participating refugees.

*CHRYSALIS will be a testament of the refugees involvement and commitment to share their stories. As such, it will represent a platform allowing them to better describe their profile to all the stakeholders involved in their new life in France, from Social Workers to potential employers.

* To translate each of their narratives into something impactful and meaningful represented by the final postcard booklet. Each image will be accompanied by a synopsis written by me, explaining how the final image came to be. 

* 

When You Contribute :

It's a step towards removing the stigma of refugees. We have all witnessed the visuals in the media, but it merely shows a single facet of their life. They have dreams, hopes and aspirations like us all. I aim to photograph and portray them in a respectful, artistic, colourful and vibrant way. We can all be the cause that is needed to create a shift, in our understanding of them. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Where is the money raised going to :

It is important to state that I, Jase King, will be offering my vision, time and experience to the development of CHRYSALIS and will do this on my own time bearing all associated costs. I will sponsor some products from Viaggi By Jase King, my fashion and lifestyle company, as part of the reward perks for your contributions.

All the money received will be divided equally among seven of the participating refugees along with copies of CHRYSALIS after the production of the postcard/booklet which will be printed and shipped as part of the perks.

For Your Contribution / Perks :

We have included an exciting Perk system to cater for all levels of Donation. Have a look at our rewards now!

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

If we don't reach our goal to fund the printing and shipping of the postcards/booklet, we will still soldier on with a single photoshoot combining all the refugees into one editorial spread and printed on a single large postcard to fulfil the perks. We may also cancel the presentation event to keep costs to a minimum while the refugees will still get the amount raised split equally amongst all 7 of them.

Help Through Sharing

We understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
If you know someone who would be interested in what we are doing, get them to contact us.
Use the share tools here to share on your social media!

If you would like to receive real time updates with CHRYSALIS during photoshoots or behind the scenes, They will be stored as an Instagram Highlight at Jase King.

Together we can help make a difference to 7 individual lives that have been affected in ways that are unfathomable, in leaving their homeland, their families and everything they know to have a new start at life.

story:
A path towards myself.

"Northern India, South Asia and  Middle East"

Argentina, 2014

Introduction

For me, art is a way of knowing ourselves and finding inner freedom. Six years have passed since I started taking pictures of my daily life. In this time I have discovered how I could learn about myself through the practice of photography.

Photography became a bridge towards my inner life. Rather than separating me from living, it brought me more closer to experiencing life in the present moment.

For me, creativity and life are of the same force of nature, and we humans share this creativity quality as well. Something part of who we are.

And in my case, when I first recognized this force, it was a moment that profoundly changed my life.

 

Sempo and Sayuri in Argentina, 2013

 

Un camino hacia mi misma

Northern India, South Asia and I hope I can continue to Middle East

Introducción

Han pasado ya seis años desde que empecé a registrar las imágenes de mi cotidiano.

Un lapso de tiempo en donde descubrí que podia aprender de mi misma y de mis procesos personales, a través de la práctica de la fotografía.

La fotografía empezó a ser mi puente hacia mi misma y pude descubrir que esta práctica  en vez separarme de la vida… empezaba a acercarme más a ella. 

Cada vez más, siento que gracias a mi conexión con la fotografía, tengo la oportunidad de observar y experimentar mi presente desde distintos ángulos.

Para mi, la fotografía puede llegar a ser una práctica meditativa, reflexiva de auto observación y aprendizaje. Por esta razón este proyecto tiene gran importancia para mí.

Es mi modo para llegar a compartir con otros mis experiencias y aprendizajes, abordando esta práctica como una herramienta de sanación y autoconocimiento.

 

 Zazen, 2014

 

The project

 

My idea is to create a photo diary while researching about self-knowledge, ancestral wisdom and ritual art, in different cultures around the world.

To make this project, I will be visiting India, Nepal and other countries in Asia and the Middle East. I am interested in the way each culture has developed practices and tools to connect with their own sense of divinity.

Practices that unify art with spirituality, such as music, dance and ritual, will be the focus of this photo diary.

Creativity as a journey towards ourselves, to our own divinity. 

From Kalbelia Gypsy Dance from Rajasthan in India to the Dervishes in Turkey,I will use photography as a bridge to bring these practices to you.

A diary about been human, about ritual and art. A diary about the many paths that exist and lead to oneself.

 

 

 

 

Winter, 2015

El proyecto

 

Mi idea es crear un diario fotográfico a modo de  investigación personal acerca del arte ritual, el auto-conocimiento y la sabiduría ancestral en diferentes culturas alrededor del mundo. 

Para realizar éste proyecto voy a emprender un viaje hacia India, Nepal y otros países de Asia y Medio Oriente.

Estoy interesada en las prácticas y las herramientas que ha desarrollado cada cultura para conectarse con propio sentido de divinidad.

Prácticas que unifique el arte y la espiritualidad, como la música, la danza y el ritual. 

Es la creatividad como un camino hacia nosotros mismos, un camino hacia nuestra propia divinidad. 

Desde la Danza gitana Kalbelia en Rajasthan en India hasta los Derviches giradores en Turquía, usaré la fotografía como un puente para traerles estas prácticas a ustedes.
 

Un diario acerca de lo humano, acerca del ritual y arte. Un diario acerca de los tantos caminos que existen que conducen hacia uno mismo.

 

A fire ceremony in Summer, Colombia, 2017

 

Support

 

From getting a perk to spreading the word, I will be more than grateful in any way you can support this project. I really want to make this dream come true.

I have beautiful rewards such as printed high quality pictures, creativity sessions for those that want to explore their creative been and off course all backers will be mentioned as collaborators ♡♡ in the project and on the future printed photo book...

I also want to express my deep gratitude to my friends and family that helped and supported me while I was doing this campaign:

Carolina Acevedo, Ignacio Padilla, Marcela Sanchez, Jesse Balsko and Tala Al-khudhairi Thank you!!!

All my love,

Ale

 

Spring, 2018

 

Soporte

 

Desde recibir una recompensa hasta pasar la voz, estaré más que agradecida con ustedes con cualquier tipo de apoyo. La verdad tengo muchas ganas de realizar este gran sueño.

Tengo lindas recompensas como impresiones de alta calidad, sesiones de creatividad para cualquier tipo de persona que tenga ganas de explorar su parte creativa y por supuesto... todas las personas que donen serán mencionadas como colaboradores ♡♡en el proyecto y el un futuro foto libro impreso.

 

También quiero expresar mi gratitud hacia mis amigos y familia por la ayuda mientras estuve desarrollando esta campaña.

 Carolina Acevedo, Ignacio Padilla, Marcela Sanchez, Jesse Balsko y Tala Al-khudhairi,

Gracias!

Todo mi amor ,

Ale 

 

About me

 

 

Alejandra León

www.diasdecolorblanco.com

@diasdecolorblanco


I am a Colombian Photographer, Illustrator, Filmmaker and Mountain Lover.

My personal interests lie in creating bridges between different type of artistic and creative practices with techniques of self-knowledge and healing.

My work aims to restore the bond that we humans have with ourselves and with nature, by sharing cultural and ancestral knowledge from different types of communities of the world.

 

Cordoba Argentina, 2017

Sobre mí

Alejandra León

www.diasdecolorblanco.com

@diasdecolorblanco

Nací en Bogotá y soy Fotógrafa, Ilustradora y Cineasta. 

A parte de ser una gran amante de las montañas y la naturaleza, mis intereses se encuentran en crear puentes entre distintos tipos de prácticas artísticas y creativas con técnicas de auto conocimiento y sanación.

Mi trabajo intenta re-establecer el vínculo que tenemos los humanos con nosotros mismos y la naturaleza, al compartir conocimiento cultural y ancestral de distintas comunidades del mundo.

story:
Company Summary

Phil has worked as an industrial photographer and freelance portrait photographer in Western Toronto for 10 years. He has found that personal customer relationships are the key to repeat business and will open Phoebe's Photo Studio in downtown, Toronto, ON on that premise.

 

Company Ownership

WAVY PHOTO COMPANY is a sole proprietorship owned by Phil.  It will open in a leased 800 square foot studio in downtownToronto, ON.

 

Phil is a graduate of Brooks Institute of Photography in Santa Barbara, California and is a member of the Professional Photographers of Oregon and the Professional Photographers of America. He has 10 years experience capturing the special moments of people's lives.

 

Start-up Summary

The total start-up requirements are broken down as follows:

 

Start-up expenses are itemized in the table.

 

Start-up current assets include:

 

Furniture $4,000

Props $2,000

Inventory of albums, mattes and frames $4,000

Cash on hand at start-up $10,770

 

Long-term assets required to start include:

 

2-1.4" Camera $5,000

Computer $2,500

Electric Sign $3,000

 

Company Locations and Facilities

We will open in an 800 square-foot studio at 100 Main Street, the heart of the commercial district with ample free parking.  The space will be leased for three years beginning at $800 a month with cost-of-living adjustments made annually. 

 

The studio will have a highly visible electric sign and a 20-foot wide display window visible to passing foot and auto traffic. Customers will enter a public area with a counter, samples of our photographs and albums, and couches for waiting. A separate playroom with props and other toys will accommodate children with sitting areas for parents, while a utility area off the back door will be set up to accommodate pets and their props. Children, pets and props can be brought into the photography studio for their photographs.  An office and working area will be used for assembling the final product.

 

START-UP REQUIREMENTS

 

Start-up Expenses

Rent  $480

Insurance  $300

Filing Fees  $20

Utilities and Deposits $500

Paper  $200

Website Development $2,000

Marketing Consultant: Ad design, etc. $2,000

Personnel Costs for December $3,500

Software $1,000

 

 

TOTAL START-UP EXPENSES $10,000

story:
Short Summary

 In my high school days I was an avid Videographer. I struggled with social anxiety and it was almost impossible to get my foot in the door. After some research, I discovered I was not alone. 1 in 3 freelancers struggle from social anxiety and cannot get past that first step, selling yourself. I created CoCreate as a way for freelancers to connect an collaborate with others. I learned quickly that this wouldn't be easy to make feasible. After a startup course I took at the Richard Ivey Business School, I learnt that small and growing businesses do not have the time or money to spend all day looking for the perfect creator. 

We are developing a software that allows businesses and individuals to find a local Photographer or Videographer within their budget. Businesses are able to view different portfolios with different price ranges and hire the best one for their needs. 

How we differ from Fiverr and UpWork?

Fiverr and Upwork are freelance sites for people looking for cheap and accessible work. With Photo and Video you need someone local and someone you can trust. Fiverr and Upwork often have massive leisure times, miscommunication and other negatives that relate to poor outcomes. With CoCreate you get real time and local freelancers you can rely on. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need around $25 000 in funding for the development of the technology and marketing purposes. 
  • We have hundreds of thousands of potential customers through our partnered youtube creators. We will announce later who that is - 700k plus subscribers.
  • Any funds over $10 000 will leave you with equity
  • Any amount will give you access to our creators with no service charge for life.

The Impact

  • Helping small and medium sized businesses save time and money.
  • Helping creators with social anxiety find work.
  • Building a trusted community of creators businesses can rely on.
  • Future creator gatherings and events
  • by 2021 the digital marketing industry will be worth $300 billion.

Risks & Challenges

  • Competitors 
  • Showing businesses why we are valuable to them 
  • Consulting businesses as to why their creator is valued that high.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this in the Toronto, ON area
  • Send to friends and family

And that's all there is to it.

________________

________________

_______________

____________

If you have been wondering to start a business relating products or serving photography this is time to actually just kickstart. I know it`s romantic to say relating this Studio box, but it has never been this much easier with social media, eBay, amazon and now this GENi studio. So leave any excuse behind and see this technique by Gary Vaynerchuk who shows easy earning by flipping garage sale products on eBay: DailyVee Make an extra $100

________________

 

You want basic shadowless photo? Okay. You want  drop-shadow (left/right side) photo? Okay. 
Or do you want vertical with or without shadow? Okay. It`s all about aesthetics & its all possible with our studio. :)

A booklet that explains 7 hacks for using the studio more effectively. Thus, We are calling it "Hacklet". It`ll share pro lighting tips to improve your photography skills and help look the photos more crisp and better. Along with how to make an efficient use of playable design of studio. I`ve made this specially for everyday people(business owner) and amateurs.

________________

 

 

 

 

 

Lastly share with your friends if you think we did a great job!

Take care.♥️   :)

story:
Who are We?

Uğur Şenay is a 34-year-old Turkish professional photographer in Istanbul, with an extensive background in both the Theatre and the Music scene and a passion for architectural and fashion photography.

Cynthia Winterhalter is a 36-year-old Irish amateur photographer and small business owner, with a background in Theatre, Film and Business and a passion for writing and, of course, photography.

Our combined skills and experience are what make us a powerhouse and will eventually lead to our mutual success in this dream of ours. We share a love of photography and a yearning to make a steady living through beautiful Art. By doing so, we hope to spread some happiness and encourage other artists to follow their dreams and never give up.

What's it all about?

Our campaign is all about creating an opportunity to publish a series of artistic photographs which represent our individual styles, within a Photo Book depicting the interplay of Traditional & Modern aspects of everyday life throughout parts of South East Asia.  Exploring South East Asia and discovering all about the interplay between traditional aspects of daily life in comparison to newer, modern aspects will help manifest a collection of exciting photographs which we later intend to publish in the format of a photo book. The idea is to focus on how our own individual cultures and backgrounds influence our vision of certain scenes. Learning about other cultures along the way will also influence the result of the scenes we depict and how we choose to represent those. The outcome will be two different views and two sets of photographs, seen and interpreted differently through artistic choices and influences, with a focus on architecture, culture and people.

We will spend the next few months planning the trip, and then hopefully head off in January of 2018. A successful trip takes careful planning and organisation. It's a good thing making plans and lists is one of my favourite things to do! :)

The hope is that our collection of photographs from S.E. Asia will allow us to stand out from the crowd and show two unique and interesting perspectives. And that, friends, is what it's all about!

How your contributions will help:

Your contributions will help us achieve our mutual dream of combining influences, discovery, cultures and photography to create a beautiful collection of images to share with the world. First of all, we will be able to create a buzz around our travel adventures which, in turn, could lead to some exciting encounters whilst on the road.  The funds raised will help us to acquire some extra photography equipment necessary for such a project, pay for flight tickets and travel visas, secure accommodation (even if it just means buying a tent!), and all the insurances necessary for a safe and happy trip.  The rest of the funding will allow us to collate our best photographs, edit and produce a Photo book, as well as send you some great Perks too. Most importantly, your contributions will help  launch us into a journey full of creativity and future projects.

What We Need & What You Get

For this project, we aim to raise a total of $11'000

$1'500 will allow us to buy extra equipment necessary to perfect our photographs for Traditional & Modern South East Asia Series.

$4'500 will allow us to pay for flight tickets, travel visas, boats, trains and motorcycles if necessary to voyage across Asia, snapping at every turn. As well as pitch a tent or two when we get there, eventually stay in a hostel or two and meet like-minded, travelling artists.

$2'500 will go towards the production of prints of various sizes, other Perks, and the production costs for the Photo book itself.

The remaining $2'500 will go towards Indiegogo expenses, tax expenses and other expenditures, including any emergency needs.

In return for your generous contributions, we are offering several unique perks with a personal touch from us, which we are certain you will enjoy. You also gain a little piece of happiness and satisfaction in the idea that you helped made our dream come true, and for that, friends, we truly thank you!

Why Us?

What makes us a special team is the combination of our individual skills and our way of seeing the world from different angles. We come from different walks of life and backgrounds, which gives us a unique artistic view. The results visible in our Artwork will be truly unique and exciting.

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

If we do not manage to reach our full goal, we won't give up, we will work on a new campaign and try to find some other plans that could lead us to a successful career together. Perhaps a trip closer to home, jumping on a boat and heading over to discover the Greek Islands. However, we will attempt to set up a small exhibition of our local travel Photographic series from Turkey, so if you happen to be in Istanbul at the time we manage to do so, just drop by and check us out! Your money will be returned to you by Indiegogo as per the terms of the site.  

 

The Impact

The aim of this campaign is to give two artists an exciting edge in the local Istanbul Art scene. We hope that our photographs from far and wide will set us apart from other photographers and will allow us to reach new heights. Diversity and beauty will help us to grow our business and eventually lead to exhibitions, sales and further projects. It is a tough marketplace out there, as I'm sure you know, and we just wish to open the doors of opportunity a little bit wider. Our success will hopefully lead to a mini revival of the Istanbul art scene and we aim to spread a little love, art and happiness. It would mean the world to us if you could be a part of this amazing journey. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a situation to be able to help with funding, so here's what else you can do to help us realise our campaign:

Spread the word! Scream it from the rooftops, tell all your friends, family & neighbours, tweet about it, tag us on Instagram and mention us to anyone that can help!

And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You also gain a little piece of happiness and satisfaction in the idea that you helped made our dream come true, and for that, friends, we truly thank you!
Why Us?
What makes us a special team is the combination of our individual skills and our way of seeing the world from different angles. We come from different walks of life and backgrounds, which gives us a unique artistic view. The results visible in our Artwork will be truly unique and exciting.
What happens if we don't reach our goal?
If we do not manage to reach our full goal, we won't give up, we will work on a new campaign and try to find some other plans that could lead us to a successful career together. Perhaps a trip closer to home, jumping on a boat and heading over to discover the Greek Islands. However, we will attempt to set up a small exhibition of our local travel Photographic series from Turkey, so if you happen to be in Istanbul at the time we manage to do so, just drop by and check us out! Your money will be returned to you by Indiegogo as per the terms of the site.  
 
The Impact
The aim of this campaign is to give two artists an exciting edge in the local Istanbul Art scene. We hope that our photographs from far and wide will set us apart from other photographers and will allow us to reach new heights. Diversity and beauty will help us to grow our business and eventually lead to exhibitions, sales and further projects. It is a tough marketplace out there, as I'm sure you know, and we just wish to open the doors of opportunity a little bit wider. Our success will hopefully lead to a mini revival of the Istanbul art scene and we aim to spread a little love, art and happiness. It would mean the world to us if you could be a part of this amazing journey. 
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a situation to be able to help with funding, so here's what else you can do to help us realise our campaign:
Spread the word! Scream it from the rooftops, tell all your friends, family & neighbours, tweet about it, tag us on Instagram and mention us to anyone that can help!
And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Anais Folk and I am the creator of this photo book. I am very invested in this project because throughout my whole life I was never happy with my body. I thought I was too skinny and too short. Being only 5'0" and 86lbs, I weigh the most I ever have currently. Shooting the pictures for this book caused me to look at myself and my body in a new light. It even inspired me to pursue modeling as a part time career. Every body shape is beautiful and it took me putting myself out there to realize just how beautiful mine was. By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping me to publish the books and help spread body positivity. I am hoping this book will help other girls and guys step out of their comfort zones and maybe even do something crazy like posing nude to realize how beautiful they are and that their bodies can be art. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am asking for $1,000 to create this photo book. The pictures are mostly done, but I still have a few more concepts I would like to add to the book. Plus I want to send exclusive photos to backers that will require a few more shoots to complete. There is also the cost of creating, printing, and shipping the physical book itself.
  • Each different level of money gets a different perk. Some of these include exclusive digital downloads, exclusive prints both signed and unsigned, and of course a finished version of the photo book including a signed copy for certain backers.
  • If my entire goal isn't reached, the funds will go towards exclusive, signed prints and other thank you gifts for the backers that did not end up getting the photobook and towards my modeling career.

Risks & Challenges

  • Some challenges may include the finished photo book not coming out the way I design it to. This is very easy to fix. Paying for a quality, well known, and trusted printing company that allows free reprints will ensure that the books come out the way they are intended to. Another risk would be not getting the funding for the project, but if this happens I will still send out prints of some of the picture that would be in the book to make up for it.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't afford to contribute, you can still tell people about the project by sharing it.
  • You can also follow me on Instagram (instagram.com/anaislovessyou) to help me grow my reach on social media.

story:
Wenn Sie Bücher oder Drucke erwerben möchten, dann gehen Sie bitte auf BACK IT oder VIEW PERK.

If you want to buy books or prints, then please go to BACK IT or VIEW PERK.

Si desea comprar libros o impresiones, vaya a BACK IT o  a VIEW PERK.

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Einleitung

 

"Im Winter 2016 brachte mich meine Reise entlang der Pazifikküste in ein kleines, nur über Boot zu erreichendes, Fischerdorf im Süden des Landes, unweit der Grenze zu Guatemala. Als ich nach einer Herberge fragte, sagte eine der Frauen, die Essen verkaufte, dass es dort keine Übernachtungsmöglichkeiten gäbe. Sie lud mich spontan ein, bei ihr und ihrer Familie zu bleiben. Ich sagte zu und schlief eine Woche lang dort, inmitten der Hühner und ich wurde von ihr und ihrer Famlilie täglich bewirtet.  Ich begleitete die Männer der Familie zum Fischen, lernte andere Dorfbewohner kennen und fotografierte einige von ihnen. Als ich zum Abschied fragte, was ich ihr und ihrer Familie schuldig sei, antwortete sie, dass sie nichts von mir haben wolle. Nach langem Insistieren meinerseits, ihre Familie erschien mir  nämlich als eine der ärmsten im Dorf, konnte ich sie erst überzeugen, ein wenig Geld von mir anzunehmen, als ich sagte, dass sie ihrem neugeborenem Baby ein paar Dinge kaufen könnte."

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Die Drucke / The Prints                                        

Sie können aus 36 Drucken in verschiedenen Größen wählen. Gehen Sie hierzu auf BACK IT und wählen Sie die gewünschte Größe. / You can choose from 36 photographs in different sizes.

 

Katalog hier herunterladen / Download Catalogue here

 

Lieferdatum: vorauss. Ende2018 / Delivering date: approx. End of 2018             

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Das Projekt
 
 

Der in Berlin und Mexiko-Stadt lebende Fotograf Michael Willöfer möchte mit dieser Kampagne die Reise-und Produktionskosten für den letzten Teil seines Langzeitprojekts und die Druckkosten für das Buch THE MEXICO PROJECT realisieren.

 

Der in Berlin-Lichtenberg und -Neukölln aufgewachsene Fotograf studierte Architektur in Berlin und Mexiko-Stadt. Seine fotografische Ausbildung begann er in Amsterdam und nach mehrjährigem Aufenthalt in Mexiko-Stadt absolvierte er dort und in Montreal einen Masterstudiengang der Bildenden Kunst im Bereich Fotografie.

 

THE MEXICO PROJECT startete vor 3 Jahren als eine Kollaboration mit dem mexikanischen Museum Laboratorio Arte Alameda und für die ersten sechs Monate des Langzeitprojekts erhielt er ein Stipendium vom mexikanischen Außenministerium.

Der zweite Teil des Projekts und die damit einhergehende sechsmonatige Reise nach Mexiko und alle damit verbundenen Kosten wurden vom Fotografen selbst finanziert, wofür er in Berlin die meiste Zeit als Stadtführer arbeitet, der  mit dem Fahrradtaxi Touren durch die Innenstadt von Berlin anbietet.

 

Für THE MEXICO PROJECT bereiste er über einen Zeitraum von insgesamt 12 Monaten verschiedene Bundesstaaten Mexikos, u.a. Chiapas, Oaxaca, Puebla, Veracruz, Estado de Mexico, Guanajuato, Morelos.

Inspiriert von Fotografen wie Walker Evans, Robert Frank und anderen handelt es sich bei THE MEXICO PROJECT um ein fotografisches Tagebuch, welches einen dialektischen Diskurs ermöglicht zwischen der krassen Realität und der optimistischen Hoffnung in dem Land.

Willöfer sucht die Auseinandersetzung vor diesem historischen Kontext zwischen den politischen Problemen auf lokaler und nationaler Ebene und der ausufernden Gewalt in Mexiko auf der einen Seite und dem Abwechslungsreichtum und Schönheit der Landschaften und Menschen auf der anderen Seite.

Dort in den Provinzen sucht er Formen der Reflektion über die verschiedenen Facetten des Landes und nach einem neuen Gesamtbild, welches sich einerseits von puren Gewaltdarstellungen und andererseits von der reinen Folklore distanziert und dem Alltäglichen ein neues Gesicht gibt.

 

Wenn Sie Bücher oder Drucke erwerben möchten, dann gehen Sie bitte auf BACK IT oder VIEW PERK.

Dort wird dann der Bestellvorgang eingeleitet.

 

Vielen Dank für Ihr Interesse!

 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

 

Artikel

aus der Rubrik Nachbarschaft, erschienen am 08.10.2018 im Berliner Tagesspiegel, von Robert Klages:

https://leute.tagesspiegel.de/lichtenberg/unter...

 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

 

Das Buch / The Book: 

 

 

 

 

 
Größe: 20x25 cm / Size: 20x25 cm / Hardcover

Seitenzahl: 150 / ca. 75 Farbabbildungen / Pages: 150 in total / approx. 75 photographs 

Lieferdatum: vorauss. Ende 2019 / Delivering date: approx. End of 2019

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

English

 

About the photographer

 

Michael Willoefer is a German photographer and artist currently living in Berlin and Mexico City. 

He has lived for over 7 years in Mexico City where he studied a Master Degree of fine arts at the prestigious San Carlos Academy of Arts and where he exhibited his work on various occasions.

 

About the project

 

The THE MEXICO PROJECT started 3 years ago as a collaboration with the Mexican museum Laboratorio Arte Alameda and for the first trip of 6 month he received a grant from the Mexican Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

The second 6-month- trip to Mexico to work on the project was financed completely by the photographer himself.

He now is launching this campaign to help raise funds for covering the costs of the last of his 3 trips through Mexico and for publishing his photography book THE MEXICO PROJECT.

 

The photos of the series were all taken on film in colour and black/white and with a medium format camera.

 

Artist statement

 

THE MEXICO PROJECT is a powerful 1,5 year photographic road-trip through the remote landscapes of Mexico.

Inspired by the thrilling works of photographers like Walker Evans, Robert Frank and many others, it is a conceptual photographic diary. THE MEXICO PROJECT is an encounter with the beauty of the Mexican landscape and its people, creating a dialectic discourse between the harsh reality and the optimistic hope for its future.

With the project THE MEXICO PROJECT I want to give back something special to all my beloved Mexican friends and all the extremely hospital people who helped during my stay in the country and during my work on this project.

In a time where Mexico is mostly with negative headlines in the news I want to give back a unique and eye-opening view on the country and its people. I strongly believe in a better future for them!

 

If you want to buy books or prints, then please go to BACK IT or VIEW PERK.

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Español

 

El proyecto

 

México y su población han vivido en los últimos años un periodo de violencia por el fenómeno del narcotráfico, que ha ampliado su radio de acción a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad. Esta situación ha generado consecuencias económicas, políticas y sociales de grandes magnitudes, sobre todo creado una imagen particularmente negativa del país en el extranjero.

Con su proyecto THE MEXICO PROJECT Michael Willoefer busca alejarse de imágenes violentas explícitas, con la intención de reflexionar de una forma íntima y sublime sobre la situación actual de México. Le interesa generar una serie de fotografías en las que se aborde otra perspectiva de la vida cotidiana en las provincias, sin dejar a un lado la violencia desde una vertiente pasiva en el que aparentemente hay calma y tranquilidad.

A través de su obra quiere involucrar al espectador, generar empatía y una nueva conciencia. Con THE MEXICO PROJECT quiere seguir directamente la herencia de grandes retratistas del paisaje urbano, como Walker Evans y Robert Frank que hicieron evidente el contexto-histórico de su país fotografiando de manera novedosa. De esta manera Willoefer nos muestra un país con huellas ignoradas, que marcan un tiempo muy específico, generando una pauta sobre una forma de ver distinta el país.

Al fotógrafo Michael Willoefer le gustaría poder conseguir financiamiento por este medio, para los costos de producción de la última etapa de su proyecto que le ha llevado tiempo de trabajo; así como para los costos de la impresión del libro México como conclusión de su proyecto.

THE MEXICO PROJECT comenzó hace 3 años como una colaboración con el Museo Mexicano "Laboratorio Arte Alameda" y durante los primeros seis meses del proyecto a largo plazo, recibió una beca por parte de la Secretaría de las Relaciones Exteriores de México. Posterior a eso, en la segunda parte del proyecto todos los costos han sido financiados por el propio fotógrafo.

Con THE MEXICO PROJECT ha recorrido varios estados de México por un período total de 12 meses entre Chiapas, Oaxaca, Puebla, Veracruz, Estado de México, Guanajuato y Morelos. El proyecto es una mezcla visual de dos géneros de la fotografía - fotografía documental y fotografía de paisaje urbano-.

Actualmente vive por temporadas en Berlín y la Ciudad de México. Estudió arquitectura en Berlín y la Ciudad de México. Comenzó su educación fotográfica en Amsterdam y después de vivir varios años en la Ciudad de México, consiguió estudiar una maestría en bellas artes de fotografía en la Academia de San Carlos de México y en la Concorde University de Montreal.

Si desea comprar libros o impresiones, vaya a BACK IT o a VIEW PERK.

Gracias por su interés.

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Financial Goal

 

The financial goal of this campaign is EUR 12.000.

 

Total Costs

 

The trip:

EUR     3.000 Travel costs for 6 month

EUR     2.000  Car rental for 6 month

EUR     1.000  KODAK Film 120mm

EUR        500 Travel Insurances

 

Note that the flight to Mexico is already paid by the photographer himself.

Additional travel costs will be paid by the photographer himself.

 

The Book:

EUR     3.500   Printing for 250 copies

EUR     1.500   Developing Films

EUR        500   High-End Scans

EUR        500   Graphic Design

 

Extra Costs:

EUR     1.000  Indiegogo Fees (estimate)

EUR         500 Packaging for shipments

 

 

Team

 

A big thank you to everyone involved in the development of the project. Without your support the project would not have been possible.

 

For conceptual support and tutoring:

Tania Aedo,

Director Laboratorio Arte Alameda, Mexico City

www.artealameda.bellasartes.gob.mx

 

Crowdfunding film Mexico City:

Jerónimo Palomares, Visual Artist and Photographer

www.jeromares.wix.com

 

Crowdfunding film Berlin:

Wiebke Heiber, Visual Artist and Gestalttherapist in education

www.berlin-kollektiv.de/index.html

 

Scans and digital prints Mexico:

Humberto Jardón, Taller de Gráfica,

Centro Multimedia del Centro Nacional de las Artes

www.cmm.cenart.gob.mx

 

Scans Berlin:

photography unlimited berlin

www.pberlin.net

 

Additional Support:

 

Marc Volk and Ulrich Hagel, Neue Schule für Fotografie Berlin

www.marcvolk.de

www.neue-schule-fotografie.berlin,

Adrian Gasser, 

www.adriangasser.ch,

Robert Klages,

www.robert-klages.de.

 

For any questions, recommendations and advice please  feel free to contact me:

My website:

www.michaelwilloefer.com

Twitter:

www.twitter.com/mwilloefer

E-mail:

michaelwilloefer@gmail.com

Tel. Berlin:

+49 (0) 152 23097544.

 

Thank you! Dankschön! Gracias!

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Biografie / Biography

 

1977 Geboren in Berlin / Born in Berlin  
2004-
2008 Studium Architektur TU Berlin / Studies Architecture at TU Berlin 
2012 Seminario Fotografía Contemporánea, Centro de la Imagen Ciudad de México
2014-
2016 Master-Studium Kunst-Akademie San Carlos Mexiko Stadt / Studies MFA San Carlos Academy of Arts Mexico City
2015 Austausch MFA an Concordia University Montreal / Exchange MFA at Concordia University Montreal

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

 

Sie können aus 36 Drucken in verschiedenen Größen wählen. Gehen Sie hierzu auf BACK IT und wählen Sie die gewünschte Größe. / You can choose from 36 photographs in different sizes.

 

Katalog hier herunterladen / Download Catalogue here

México y su población han vivido en los últimos años un periodo de violencia por el fenómeno del narcotráfico, que ha ampliado su radio de acción a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad. Esta situación ha generado consecuencias económicas, políticas y sociales de grandes magnitudes, sobre todo creado una imagen particularmente negativa del país en el extranjero.
Con su proyecto THE MEXICO PROJECT Michael Willoefer busca alejarse de imágenes violentas explícitas, con la intención de reflexionar de una forma íntima y sublime sobre la situación actual de México. Le interesa generar una serie de fotografías en las que se aborde otra perspectiva de la vida cotidiana en las provincias, sin dejar a un lado la violencia desde una vertiente pasiva en el que aparentemente hay calma y tranquilidad.
A través de su obra quiere involucrar al espectador, generar empatía y una nueva conciencia. Con THE MEXICO PROJECT quiere seguir directamente la herencia de grandes retratistas del paisaje urbano, como Walker Evans y Robert Frank que hicieron evidente el contexto-histórico de su país fotografiando de manera novedosa. De esta manera Willoefer nos muestra un país con huellas ignoradas, que marcan un tiempo muy específico, generando una pauta sobre una forma de ver distinta el país.
Al fotógrafo Michael Willoefer le gustaría poder conseguir financiamiento por este medio, para los costos de producción de la última etapa de su proyecto que le ha llevado tiempo de trabajo; así como para los costos de la impresión del libro México como conclusión de su proyecto.
THE MEXICO PROJECT comenzó hace 3 años como una colaboración con el Museo Mexicano "Laboratorio Arte Alameda" y durante los primeros seis meses del proyecto a largo plazo, recibió una beca por parte de la Secretaría de las Relaciones Exteriores de México. Posterior a eso, en la segunda parte del proyecto todos los costos han sido financiados por el propio fotógrafo.
Con THE MEXICO PROJECT ha recorrido varios estados de México por un período total de 12 meses entre Chiapas, Oaxaca, Puebla, Veracruz, Estado de México, Guanajuato y Morelos. El proyecto es una mezcla visual de dos géneros de la fotografía - fotografía documental y fotografía de paisaje urbano-.
Actualmente vive por temporadas en Berlín y la Ciudad de México. Estudió arquitectura en Berlín y la Ciudad de México. Comenzó su educación fotográfica en Amsterdam y después de vivir varios años en la Ciudad de México, consiguió estudiar una maestría en bellas artes de fotografía en la Academia de San Carlos de México y en la Concorde University de Montreal.
Si desea comprar libros o impresiones, vaya a BACK IT o a VIEW PERK.
Gracias por su interés.
 
______________________________________________________________________________________
 
Financial Goal
 
The financial goal of this campaign is EUR 12.000.
 
Total Costs
 
The trip:
EUR     3.000 Travel costs for 6 month
EUR     2.000  Car rental for 6 month
EUR     1.000  KODAK Film 120mm
EUR        500 Travel Insurances
 
Note that the flight to Mexico is already paid by the photographer himself.
Additional travel costs will be paid by the photographer himself.
 
The Book:
EUR     3.500   Printing for 250 copies
EUR     1.500   Developing Films
EUR        500   High-End Scans
EUR        500   Graphic Design
 
Extra Costs:
EUR     1.000  Indiegogo Fees (estimate)
EUR         500 Packaging for shipments

Berlin:+49 (0) 152 23097544. Thank you! Dankschön!
