story:
We take hearing for granted, its just something most of us need to perform on a day to day basis. One of the most pleasurable experiences we can have through sound is music. It has the power to alter our feelings, emotions and relationships with our world in a wide range of ways. Our first classic Disney tune we hear when we are children, that special song we danced to at prom with what we thought was the love of our life at 16 and that time when we used Coldplay to help get over the partner that just cheated on us! Music is so vital to our daily lives.

 

I want to help deaf people hear and to appreciate music as well, so they can feel the wonderful array of emotions that have even been scientifcally proven to benefit health and wellbeing. (http://aplus.com/a/15-ways-music-is-good-for-you?no_monetization=true)

 

I have attempted to illustrate music through the movements and the expressions of dance. By capturing and combining particular movements photographically, I want to communicate the changing emotions and feelings of a particular piece of music, so that these can be experienced by deaf people without the actual sound.

 

Share emotions of music with deaf people!

When I was a kid, there was a girl I really liked in town. I wanted to tell her how much I liked her and wanted to make the classic mixtape filled with tons of love songs to show my true feelings, so she would fall in love with me forever after!! But.......I coundn't because she was deaf. She couldn’t hear my words of love. She couldn’t listen to my love songs. I was very depressed by this stumbling block and vowed to never let this happen again.

So.....when I was in the University I decided to show the music to her instead. Not just play a music video or show a written lyric. I wanted to show her the emotion of music. Through several researches, I realized dancers represent music with their movement. 
Almost 2 years later, I exhibited my first art work in London and many more around the world after that and they have been well received.


Listening to Dance #1
Medium format film
Printed on Kodak Metallic paper 
Edition of 5
60 X 70 cm, 2011

Since I graduated university, I photographed series of dancers like a modern dancer, ballerina and Korean traditional dancer to see how they move to express emotion.


Listening to Dance #2 Ballet
Medium format film
Printed on Kodak Metallic paper 
​Edition of 5
60 X 70 cm, 2012


Listening to Dance #3 Salpuri
Medium format film
Printed on Kodak Metallic paper 
​Edition of 5
60 X 70 cm, 2011

Now I’m going to travel around the world to take photos of world traditional dances to show how these traditional dances express emotion of music and its story.

 

What I Need

This is not just a simple photo shoot project. It is a study and experiment of deaf people and what they can feel and appreciate music through a photo. Which means, a lot of time, research and effort are needed to understand music and dance to catch its emotion.

I need a small motorhome and will modify it into mobile photo studio. To Jump around countries and move to see a dancer or deaf people to their place, I reckon that a motorhome is the most reliable, fast and inexpensive choice.

Public transportation would be a cheaper option to travel around the world. But it is too expensive to carry all my photography equipment and could be damaged or be lost.

In a tight budget, accommodation is a lot. Hostel, Couch surf or Room sharing at Airbnb is cheap but the risk of lost property is too high. Film developing and scanning needs a proper space and fully controllable.

Photography studio is the most expensive choice. It cost me a rent per hour. Moreover, the flash light is very crucial equipment on my photography. If I get a wrong space and wrong light, then everything can go wrong.

As I reckon, motorhome will not only save my time, money but also maximize safety and my effort.


i.e Mobile Photo Studio Motorhome

Your support will push me hard to work with dancers, song writers and even deaf people in around the world. 

 

The Impact

According to the World Federation of the Deaf (https://wfdeaf.org/), there are about 70 million deaf people in the world. Which means they use sign language as their first language. It is not an international language, but there are universal features in it.

As explained by world class dancers I have consulted with, movement of fingers, arms, toes and even facial expressions can be used as a sign language, so it can make it possible for deaf people to understand and feel emotion of music just like able people can.

Therefore, my project will be developed as a musical emotional sign language, which will translate music for deaf people and give them those amazing emotions and connections with music as well.

 

What You Get

  • Listening to Dance #1 Postcard

    Size: 127 X 177.8 mm
    Printed on Fuji Crystal Archive Gloss paper
    Artist's sign on  the back
     
  • Handmade Leather Paper Tote Bag
    It is a paper bag. But it feels like a leather, looks like a leather. Very light, economical and looks so beautiful. 
    Moreover, it is water resistance!
    You can select a print from this project photo.



  • Printing i.e
     
  • Listening to Dance series Photo
    Final result, which is one of your amazing perks will be a multiple exposed photo taken with a medium format film camera (Mamiya RZ67 PRO II). Print on a 70 X 60 cm Kodak Metallic paper. Edition of 5.
    From Listening to Dance #1 to #3 photos were made already. So I can ship it by August 2017. From #4 to #11 will be made through this project and will ship by end of this year.

    Size: 60 X 70 cm
    Printed on Kodak Metallic paper
    Medium Format film
    Edition of 5

    Listening to Dance #1


    Listening to Dance #2


    Listening to Dance #3

My journey will be posted on my website and youtube every week. 
I will keep post about photo shoots and progresses on the Behance website.


Behance: www.behance.net/lazydean
Website: www.lazydean.com
Youtube Channel
Facebook: www.facebook.com/dean.shim
Twitter: www.twitter.com/DeanShim
Linked In

 

Follow me on one of my SNSs
Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Summary

Our mission is to create a body of compelling images of America's public lands that will be used to further the efforts to protect our public lands.

  • We are committed to following our passion for photography while contributing to an endeavor of greater good.
  • We will produce a body of work that will concentrate on our shared public lands and preserve those images for generations to come.
  • We recognize the power of visual media to inspire people to act and we will use this work to collaborate with like minded organizations to fight for the protection of America's public lands.
  • We need support and partnerships to be successful.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We calculate that it will require $140,000 over the next year to fund the project.
  • Funds will be used to outfit our existing 2012 Toyota FJ Cruiser, purchase a suitable off-road trailer, maintain a darkroom and production space, purchase film, developing and printing supplies, cover book printings and pay for travel expenses such as food and fuel.
  • We want to partner with conservation organizations that can expand our audience and benefit from our content in their efforts to protect public lands.
  • We want to collaborate with outdoor industry manufactures on advertising and public awareness campaigns designed to raise public awareness and participation in the fight to protect our public lands.

The Impact

Public access to the spectacular natural beauty of our country is a benefit some may have taken for granted, considering most of us have never known this country without public lands.

Imagine your favorite wild and natural area declared off-limits!

This could happen if federal public lands are sold or transferred to the state for management. Efforts to decommission national monuments and  put public land into state hands for the purpose of generating state income are happening now.

These short sighted and selfish efforts must be stopped!

Risks & Challenges

Funding is not enough to make this project successful.

We need partners and collaborators with the power and urgency to jump in and multiply our audience. We want to influence more people to act. The more book and print sales we generate the more we can donate back to conservation organizations directly involved in this cause.

We need your help! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this video and campaign!

You may know someone, that knows someone, that can multiply our success beyond measure.

With your help this project has the potential to continue infinitely. Our hope is that this year is so successful that we can continue this work to the end of our days.

Visit us on the web!

www.publiclandsproject.com

Instagram: @public_lands_project

Facebook: www.facekbook.com/publiclandsproject

Email: publiclandproj@gmail.com

story:
• Hello , my name is Gabriel Daniels , and I am the proprietor of Gabriel Daniels Productions . For the last 12 years I have been producing videos in my native home of Queens NY . I would like to continue in that vain , but at this time I am in need of assistance . As you know , it takes the best equipment in order to achieve this goal , and that is where you come in . 
  • I love to shoot videos , the only problem is that I need better equipment to do that . Your donation will help turn that dream into a reality . My desire is to become a prominent film maker , and bring my videos to life . 
  • This will give me the chance to produce great quality videos , and bring more people to my business . I believe that a camera can tell someone's whole life story , and inspire others to do the same . I want to be the person to continue making those videos , and telling that story.
  • The funding for my campaign will go towards the following 
  •  Canon XC10 - $2000
  • Canon LP E6N Lithium-Ion Battery Pack -  $64.00
  • Canon LC-E6 Charger - $53.00
  • Rode Stereo Mic - $200.00
  • 2 Sandisk Exteme Plus SDXC 128gb Memory Card $120
  • Manfrotto Slider Bundle (Tripod) - $700
  • That comes to a total of $3,137 , which is just enough to get the equipment and need , and start working on more videos .
  • As a token of my appreciation , you will get a free photoshoot (100 Photos) for your next event (Wedding , Concert , Church , etc)
  • If I'm not able to reach my goal , the funds will automatically be returned to indiegogo , so please support and donate as much as possible . If you're not able to give a lot , any amount is appreciated.

 

  • Your contribution will help me to network with more people , and bring my company into the forefront of media with clear-cut quality videos . The more you support , the greater chance we have of making that into a reality. I pride myself of great quality , and go above and beyond in everything that I do
  • Many of the obstacles that I face often involve not having enough light (or perfect focus) for the camera , or bad sound quality , which can sometimes distort a good video . The quality might be superb , but the audio would tell a different story .
  • Having a new camera and microphone will change the way that people see and hear my videos

 

  • If you know anybody that loves to make videos as much as I do , share the link with them and your friends (ex. Facebook , Gmail , Twitter , etc)
  • Just look for the share tool at the top of the page , and as easy as " 1,2,3 " , you'll be able to send .

And that's all there is to it !!!

story:
'The Invisible City': what is it?

First of all, let me introduce myself. My name is Federico Povoleri, I'm 52 years old and I am an Italian photographer, film-maker and writer (see my portfolio here). During the past four years I have been exploring in depth Venice, my home city, and I took many unusual pictures of it. Using my own limited savings, I have started up a project called 'The Invisible City'.

#1

Through my photographs, I strive to show the true essence and soul of Venice, unseen to those visiting it.  Venice is a city that trough the millennia brought to us history and unparalleled architecture. Nevertheless, it is not a still-life exposition in a museum; it lives to a full extent trough his environment and inhabitants (the latter is too often a unappreciated perspective).

#2

Often the news are describing how Venice is suffocating and dying under the pressure of an invasion of tourists that are not showing much respect for this ancient city. What the reporters forget to point out is that the tourists are not exclusively responsible for the destruction of the city: the politicians and all the people that are taking advantage of the city with in their mind the only purpose of monetary gain they are responsible too. The ongoing exodus of inhabitants fleeing from the city is often lamented in the media, but nobody points out that there are incentives in favour of those moving outside the city limits. They forget to tell that the historical palaces, the shops and workshops have been sold out, without any care for keeping and preserving the city own culture.

#3

Those aforementioned are only a few aspects of what is by now a gigantic problem, since in the meantime the canal dredges and the large scale civil works (as the 'Moses' flood flap-gate barriers) have modified the ecosystem of the lagoon and provoked uncontrollable tides, as well as the waves due to boat traffic have increased the corrosion of the wooden foundation poles that held the whole city up.

In other words, Venice is dying. In stark contrast, the image that is shown to the rest of the world is akin to the cover of an advertising brochure, and does not reflect the soul of a place that is certainly no Disneyland.

#4

I am persuaded that respect comes from understanding. That is the reason why I am committed to disclosing the human nature of this city. An image can tell a story that is comprehensible to everyone: it can arouse emotions, send a message and, above all, preserve memory.

'The Invisible City' is not only a photographic book; it will contain also short tales in form of an imaginary dialogue between a Venetian and a tourist, in which an elderly inhabitant of Venice will recount short stories set within the 'Invisible City'.

#5

Expenses and Perks

Publishing a book that contains at least 100/120 pictures to be distributed in Italy and abroad it would require the sum of 22000 EUR, that represents a participations towards printing and distribution expenses covered by Publishing House.

Rewards for your contribution


For 10 EUR you get 3 autographed postcards from 'The Invisible City' collection plus your name as supporter published in my website
(postage & package not included)

For 30 EUR you get 'The Invisible City' e-book
+ 3 autographed postcards from 'The Invisible City' collection
+ your name as supporter published in my website
(postage & package not included)

#6

For 60 EUR you get The Exclusive High Water T-shirt (choice of sizes M, L or XL)
+ 'The Invisible City' e-book
+ 3 autographed postcards from 'The Invisible City' collection
+ your name as supporter published in my website.
(postage & package not included)

For 80 EUR you get One of the first 600 copies of the book 'The Invisible City' (Italian Version) autographed and numered
+ your name published as sponsor in the book
+ your name published as supporter in my website
+ 3 Postcards
+ the e-book
(postage & package not included)

For 120 EUR you get a Quality art print 24x36 on museum fine paper (29,7X42cm)  complete with authentication seal (please choose between the following: #1, #2, #3, #4, #5 #6 #7 #8, #9)
+ The Invisible City' e-book
+  your name as sponsor published in the book
+  your name as supporter published in my website
 (postage & package not included)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For 200 EUR you get a Quality art print 30x45 on museum fine paper (40X60cm)  complete with authentication seal (please choose between the following: #1, #2, #3, #4, #5 #6 #7 #8, #9)
+ The Invisible City' e-book
+  your name as sponsor published in the book
+  your name as supporter published in my website
 (postage & package not included)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For 500 EUR you get 3 X Quality art print 30x45 on museum fine paper (40X60cm)  complete with authentication seal (please choose between the following: #1, #2, #3, #4, #5 #6 #7 #8, #9)
+ The Invisible City' e-book
+  your name as sponsor published in the book
+  your name as supporter published in my website
 (postage & package not included)

For 1000 EUR you get a Quality art print 30x45 on museum fine paper (40X60cm)  complete with authentication seal, certificate of authenticity, numered and signed in limited edition of  only 10 Prints (please choose between the following: #2, #5, #8)
+ The Invisible City' e-book
+  your name as sponsor published in the book
+  your name as supporter published in my website
 (postage & package not included)

SPECIAL PACK:
For 250 EUR you get One of the first 600 copies of the book 'The Invisible City' (Italian Version) autographed and numered
+ The Exclusive High Water' T-shirt (choice of sizes M, L or XL)
+ 'The Invisible City' e-book
+ Quality art print 24X36 on museum fine paper (cm29,7x42) signed and complete with authentication seal (please choose between the following: #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8, #9)
+  your name as sponsor published in the book
+  your name as supporter published in my website
 (postage & package not included)

#7

The Impact

The book is going to count on substantial press reviews in Italy and it will be proposed to the editor's liaisons abroad, mainly in Germany, United Kingdom, France, United States and within the publish industry trade shows all over the world.


#8

Risks & Challenges

No Risks for contributors:

In order to actualise 'The Invisible City' project, we must obtain the starting
up sum by this present crow-funding campaign. The afore-mentioned sum is going
to trigger the editor's contract, resulting in the book to be printed and distributed; it will not happen otherwise. That is the reason why I am compelled to utilise the 'Fixed Funding' system, which entails a few disadvantages, i.e. the limitation to PayPal only as the funding option. Should this campaign fail to reach the required amount, every payment will be refunded and, alas, the book will not go to the printer. This latter is indeed the greatest risk and the funding is the real challenge that we have to face: from the moment in which we reach the required amount onward, everything is going run smoothly downhill.

#9

Other Ways You Can Help

'The Invisible City' needs any possible help in order to succeed. If you deem
this project to be worthy, please help to spread out the voice amongst your
friends, and propagate this campaign between acquaintances, including the use of
social media as Facebook, WhatsApp etc.

The warmest heartfelt thanks to you all.
story_txt:
'The Invisible City': what is it?

First of all, let me introduce myself. My name is Federico Povoleri, I'm 52 years old and I am an Italian photographer, film-maker and writer (see my portfolio here). During the past four years I have been exploring in depth Venice, my home city, and I took many unusual pictures of it. Using my own limited savings, I have started up a project called 'The Invisible City'.

#1
Through my photographs, I strive to show the true essence and soul of Venice, unseen to those visiting it.  Venice is a city that trough the millennia brought to us history and unparalleled architecture. Nevertheless, it is not a still-life exposition in a museum; it lives to a full extent trough his environment and inhabitants (the latter is too often a unappreciated perspective).

#2
Often the news are describing how Venice is suffocating and dying under the pressure of an invasion of tourists that are not showing much respect for this ancient city. What the reporters forget to point out is that the tourists are not exclusively responsible for the destruction of the city: the politicians and all the people that are taking advantage of the city with in their mind the only purpose of monetary gain they are responsible too. The ongoing exodus of inhabitants fleeing from the city is often lamented in the media, but nobody points out that there are incentives in favour of those moving outside the city limits. They forget to tell that the historical palaces, the shops and workshops have been sold out, without any care for keeping and preserving the city own culture.

#3

In stark contrast, the image that is shown to the rest of the world is akin to the cover of an advertising brochure, and does not reflect the soul of a place that is certainly no Disneyland.

story:
About Galaxy Photoz Inc

After the founder's close friend hired a wedding photographer, paid $4,500 and never received a single image, Leanne knew she had to change the way people went about hiring photographers. You as a customer deserve a safe payment process, upfront pricing, and same day service. So, Leanne set her sights on developing the safest and quickest way to hire a professional, vetted photographer at great prices with a 100% satisfaction guaranteed.

Whether it was to capture a wedding day, first belly bump or a great looking headshot for a new website. Everyone has had those moments where they wanted to hire an affordable photographer to capture those special moments. Wouldn't you dislike having to weed through random online searches, online ads and random review sites to find a really great photographer? Then when you find one that has potential they aren’t available for the date requested, they were extremely expensive or they simply didn’t respond. If you are lucky enough to find a match, there was always the possibility that the photographer wouldn't show up, were not very professional or you didn't get what you paid for...the photos. With Galaxy Photoz you can now say goodbye to those worries.

Radio features: Many are calling this the UBER for Photographers and the media have shown interest. Galaxy Photoz's Founder Leanne Ferguson has been featured on:

   

The Perfect Pitch 1280AM   What She Said 88.5 The Jewel      The Career Buzz 89.5

[Media Inquiries can be sent to leanne+media@galaxyphotoz.ca]

The Perks!

A huge thanks to the two major sponsors Droneafy and Harper Monroe who donated products to the Indiegogo Campaign. Galaxy Photoz is able to provide irresistible perks in return for your donations.

Suitable Worldwide:

$1149 The Drone You Came For! Similar to the Phantom 4.

ONLY 10 AVAILABLE


 

$499 for Your First Drone - Comparable to the Mavic Pro.

ONLY 10 AVAILABLE

 

$199 Virtual Reality Goggles.

ONLY 15 AVAILABLE

$15 for a Selfie Stick Micro.

ONLY 25 AVAILABLE


 

 

Suitable for photographers:

$49 for 50% off Membership.

$69 for a Camera Bag.

$49.99 for a Tripod Mini.

Suitable if you are local to Toronto:

$150 for Photography course with the CEO

$300 for Photo shoot with the CEO

Suitable for moms:

$24.99 for a Baby Swaddle

 


$15 for a Baby Headband

 

Mission         

To remove the lack of trust from the photography industry worldwide with an easy to use mobile and web platform. Galaxy Photoz Inc provides a risk-free zone for clients looking to hire a photographer for 9 types of photography with no guess work. A middle man (the Galaxy Photoz mobile app and web platform) means no more hesitation when leaving deposits, and no self-generated reviews. While you can book well in advance, you can also book for on-demand same day service, which means last minute bookings are very much welcomed.

Vetted Photographers On-Demand

The company will also separate expert photographers from mediocre ones. All photographers will be tested approved professionals, providing only high-quality, creative images and ensuring that you are 100% thrilled with your photos. The photographer will come to the location of your choice.

Whether you are hiring a photographer for a Corporate event, Maternity, Newborn, Cake Smash, Model Portfolio, Engagement, Wedding, Headshots, or Portraits, this company will bring trust and speed during the booking process while separating expert photographers from amateurs.

 

100% Satisfaction Guaranteed

Only talented photographers that are camera literate are on the platform. If by chance you are not happy, another photographer will re-shoot for free (this applies to non-events only. The first photographer will not be paid if you are not happy with the images).      

What We Need & What You Get

It's not just another app or marketplace!

  • The money being raised goes towards a seed round for go to market.
  • As a supporter, you will receive gifts ranging from Drones to Photo Shoots.
  • You will also be the first to see the new on-demand mobile app.
  • The funds being raised will go directly towards marketing, development, and expansion.
  • Perks include Drones, Virtual Reality Goggles provided by sponsors and way more!

Who Wins?

Starting with customers this marketplace does all the hard work for you. You no longer have to check google maps for the closest photographer, search dozens of review sites or call to check pricing and availability. This platform will have top qualified photographers in your city, truly, an Uber for photographers. Just choose where, when, and how much you want to pay, then sit back and relax. We'll do the rest AND you get 100% Satisfaction Guaranteed. Our goal is to provide you with vetted photographers that have proven skills to amaze you.

 

Photographers

This is built for photographers too! The founder has been a wedding photographer for almost 10 years. She understands that photographers want affordable marketing and less competition with amateurs. In most metropolitan areas photographers have to compete with the new guy who just bought a DSLR camera and calls himself a "professional photographer". All of the photographers here are vetted period. This means not every "photographer" will gain access to the platform, only the best.

With Galaxy Photoz photographers could now have a more fulfilling career. They'll be able to fill gaps in their schedule, manage their capacity and receive more requests for photography than they usually would. Galaxy Photoz is on a mission and part of that is to create opportunities for destination photography. As we expand to more regions, photographers can make money while they travel. Essentially they could become destination photographers, which is extremely rewarding. If you are a photographer and you have not joined, go here.

So photographers, do you want more exposure?

While downloading the app and accepting paid photo shoot requests is FREE for photographers, Galaxy Photoz offers more. If you would like to be one of the first photographers to offer a promotion on the platform we have you covered. When the new platform launches in June, photographers who would like more exposure will have the opportunity to pay a monthly premium.

A Monthy premium of $99 ($49 Today!) will include:

  • Hosting 4 promotional offers per month
  • Coverage on the customers home page
  • Clients that now come to you (perfect if you have a studio)
  • Galaxy Photoz will spread the word about your promotion
  • Tips to help you make your offer as lucrative as possible.  

 

A Global Presence

Not in Toronto? That's a good thing! By supporting this mission and letting the team know what city you are in, you will help us to better plan which city to launch next. When we launch the new mobile app in June 2017, photographers from around the world will be able to participate on the platform within the first few years. So, to all of you potential customers and photographers, let us know where you are.

story:
Be part of the challenge! Become a part in producing “365 Days of life thru windows and doors - 2018 in Romania” LIMITED EDITION ALBUM
I am Victor Razvan Olaru and I CHALLENGE YOU to challenge me for 365 days!
I’m a photographer based in Romania. I have been taking photographs ever since I can remember. Now, I am here to accomplish a 365 days photographic challenge from 1st of January to 31st of December 2018. From this will result a 365 photos album.
It's an album about life - my life in places around Romania in 2018. Like the photos you already see here, they will be catching the atmosphere, energy and, sometimes, the story surrounding a window or a door.

Technical details about the album:
Hardcover limited edition album:
Size: 210x297mm - A4 landscape closed, 210x594mm open, 372 pages
high quality art paper 170 g/m2, full color, 365 limited prints, signed and numbered.
Softcover limited edition album:
Size: 210x297mm - A4 landscape closed, 210x594mm open, 372 pages
high quality paper 170 g/m2, full color, 4015 limited prints, numbered.

POSTCARDS AND ANNIVERSARY CARDS - “365 Days of life thru windows and doors - 2018 in Romania” LIMITED EDITION POSTCARDS
Apart from the art book, this campaign will help me produce postcards and anniversary cards for all of us to share with our loved ones. Every postcard is limited to 12 numbered pieces.
Also, if you enjoy surprises, you can choose to be provided with postcards any time during 2018 by selecting the "random day card" perk.
The postcards and the anniversary cards are the same, A6 size. When you order a postcard, we will send it to your address with a stamp on it. An anniversary card, is also part of the limited 12 prints per day edition, the only difference is that we will send it to you in an envelope, leaving the back of the card blank (except the numbered part that indicates the no x from 12 prints).

MY INVITATION TO YOU
Surely, without Indiegogo I would not be able to finance the taking of one photograph per day throughout 2018 or their transformation into an art book.
I am truly happy to share with you all my excitement in bringing this project to life.
It’s a hard challenge, a whole year challenge. But I’m determined to put a lot of time into this and make it an interesting project for myself and for YOU, its backers.
The major risk I do see right now is not raising the amount needed to print the high-quality books and postcards. In this case I will only print pre-ordered items, rewarding only the initial contributors.
Let’s do this CHALLENGE!
So far, I have done exhibitions, magazine photos, studio and people photos, prints and posts, as well as photos showcasing various products. Pretty much everything related to photography.
Be part of this challenge and help me add this album to my list also!

Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share!

Cheers!
Victor Razvan Olaru

story:
Short Summary

I bestow eternal gratitude for checking out “Cosplay 24.” Allow me to introduce myself. I am Chase Lawrence, best known as the driving force behind Affliction Cosplay Photography. My work has been featured in an array of media including We Rise Magazine, Syfy, Arcade Sushi, Game Traders Live Magazine, and Birmingham News. In my project proposal, “Cosplay 24,” I would like to be allowed the opportunity to photograph twenty-four (24) different cosplayers from around the United States in locations that perfectly enhance the characters they portray. These talented 24 individuals will consist of both male and female participants that will showcase their lovingly amazing costumes and props, and most importantly, their unbridled passion for the character he/she represents.

What We Need & What You Get

With “Cosplay 24,” I wish to highlight the wonderful personalities behind the fabric and armor and explore extraordinary locations while we collaborate to produce the most incredible cosplay photography we have ever achieved. Furthermore, in addition to completing our dream to render incredible imagery, Zach Gables of Crimson Arrow Cinema will be accompanying us to document every step of the way through this journey. Collectively the Cosplay 24 team will work to produce the content for a polished documentary highlighting the successes and setbacks in completing the project. You will be able to also watch bonus behind-the-scenes footage and partake in a public Q&A session upon the project's ultimate completion. Please join me and Team Cosplay 24 in our efforts to go “beyond the mask,” and we will ensure you will enjoy the ride.

Thank you everyone who has taken the time to check out my project! Since Cosplay 24's Kickstarter beginning, many supporters have expressed active interest in accomplishing this dream more effectively and efficiently. I recently reevaluated different methods and logistic approaches and successfully arrived at a solution. Instead of the initial Kickstarter budget, Cosplay 24 will now only require $12,000 for successful completion.

The Documentary Crew:
Director of Cinematography: Zach Gables/ Crimson Arrow Cinema 
Director of Photography: Chase Lawrence/ Affliction Cosplay Photography

Where does the $12,000 go?
Travel and lodging cost for the "Cosplay 24" crew.
Locations fees. 
Food for crew and cosplayers.
Book publication, printing, and advertisement. 
Editing funding for the "Cosplay 24" Documentary.
Backers gifts: T-shirts, prints, post cards, buttons, and paper back "Cosplay 24" books. 
Shipping costs for US and World Postal

If we arrive at our stretch goal of $14,000, Cosplay 24: The Documentary will then evolve into DVD form for our supporters! That will be added as a extra gift to perks $80-$500 Choices 

The Impact

Ever since discovering the world of cosplay during my high school years 6 years ago, my enthusiasm to photograph cosplayers has been addictive and constant. Since cosplay has been more widely recognized and accepted as a positive outlet in recent years, I want to highlight the variety of people involved in this creative venture.

Over the years, I have seen people grow both as cosplayers and as personal individuals. Skill sets have tremendously expanded, and their upbeat enthusiasm has only become more intense. Both of which are clearly marked in the final products of fine craftsmanship and presentation as they mesmerize other fans with excitement and nostalgia. Though, as onlookers and bystanders, we often forget to recognize the persons behind the fantastic costumes.

Risks & Challenges

This project will combine the possibility of many risks such as: equipment failure, models being unable to appear due to sickness or issues, weather not cooperating, flights getting cancelled, or getting stuck in the fourth dimension of some alien planet. Haha I'm joking about the last one, but my crew and I have back up gear, models, extra flight plans, and plenty of time to sort things out as they should be. This will be a great struggle, but with your help, I believe my crew and I can accomplish this project.

Reassurance: 
We will be keeping a book of all purchases meaning everything that will be paid for will be posted online after the completion of the project so that you can see our expenses. Receipts will be kept for the public to view to show that the backers money is going to the project itself.

When the book is completed :
After the book is finished In Honor of my Grandfather and Grandmother Jerry Lee Stivener, and Roseann Stivener that passed away November 22, 2008 , and December 22, 2014. Money left over from the project after taxes along with 10% of all book proceeds will be donated to The American Cancer Society for colon rectal cancer. My grandparents will also be honored as supporters for the book as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

The old-fashioned way! Talk about Cosplay 24 with your friends

Social Media Interviews:
Cosplay Connection University Podcast: Click here to listen


Meet the cosplayers:

Lolita Zombie
Dynamite Webber Cosplay
Ashlynne Dae
Cinnabunny
Missyeru
Kitsune Kid
Betsy Bon Bon
Cinnabunny

Mira Scarlet Cosplay
Mira Scarlet is a 23 year old cosplayer based out of South Carolina who has been making costumes since 2012 and cosplaying since she was a little girl. She is entirely self-taught when it comes to sewing and constantly continues to improve her skills in hopes of one day being a full time costume designer. She is an extremely passionate cosplayer that strives for accuracy in the costume itself and also aims to bring the character she chooses to create to life. Being anime obsessed since the age of 5, having a father with a love for Marvel comics and an avid video game playing brother, she has been influenced by nerd culture all her life and truly enjoys making costumes that show her love for it. Some of the cosplays she has created herself include Celestia Ludenberg, Chun Li, Yowane Haku, Mako Mankanshoku and Psylocke

Allie Cat Cosplay
AllieCat Cosplay has been a positive force in the Cosplay community for 5 years. With the "anyone can Cosplay" motto in mind, she motivates others to excel in their own cosplays. In her Cosplay career she has won awards for best in show, best overall for craftsmanship, and also hosted and judged multiple costume contests. She has been featured in Kotaku, Fashionably Geek, Complex, to name a few. Her ultimate goal is to inspire and teach other cosplayers to Cosplay who and hat they want and is always happy to share the knowledge she has gained over the years.

Knightmage
Knightmage is a 35 year old cosplayer from Youngstown, Oh. This 15 year veteran Deputy Sheriff and Hollywood actor/stuntman has been cosplaying since 2012. Having the hobby turn into a passion, Knightmage focuses on not only bringing characters to life in his own unique vision but also how to constantly turn the hobby he loves into a charitable act of love. His creations as well as charitable deeds has garnered him praise in numerous national and international online and print publications such as ICosplay Magazine, Cosplay World, Screen Crush, The Richest, Anime News Network, The Examiner and many others. In 2014 Knightmage was awarded the Presidential Volunteer's Service Award from The White House for his charity work through cosplay.

Kay Victoria Cosplay
Kay Victoria is a 23 year old cosplayer from Central New Jersey. She has been cosplaying since 2012. Kay is self-taught in sewing and crafting her own cosplays. Within the last year she has been experimenting more with worbla armor and prop-making to apply to her future works. Her aspirations down the road are: to learn new techniques, work with more photographers, and meet other cosplayers to further evolve her talents in all areas of cosplay. She has been featured in arcadesushi, coscouture.com, and Nerd Caliber.

Sprout - Cater Moon
Sprout - Carter Moon is a 17 year old Cosplayer since 2010 based out of Atlanta, GA. For the past four years she's been improving her costuming and makeup skill in order to perfect her envision of the hobby. Moon adds every bit of detail that she can to each costume in order to bring that character to life. Her work in cosplay has also allowed her to begin using her hobby for volunteer opportunities at hospitals. She has won several awards, been featured on popular websites, and has been a guest at several south east conventions.





Rewards:


 All rewards will be ordered and sent out  after the book is completed. Please select what prints you want when you donate so that It will help allow use to make sure you get your reward correctly. We will also need your mailing information for the rewards to be sent to your location.

Sprout - Cater MoonSprout - Carter Moon is a 17 year old Cosplayer since 2010 based out of Atlanta, GA. Moon adds every bit of detail that she can to each costume in order to bring that character to life. Her work in cosplay has also allowed her to begin using her hobby for volunteer opportunities at hospitals. She has won several awards, been featured on popular websites, and has been a guest at several south east conventions.
Beautiful Syn Beautiful Syn is a 23 year old cosplayer based out of Atlanta, GA and has been cosplaying since 2007. For the past 2 years she has been bettering herself in the art of costuming and has won awards for it. Her passion for her characters shows in her work. Trying to get every little detail matched, she tries to be as thorough as possible. Her work as been featured on several websites such as Nerd Caliber, Zelda Informer, Adult Swim, Comic Book Movie, Broadway, and more.
MusableMusable is a Cosplayer and seamstress from the south east United States. She has been cosplaying and crafting since 2010.  Musable has been featured in several online blogs Share My Cosplay, Titans of Cosplay and Allstars Cosplay.  She has also had a multi page spread in We Rise Mag and is an award winning costume maker with awards varying from Judges Picks to Best Overall and Best Group.  Her best skill is that she creates all her own patterns and teaches others to do the same.

Maka Lee
Maka Lee is an avid anime and video game lover. She has been cosplaying since 2012 and is based out of Raleigh, NC.  Her goal is to make people smile and to bring a character to life. She has only recently started competing in craftsmanship competitions and has won best in show for her Gnar (League of Legends) costume and has been featured as a cover girl for the nationwide D20 Girls Magazine. She is a painter, artist, otaku and of course cosplayer enthusiast.

Z-Sasuke CosplaySasuke Oregame, also known as Z-Sasuke cosplay, is a well rounded individual with many talents and skills. He is mostly well versed in martial arts and spends most of his free time sculpting his body at the gym, and training for his cage fighting career. He has been on the cosplay scene since 2009 and is most well known for his Ryu cosplay. At conventions, you will most likely find him filming videos with his crew, plus two productions. He is also an aspiring actor and has starred in a few YouTube videos, a short film called "Color Blind" with Akioboy, and has done extra work in various other movies.
The Cel SagaThe Cel Saga is Celeste Oregame, a 28 year old cosplayer from Birmingham. She's been cosplaying since 2009, and has made a few hundred costumes ranging from altered, sewn from scratch, armor, and leather work. She's especially experienced with prop making. She also often makes costumes for friends and her husband, and has won about 10 awards at multiple conventions including a journeyman award at Dragon Con in the Steam punk Avengers group.
RCsixtyfourRCsixtyfour, a sixteen year old from east Alabama, is not your typical teenage girl. At an early age she found a love for gaming, sci-fi and anime. Being homeschooled since sixth grade she found more time to delve into these worlds. Through them she found out that there was a whole community of people that shared her interests and enthusiasm. By the time she reached the age of fifteen she had found creative and imaginative ways to express her love for these genres. 
Tham"Samantha McMichael (Tham) has been a cosplayer for many years, debuting her first costume in 2006 at Anime Weekend Atlanta. Ever since then, she's taken on cosplay as her main hobby, and has even entered her costumes in several competitions. She has won several Best in Show awards as well as numerous other titles, including the Yume Prize Regionals at Metrocon 2010 and was flown to NYCC to compete in the finals. Since then, she has continued to cosplay and plans to begin competing in the Master division again."
LonstermashLonstermash is a 44 year old cosplayer who has lived his entire life in Los Angeles and has been cosplaying since the fall of 2012 (though his cosplays were all Halloween costumes at one time).  He works as a physical therapist and has been heavily involved in fitness since he was only 15.  This love of fitness began with his desire to have a body that looked like Sylvester Stallone's in the mid 80's, heavily being inspired by the Rocky movies.  Therefore, although he usually cosplays as Wolverine and is best known for this, in truth, his favorite cosplay is his Rocky Balboa.  He does all of his own special effects make up, too, and loves injecting humorous versions of his world-famous Wolverine, such as using carrot claws and bunny ears on Easter.
Missy
Katie CosplayKatie George is an award-winning cosplayer living in Atlanta, GA. She has been cosplaying and competing since 2004 and has a BFA in Costume and Makeup Design for theatre/film from Auburn University. In 2012, Katie won the chance to represent the United States in the international World Cosplay Summit in Nagoya, Japan. In 2013, she was featured in the Emmy-winning PBS documentary Cosplay: Crafting a Secret Identity. In 2014, Katie joined the Heroes of Cosplay cast for season 1.5 on the SyFy channel. She has been a cosplay guest or cosplay events coordinator at several conventions in the US and Mexico, speaking on a variety of subjects related to cosplay in panels and/or judging cosplay contests for craftsmanship and performance.
Ben Be Jammin
Intraventus
Rewards:


Cosplay 24 T-shirts

2inch Pin Back Buttons

Post cards

Cosplay 24 beyond the mask

Posters and Prints
 All rewards will be ordered and sent out  after the book is completed. Please select what prints you want when you donate so that It will help allow use to make sure you get your reward correctly. We will also need your mailing information for the rewards to be sent to your location.

story:
Hey Everyone

Check out fine art nude photography on my site.

I am a photographer based in Charleston SC specializing in female nudes. My artwork is both exploratory and celebratory (More about that in my artist's statement.)

I am taking a trip to New York City in June. A friend of mine, a painter, mentioned he's going to NYC for the Whitney Museum Biennial exhibit. He invited me along to share a hotel room, cab from the airport and other expenses. We've done this trip many times before and it's a great adventure.

Despite having visited NYC several times, I've never done one of my art shoots there. It only makes sense because the city is full of models that fit what I'm looking for. So this time...

I'll spend two days shooting nudes in NYC.

I'll be shooting on rooftops and other interesting places the city has to offer. You may be surprised how many places you can do a nude shoot in a city. I've already been in touch with a few New York models to dream up ideas.

Perks will be a very exclusive, backers-only digital reward photos from the shoots, downloaded or on flash-drive. I may also use this to test out Indiegogo's funding model.

The Perks

Backers receive downloads of the pre-public photos. They are among the best, but not fully edited. You'll see a lot of frames that never end up published. I am also making a hard-copy portfolio for top-end backers. A few of the best images will receive hours of attention and finally become limited edition prints.

Here are some examples of my work in Charlotte North Carolina and various other cities.

To comply with Indiegogo's rules, more images (NSFW) have been placed on my site.

Digital Downloads

Hand-picked images, before the public sees them, and some will be exclusive to backers. Downloaded digitally for delivery as soon as they are announced. Optionally delivered on flashdrive.

Demi-Portfolio

Physical, printed portfolio: 20 pages on the highest quality Mohawk Proline Pearl heavyweight 140# gloss photo paper. Autographed by the artist. Full-color softcover 8x10 inches. Printed in the USA using the highest caliber methods.

Variety & Creativity

The key to this project will be to work with several models (three or four) and at least two locations. I don't shoot photographs just to catalog what people look like. We bring together a ton of creative energy to produce a unique images, ones you keep looking at and that will stick in your mind.

Check out fine art nude photography on my site.

story:
Short Summary

Vault apps are useful for hiding your own private pictures on your phone. However, they do nothing to hide your pictures on other peoples' phones. In addition, you have to go to the trouble of deleting the photos from everywhere but the vault.

Cammeleon has solved those problems by hiding the pictures in plain sight. In addition, you can add a password so that you can be sure that nobody can view the hidden picture even if they know to open it with Cammeleon.

Our small team consists of 3 people from 3 different continents that all share the same dream and passion.

What We Need & What You Get

We are striving to make the app better every day and we want it to stay free for everyone. Funding will allow us the resources to realize our dreams for the app:

  • Stopping Screenshots

  • Ensuring that only your intended recipient can see the picture, even with the password

  • Encrypting and sending videos or other kinds of documents just as easily as you can with pictures 

The Impact

Any additional funding will go into establishing our headquarters in the US, and creating more jobs to contribute to our community. 

  • The value in this app is the worry-free ability to send and share photos. As photos have become an extension of the way we communicate on a daily basis, we feel it is a necessity to ensure that everyone have the tools at their disposal to maintain their privacy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute monetarily, there are other ways you can help;

  • Get the word out to family, friends and coworkers. Be sure to share this campaign with the Indiegogo share tools.

  • Download our app today and take it for a spin. It's free!

  • Let us know what you like/don't like about the app. What features would you like us to add/remove? Your feedback is valuable to us. Email us at info@marbalsolutions.com

We look forward to bringing you the privacy that you deserve.

story:
The Concept

Both Rocky and I think there's far too much negativity and lonliness in the world today. If you follow us on Instagram (@rockydoggins if you don't), you probably know by now one of the things we value is trying to stay positive and finding silver linings when life shits on you.

That said, on March 10th for a minimum of 10 days: Rocky, myself and an assistant will be embarking on The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour: an interactive road trip all about bringing people together and putting at little happiness into peoples' lives, while creating a unique and interactive experience for those of you making this trip possible through your contributions.

The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour begins in Vancouver, BC, then continues through to the scenic Pacific Coast Highway down Washington. Then we hit Oregon (with a detour to the wonderful city of Portland). Next is the California coastline: San Francisco all the way down to San Diego. Once we're done, we'll head straight back up the I-5 hitting all the main attractions along the main freeway, then back home to Vancouver. 

One thing that can't be stressed enough is that we do NOT want anybody to feel obligated to donate. This is intended to be as fun and engaging experience and we understand not all our supporters have the means to donate! However, we like to give back how we can: so we'll be creating some personalized content as an extra thank you to our contributors.  

 

 

What Do We Need To Make This Happen?

In a nutshell, as much as you can help with. The more we can raise, the more we can make the trip more interactive and engaging! And hopefully with enough funds raised, extend it a few days! 

As of right now we're looking for a bit of help with the basics.

Asking for $3750, this is a complete breakdown of where the funds will go:

Car Rental - $750 - We currently plan on renting a mid sized sedan. Something with enough room, but not overkill. After a bit of research, a car for $75/day should cover the basics.

Gas - $600 - A rough estimate for about 7000 miles calculated with the typical gas mileage of a car the size of one we will be renting.

Lodging - $600 - While we plan on doing a good deal of camping, there's something to be said for spending a few nights inside. $60/night on average for a mix of hotels and camping.

Camping Gear - $300 - We need a decent compliment of camping gear to make this happen. There's not much point in buying new, so we did some costing at a used camping goods store. We can get absolutely everything we need to stay alive for just around $300.

Miscellaneous Supplies - $350 - Think the stuff behind the scenes. A GOOD roadside emergency kit, a first aid kit for 2 people and a dog, maps, a repair kit, gas cans etc. All the stuff that you don't normally think about.

Emergency Fund - $750 - Gotta have that fallback fund. Breakdowns, tows, medical emergencies, unexpected vet trips & other shit that can go wrong that I can't even begin to imagine.

There are obviously more costs to this whole thing, but I'll be taking care of those costs myself. Camera gear, cell phone plans, paying my assistant, extra insurances, personal gear, the list goes on. We're not looking to have the WHOLE trip funded. Just some help!

 

 

What's In It For You, The Donor?

Well now time for the fun bit! The part of all of this that makes The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour! unique. Like we said before, this is all about togetherness. We want to be together with you guys while we're on this adventure, so we want to make it as interactive and tailored to our fans as possible.

 

WHAT WE MEAN BY THAT

It's simple. When you donate, you get to be a part of this entire tour! Every single donation received will get a post, shout-out, tag and personalized message of some variety on the official @rockydoggins Instagram.

That is to say, depending on how much you donate, we will give you a post (might be a picture, might be a video) on either the @rockydoggins Instagram Stories or with enough donated, a main profile picture post. We will also send you a digital, full-size copy of the photo we post for you, as a little memento for you, and if you want, to share it on your other social media.

The message in the post is totally up to you! It can be to someone special, it can be promoting yourself or a business/product, or if you want, we can even make a little message from us to you.

 

Here, let's break it down a little more, in straight donation-to-reward terms:

$5 Donation - You get a tag and a small personal message on an Instagram Stories post. Instagram Stories will be the main device we'll be using to cover this road trip. It will have all of the day-to-day, hour-to-hour, minute-to-minute stuff. The behind the scenes and weird stuff.

$10 Donation - You get the same as above, Stories post, tag and small message, and you'll also receive a thank you post card featuring a prominent image from the tour.

$20 Donation - A limited amount of these. More meant to reward the early helpers. A $20 donation will get you a post on the main @rockydoggins profile. The main profile will be where all the big highlights of the trip go. The more polished shots, and familiar locations. Again, a post with a tag and personal message. You'll also get a thank you post card.

$25 Donation - This is for after the $20 dollar level runs out.  A $25 donation will get you a shared post on the main @rockydoggins profile. Instead of having your own post, you will share a highlight post with a few others. Don't fret though, everyone in the post will get their own shout-out, tag and personalized message. Also, a thank you post card.

$50 Donation - Again, a limited amount. This level will get you the same as the $20 level (a main profile post to yourself, post card), BUT you also get a comfy, limited edition t-shirt that will feature a picture and artwork specific to the tour.


$100 Donation - Only a handful of these. Same perks as the $50 level (post to yourself, post card, t-shirt), but you get to choose the location and subject of your post! (Except the 4 locations outlined in the $250 and $500 donation tiers).

$250 Donation - 3 of these. These are for the main @rockydoggins profile posts for prime locations. The icons. One for each state.

Washington - Space Needle, Seattle.
Oregon - The Gigantic Keep Portland Weird sign in Portland (this one is gonna be funnnnn!)
California - Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco

This tier also gets the limited edition t-shirt and thank you postcard.

$500 Donation - Just one. For the biggest landmark of them all. The gigantic white HOLLYWOOD sign in Los Angeles. For a $500 donation, you get the post featuring probably the most recognizable icon of film, and best known sign in America. All complete with a special personalized video message from us, to you posted on the main @rockydoggins profile. Here as well, you get the thank you post card and limited edition t-shirt.

 

Important Note: All main profile posts will have Rocky in frame, while the Story posts may or may not. We'll do our best to make sure you can see Rocky in all Story posts, but can't promise, as there may be something fun or important to see that we don't have time to set up properly. 

 

So There You Have It!

We hope now you can see where we're going with this! You help us spread a few good vibes and a some smiles, we give you fun, creative, unique and uplifting content, in new locations. All tailored for and by you, the fans.

And if you do decide to donate, get message us with an email address or your Instagram username so we can start talking perks!

 

What Could Possibly Go Wrong??

I mean honestly, for you, the donor, not much. We're not promising the world. We really want to drive home that this is going to be an important ongoing personal project important to Rocky and I. This tour is happening regardless of funding here. We would just like a little help. 

Because of the nature of this fundraiser, any perks promised will absolutely 100% easily be honored. Any physical perks, we fully expect to ship within 7-10 days of arriving home. (Time to select imagery, procure merchandise etc).

We also want to stress, again, that we in no way, shape or form want anyone to feel pressured to donate. Only give if you like and see the value in the fun of The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't use IndieGoGo, for whatever reason, let us know! Maybe we can work out an alternative.

If you can't contribute monetarily, do not feel bad even a little. The whole point of this entire thing is spreading positivity. If you want to help but can't, consider just giving us a share or a post on social media. Who knows if you know someone that wants in???

 

 

Any questions? Ask away! We'll build a FAQ as the questions come!
story_txt:
The Concept
Both Rocky and I think there's far too much negativity and lonliness in the world today. If you follow us on Instagram (@rockydoggins if you don't), you probably know by now one of the things we value is trying to stay positive and finding silver linings when life shits on you.
That said, on March 10th for a minimum of 10 days: Rocky, myself and an assistant will be embarking on The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour: an interactive road trip all about bringing people together and putting at little happiness into peoples' lives, while creating a unique and interactive experience for those of you making this trip possible through your contributions.
The Rocky Doggins West Coast Togetherness Tour begins in Vancouver, BC, then continues through to the scenic Pacific Coast Highway down Washington. Then we hit Oregon (with a detour to the wonderful city of Portland). Next is the California coastline: San Francisco all the way down to San Diego. Once we're done, we'll head straight back up the I-5 hitting all the main attractions along the main freeway, then back home to Vancouver. 
One thing that can't be stressed enough is that we do NOT want anybody to feel obligated to donate. This is intended to be as fun and engaging experience and we understand not all our supporters have the means to donate! However, we like to give back how we can: so we'll be creating some personalized content as an extra thank you to our contributors.  
 
 

What Do We Need To Make This Happen?
In a nutshell, as much as you can help with. The more we can raise, the more we can make the trip more interactive and engaging! And hopefully with enough funds raised, extend it a few days! 
As of right now we're looking for a bit of help with the basics.
Asking for $3750, this is a complete breakdown of where the funds will go:
Car Rental - $750 - We currently plan on renting a mid sized sedan. Something with enough room, but not overkill. After a bit of research, a car for $75/day should cover the basics.
Gas - $600 - A rough estimate for about 7000 miles calculated with the typical gas mileage of a car the size of one we will be renting.
Lodging - $600 - While we plan on doing a good deal of camping, there's something to be said for spending a few nights inside. $60/night on average for a mix of hotels and camping.
Camping Gear - $300 - We need a decent compliment of camping gear to make this happen. There's not much point in buying new, so we did some costing at a used camping goods store. We can get absolutely everything we need to stay alive for just around $300.
Miscellaneous Supplies - $350 - Think the stuff behind the scenes. A GOOD roadside emergency kit, a first aid kit for 2 people and a dog, maps, a repair kit, gas cans etc. All the stuff that you don't normally think about.
Emergency Fund - $750 - Gotta have that fallback fund. Breakdowns, tows, medical emergencies, unexpected vet trips & other shit that can go wrong that I can't even begin to imagine.
There are obviously more costs to this whole thing, but I'll be taking care of those costs myself. Camera gear, cell phone plans, paying my assistant, extra insurances, personal gear, the list goes on. We're not looking to have the WHOLE trip funded. Just some help!

story:
The photographer

My name is Debbie, I am a photographer, I'm a mother and wife, I live in a beautiful country and am part of a rainbow nation.

I would love to take you on a visual journey into some of the homelands and rural villages of our African people, share with you the color, the vibe and energy of her people through the lens of my camera and bring a little piece of Africa into your home.

The Project and Funds raised.

After 9 years of accumulating some wonderful, powerful images of the lives of people in South Africa It is my desire to share these incredible little moments in their lives with others, I would love to put together a high quality, hard cover photographic coffee table book that can be an interesting and visually pleasing addition to any home, office, hotel, guest house or other Establishment. 

Funds raised in this campaign will help me to bring my vision to life and create this beautiful coffee table book, funding will help me to print and self publish the book and enable me to showcase this magnificent country in a powerful and colorful way.

The perks

I am offering you the contributor the opportunity of getting a signed copy of my book. If you'd like to give the book as a gift to a friend, colleague or loved one I will include a hand written personal message of your choice. Some of the perks also include a signed printed image, the selection of images available to chose from is at the bottom of this page.

Print Design and production

I am currently working on design and layout and some of the images you see here plus many more will be included, there is text on certain pages giving interesting facts about South Africans and the various cultures. 

I will be self publishing my book and have a fantastic company lined up to help me every step of the way, from proof reading and editing to printing, binding and delivering the final product.  I don't  foresee any hassles in getting this book ready for your coffee table. 

Book Specifications:

Size: Approximately 8x12 inch (A4)

Cover: Hard cover with removable full color dust jacket

Number of pages: Minimum 120 pg (could be more depending on how design goes as well as funding. 

Print and Paper: Full color high quality print on white paper.

Layout samples below.

Why this project

I am often asked if I feel safe going to these rural areas, "how are you treated", "do they look after you", "what is it like?" When we fear the unknown and don't give ourselves a chance to find out, we often lose out on an incredible experience, on being part of something unique and different and wonderful. I would love show the world that South Africa is a loving, generous and giving country, I would love to introduce you to some of her people. 

A warm and Heartfelt Thank you 

whether you donate $1 or $1000 you will be helping to bring this very special project to life.

I would really appreciate you sharing my page with friends and family to help me reach my target.

Image selection for 8 x 10 inch prints

story:
Hi! This is Rita. Don't forget to watch the video above, with me and filmmaker Don McKellar talking about my book! 

 

Pre-Purchase GUARANTEES you get your copy(ies) of FOREST FOR THE TREES! directly from me, Rita Leistner. Thanks in advance!

 

 

BOOKS MUST BE PURCHASED IN ADVANCE OR THEY WON'T GET PRINTED ! 

Delivery of Books and Photographs

Books or photographs picked up in person will be reimbursed any shipping fees paid through this campaign. An RSVP invitation will be sent out, and books will be held onto for those who RSVP to a launch. All other books and photographs will be shipped. *If you don't see your destination in the shipping options please send an email to the campaign. 

Book Launch Schedule:

Toronto, at the Stephen Bulger Gallery, Saturday Oct 23rd

Montreal, location TBD, Saturday Oct 30th

Vancouver in the fall, location and date TBD

A great way to save on shipping! See friends! And see me! I can hardly wait to see you and put this book in your hands! 

Exclusive Offers and Discounts

See the "Perks" for

  • Advance Sales Discounts on Books
  • Campaign Exclusives Limited Editions 8" x 10" (edition of 50 only) and 12" x 18" Prints (Edition of 25 only) from the twin epic series The Tree Planters and Enchanted Forests!  ONLY AVAILABLE FOR DURATION OF CAMPAIGN. Please refer to bulgergallery.com Rita Leistner or contact Rita to see full collection. See sidebar for Perks: Sceefer, Creamer, Rookie Highballer, Pounder and Highballer Levels. If you buy a print, your name goes in the book!

 

A Lifetime In The Making

The decade from 1984–93 I spent planting trees in Canada in my twenties was among the most transformative of my life. I had never, nor have I since, pushed my body so hard and so brutally.

I became a photojournalist and documentary photographer, working primarily in war zones, and when people asked me what prepared me for that work, I told them “tree planting in Canada.” They were surprised because they didn’t know what tree planting was.

In 2016, I returned to the world of tree planting, spending four years photographing and filming tree planters to tell their story. This book is the final part of that project. It took me five years to get here, but it’s been a lifetime in the making. I hope you will join me.

— Rita Leistner, June 9th, 2021

 

About The Project

FOREST FOR THE TREES: THE TREE PLANTERS is the culmination of four years of immersion in the Canadian bush, and a life shaped by northern forestry. It is photographer RITA LEISTNER's fourth book of photography, and her first with DEWI LEWIS PUBLISHERS, UK.

FOREST FOR THE TREES: THE TREE PLANTERS features photographs Leistner made of a tightly-knit group of 100 professional tree planters she lived with over four years. These young labourers became the subject of her documentary film FOREST FOR THE TREES (2021), as well as two series of fine art photographs — the twin epics THE TREE PLANTERS and ENCHANTED FORESTS, which are currently in major Canadian collections and will soon be a touring exhibition.

BI-LINGUAL IN FRENCH AND ENGLISH

The photographs are paired with an intimate conversation between Leistner and her friend and collaborator, celebrated screenwriter, director and actor, Don McKellar — with an exquisite translation into Canadian French by Dominique Russell. 

 

 

The Photographer

RITA LEISTNER uses her camera to create portraits of communities in extreme conditions, exploring themes of purpose, struggle, and belonging.  Each unique world shapes her conceptual approaches and aesthetic styles, resulting in distinctive, large bodies of work that merge art and documentary and often consist of books or films in addition to photographs for installation. She has a Master’s degree in Comparative Literature from the University of Toronto, has lectured internationally and written extensively on documentary photography and photojournalism. Her work is in private, corporate and public collections and is represented by the Stephen Bulger Gallery in Toronto.

 

 

The Publisher

DEWI LEWIS PUBLISHERS, based in the U.K., is one of the world’s leading publishers of high quality and award-winning books of photography. 

 

 

The Book

Forest for the Trees

Photographs by Rita Leistner

In Conversation:

Don McKellar + Rita Leistner

French Translation by Dominique Russell

CAN $69.00 | Hardback, 250 pages | Pub. Date October 2021

160 colour photographs

250mm W x 290mm H x 20mm | 1.6 kilograms

 

 

In Conversation: Don McKellar + Rita Leistner

The book rounds off with an intimate, energetic and insightful conversation between Rita Leistner and her friend and collaborator Don McKellar.

DON MCKELLAR is one of Canada’s most acclaimed and prolific artists — a writer, director and actor working in television, theatre and film, often assuming multiple roles in a production. He co-founded the avant-garde theatre collective The Augusta Company with Daniel Brooks and the late Tracy Wright. He was a key player in the Toronto film scene’s “New Wave,” collaborating with Bruce McDonald and Atom Egoyan on such films as Roadkill (1989), Highway 61 (1991), The Adjuster (1991) and Exotica (1994). He received the Prix de la Jeunesse at the Cannes Film Festival for his directorial debut, Last Night (1998) and directed The Grand Seduction (2013), one of Canada’s highest grossing films. Screenplay credits include 32 Short Films about Glenn Gould (1993), The Red Violin (1998) and Blindness (2008). He won a Tony Award for co-writing the hit musical The Drowsy Chaperone. McKellar has also worked extensively in television, creating and starring in the cult-classic Twitch City and directing and co-staring in Sensitive Skin with Kim Cattrall. During the pandemic in Toronto, he collaborated with Rita Leistner on a new photographic project, Infinite Distance, slated to be a book and exhibition.

During the pandemic in Toronto, he collaborated with Rita Leistner on a new photographic project, Infinite Distance, slated to be a book and exhibition.

story:
90s nostalgia is entering full bloom.  Generation X came of age listening to this music and it was these songs that millennials cut their teeth on. I am one of those Gen Xers that grew up with this music and love it almost as passionately as I love 80s music, the subject of my previous book, “80s Redux.”

I set out to create engaging portraits of the artists of the 90s and find out more about their time in the limelight and where their lives have taken them. Their answers were open, honest, inspiring, and revealing. They offered profound and often funny gems of wisdom that will resonate with their fans and music lovers in general.

There have been quite a few artist memoirs that have received a lot of attention over the past year or so – books from Sleater-Kinney’s Carrie Brownstein, Sonic Youth’s Kim Gordon, Red Hot Chili Peppers Flea among others – that clearly show a thirst for stories from the indie rock decade. My book gathers artists from this spectrum and beyond to tell their stories and showcase them with beautiful photographs that show them in their current light. Artists in the book include Krist Novoselic from Nirvana, Tanya Donnelly from Belly/The Breeders/Throwing Muses, Ben Lee, Tjinder Singh from Cornershop, and many others.

The book is nearly ready to go - the photography is done, the writing nearly complete, and I've got a great partner with Girl Friday Productions.  This book will be one of the first under their new publishing umbrella that is a hybrid of self-publishing/traditional publisher model.  Funds earned  from this campaign go to the printing and editing of the book.  It's expected for a holiday 2021 release.

story:
You're invited to be a part of producing INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED - the fine art, hardcover companion book to INSTRUMENTHEAD, where photographer Michael Weintrob unmasks these musicians in a way that you've never seen before.

INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED

In 2017, after a successful INDIGOGO campaign, I was able to self-publish the award-winning INSTRUMENTHEAD, a fine art photography book where I portray musicians with their instruments covering their face.

In my new book, INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED, I will be unmasking the INSTRUMENTHEADS. You'll see all the same musicians in the same order, but you can see their faces. The new book will become a key to the original, giving you a deeper more in depth look at the scope of this work. To learn more about the backstory, click the image at the top of the page to watch our video. Complete your INSTRUMENTHEAD collection with this new book, or if you are new to the project you can purchase both books through this campaign. 

Billy Strings

What We Need and What You Will Receive:

To accomplish our goal of creating a companion book to the original INSTRUMENTHEAD we are going back to the same printer in Italy. We discovered many costs associated that we did not calculate in the first crowd funding campaign.  This time around our fundraising goal is higher to account for these extra costs.  With your support we will be able to make this happen.

We have got some really great incentives at every price point, including the book, a box set including the first INSTRUMENTHEAD book in a decretive box, a photo shoot and even your own INSTRUMENTHEAD exhibit. 

Additionally we are offering 15% off on all prints including INSTRUMENTHEAD and INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED. You can add this to your cart on the check out page by scrolling down and choosing your size. Not sure what print you want? I will be personally contacting you for a musical consultation ensuring you take home a perfect addition to your collection.

Check out the sizing charts below to see the scale of the pieces we offer: 

The Impact

Throughout the years I've benefitted many great charities through my exhibitions. With this campaign, $3 OF EVERY BOOK SOLD will be donated to the New Orleans Musicians Clinic (NOMC) a charity I am very passionate about. They support New Orleans musicians in mind, body and spirit. Click here to learn more about what they do 

                                                               

INSTRUMENTHEAD and Grafiche Antiga

What makes this book so special is that we will be partnering with the esteemed Grafiche Antiga again to produce the same high quality book as the first INSTRUMENTHEAD. Grafiche Antiga is an Italian printing company with a rich history and sustainable printing practices. The company has been entrusted in printing the iconic Pirelli calendars and has been in business for over 50 years.

INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED will be printed using solar powered clean energy and natural inks on certified FSC paper. We are so excited to create a book with an environmentally conscious  production.

Bootsy Collins

What Will the Book Look Like?

.[Sample Page Design - Not FINAL VERSION]

INSTRUMENTHEAD REVEALED Book Schedule

The design and production of a fine art book is a long and expensive process. We are aiming to deliver the book to INDIGOGO backers before the end of the year.

The Backstory

Over the last decade, I have been on the road showing my INSTRUMENTHEAD work through immersive art exhibitions and connecting with the public. I love seeing people's reaction to the images and diving into conversations about the art. One of the comments I often hear is "I wish I could see their faces." Well you're in luck...  

While creating this body of work, I also photographed the musicians where their faces were not obscured. They would show up with clothes, instruments and possessions to serve as clues for the guessing game in the INSTRUMENTHEAD portrait. By photographing in this setting I was able to shoot an honest portrait. 

I have had the opportunity to sit with this work over the pandemic and I believe now is the time to unmask the INSTRUMENTHEADS.

Many of the musicians I have photographed are “sidemen” and have performed with some of the biggest names in music. The harmonica solo on WAR's hit song "Low Rider" by Lee Oskar. The funky trombone sound of Fred Wesley that you hear on many James Brown and Parliment Funkadelic recordings. Tina Weymouth's bass grooves on every Talking Heads song.  The list goes on and on.

Zakir Hussain

I have always loved traveling to different parts of the world and learning about their indigenous music. In this book you will also see portraits of many musicians with their instruments and traditional dress. Cyro Baptista from Brazil with his pandero and berimbau. Zakir Hussain with an assortment of Tablas from India.  Wu Fei with her Guzheng from China. Hopefully these images will inspire you to learn more about the diversity of music around the world.

Wu Fei

At the start of this project, I was based out of my Brooklyn Studio where I photographed many of the musicians for this book.  When I wasn't shooting in my studio I traveled all over setting up pop-up studios everywhere from backyards to music venues, from New Orleans to Cape Town.  In this book there are 366 different artists. 

Kenny Olson

Risks and Challenges 

This is my second time crowd funding a book. The first time I learned so many valuable lessons that will allow this production to run so much more smoothly. I know what the design will be, where I am printing the book and when it will be printed.  I have a super solid team that worked with me on the first production and I feel confident that we have stream lined the process and have realistic expectations for delivering an amazing book.

Can't Support Financially?

You can help us by following and sharing our pages and campaign on the social networks: 

                

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME TO LEARN ABOUT THIS PROJECT! -MICHAEL
