story:
Welcome

Hello! Thank you for taking the time to visit my crowdfunding campaign. My name is Jessica, and I am opening a photography rental studio in Sacramento. Photography is a keen interest for me. It is my passion, and since 2008, I have developed myself into a lifestyle photographer, photography consultant, and photography instructor. I put more of an interest in my photography attending school, working in art galleries, and well-known camera supply stores. I have dedicated my time and energy for the past 12 years to learn everything I can about photography, and ready to share my education and experience with others by opening a fully equipped studio available for rent.

 

My Way Of Making A Difference

Photography can be an expensive career with gear costing $500 to $5000, and not every beginning photographer will be able to afford that.  Photographers starting will make anywhere from $25 to $75 per shoot. At that rate, You would have to do an average of 60-70 shots a month to afford the higher end camera equipment. There is no possible way. This studio is my opportunity to give back and help develop photographers' skills, reach goals beyond imagination, create beautiful portfolios, and become successful photographers. Studio 64 will help photographers who are not financially ready to purchase the equipment and allow them to have a successful photo shoot. 

Not only are we providing a space to grow your experience and creativity, but we are providing a judgment-free, safe haven for you to explore any photography. Studio 64 will be uplifting. A studio to build your skills and a studio to feel comfortable and let the creativity run wild. I could not be more enthusiastic to give back to the photography community. I want photographers like myself to do what they love and love what they do.

 

Why Sacramento?

Sacramento offers an arts scene that rivals other cities and has exceptional cultural, artistic, and leisure opportunities that enrich life quality, contributing to a vibrant metropolitan region. Sacramento is the most thriving city with creative people everywhere. The diversity and creativity are so welcoming. It's the main reason why I want to start the studio.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Studio 64 will be a fully equipped photography rental studio. It will give the artist the possibility and properties to grasp their goals and cultivate as a better artist. My goal is to provide the tools any form of photographer or videographer would need to achieve his or her dreams. Achieving this goal will include tips, lessons, and lectures on photography, along with staying equipped with the latest technology and giving exceptional customer service.

All money raised will go to the purchasing of equipment needed. For Example:

  • Lighting
  • Background stands and backdrops
  • Computers for editing
  • Props
  • Furniture
  • Office supplies

 

How Will It Work?

Customers will make reservations on an hourly or full-day basis. The best part, there is no credit card or deposit needed! The hours are from 10 am to 7 pm Monday-Friday. Weekends are closed but will offer appointments if required. The studio will offer three departments: an all-white setup primarily used for photography, a green screen for video, and a media station for editing. The stations will provide lighting, stands, backdrops, props, etc. There will be a lounge area for creatives to relax and vibe together, a changing station with a lighted vanity for models to get ready, and a coffee bar that will nourish the hard-working minds. The media station will consist of a Mac and PC, with the current editing software installed. For example, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe Final Cut Pro. All this at one low affordable price. If booking the whole day, customers will qualify for a fantastic discount. Bottom line, I want to help others reach their goals without worrying about the cost.

 

The Impact

While working in the photography field, I have noticed that there is not something like this in Sacramento. Yes, there are other studios available for rent, but they will come with limited equipment. Why limit the possibilities.  Also, there are no studios that will allow photographers to meet with clients and plan out their sessions. It's a little hard to talk about a photography session at a Starbucks. 

Fstoppers.com clarifies this reason in a short article.

https://fstoppers.com/business/5-reasons-you-sh...

Studio 64 will make it easy, fun, and stress-free! When complete, the studio will be a place for photographers and videographers to collaborate, work on personal projects, professional projects, and network with others in their industry.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a great deal of risk opening a company that somewhat already exists, resulting in failure, lack of business, or low customer repetition. I plan to grow the studio by devoting all the time and energy to the company and providing exceptional customer service to gain repeat customers. There will be a great deal of energy and skills into marketing for customers to know about the studio. Social media, blogs, ads, and word of mouth will be some of the platforms.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. I ask you to get the word out and make some noise for this campaign.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Because it works! Crowdfunding has become an accessible and practical way to raise money and successfully create projects. In today's world, it is essential for entrepreneurial artists like myself without significant funding or sponsors to rely on people like you to start my business. With your help, I have the freedom to lay the foundation for a successful business. As Indiegogo supporters, you will have access to several discounts and free enrollment to classes I teach.

I have 60 days to reach my goal, so anything you can do to spread this project will help. A simple repost on Facebook, creating a post on Instagram, or just telling your family and photography friends. I am just grateful for any help. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for sharing!

I truly believe in this project.

Jessica Falls

story:
Why This Book and Campaign?

Need more books!

Thanks to many of you, I have sold out of my first edition of the guidebook "Photographing Acadia National Park: The Essential Guide to When, Where, and How.” I continue to get requests for copies (that I don't have) and many of you sent in great suggestions for new locations and other revisions.

I’ve been working hard to put together the updated 2nd edition. I’m planning to publish it in late June 2021.

But your help is needed!

Publishing will be expensive! (Besides being the author and photographer of this book, I'm also the publisher—Analemma Press, LLC.)

To publish the 2nd edition will cost about $15,000, considering costs associated with printing, shipping, etc. I delayed publishing this book for a year due to the pandemic. Not surprisingly, the stay-at-home orders and strict travel restrictions had a significant financial impact to my business.

I am requesting your help to raise $5,000 which will cover a third of the cost to publish the book but will make a HUGE difference in my abilities to bring this title to life. I’m so passionate about Acadia, connecting people with this magical park, and helping others grow in their own photography. With the exciting changes I’ve made to the book, I’m hopeful I can continue to do just that through this 2nd edition.

As a thank you to YOU, my amazing community of valued supporters, I am offering pre-order discounts on books, eBooks, and workshops with me to help raise money to produce this exciting new edition.
 

What's This Book About?

My dear friend, fellow photographer, and park naturalist Bob Thayer summed it up best after reviewing the 2nd edition: "This is much more than a guide to photographing Acadia; it's a photography course in a book. This book will give you a deeper appreciation of Acadia, and make you a better photographer."

I've sure grown and learned a lot since 2014, when the first edition was published—and I’ve poured even more of my heart and soul into this new version. I’ve packed all I’ve learned into this 224-page book from my 450+ days in Acadia since 2009 as a three-time Artist-in-Residence, frequent workshop instructor in Acadia (and elsewhere in the United States), and visitor and lover of the park.

This new and improved second edition is my personal invitation to you to experience, enjoy, and photograph Maine's coastal gem through your own lens. You’ll hear how to get in the right place at the right time to create your very own treasured photographs from Acadia National Park. You’ll get professional-level advice on:

  • WHEN: The ideal times to photograph scenic vistas and intimate details, based on lighting conditions and seasonal events
  • WHERE:  Directions, with GPS coordinates, to 50 can’t-miss classic and lesser-known locations across Mount Desert Island, the Schoodic Peninsula, and Isle au Haut
  • HOW:  An 24-page Photography Basics section, 12 “Making the Photo” stories, and location-specific photography tips
     

This new guidebook includes:

  • 80+ new photographs with descriptions and technical details provided
  • 4 new locations: Kane Path, Thuya Garden, Upper Hadlock Pond, and Beech Mountain Trail
  • 5 new Making the Photos stories: One with the Lily Pads, It Takes Two, The Point of it All, Freddie the Leaf, and Finding Your Creative Voice
  • An expanded Photo Basics section in the front with updated instruction
  • GPS coordinates to the parking lot and/or trailhead added to each location’s directions
     

I'm also producing an eBook (PDF) for download to your mobile devices with the same content plus interactive hyperlinks and maps included!

Here's a sample location listing from Kane Path from the book:

 

Also, here's a sample of one of the Making the Photos stories, called "One with the Lilypads," from the book:

We've made an award-winning guidebook even better! To view more information about the original book, visit our website at www.photographingacadia.com
 

What's in it For You:

Pick your perk! (Click on the package listing on the right side of this website to order):

  • Get discounts on the new book and eBook!
  • See your name in the book forever! 
  • Get a 1-hour critique of your work with me
  • Polish your photography on a private half-day, 1-day, or 3-day workshop in Acadia with me
     

I won’t be offering these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so if you have interest in our guidebook, eBook, prints, and workshops, now's the time to buy!

 

Where Your Money Will Go:

All monies raised in this campaign will go towards the following:

  • The actual printing costs for 5,000 copies of the updated 2nd edition of the book
  • The cost of fulfilling perks (e.g. shipping, workshop logistics)
  • Indiegogo & credit card processing fees (~8%)
     

In addition, I will continue to donate 10% of this book's profits to the Schoodic Education Adventure residential program, an unsurpassed educational opportunity for children to learn about science and nature in Acadia National Park. So far, we’ve contributed over $5,500 to this program! So not only will your contribution help me produce this book, but together we can also make a difference for our future generations!  

 

Ways You Can Help:

  • Pre-order books and eBooks and receive some great perks like your name in the book forever, critiques, and even your own private workshop in Acadia!
  • Share this campaign with your camera clubs, friends, and family—please help spread the word with Acadia and photography enthusiasts!

 

Thank you for your support!

(Besides being the author and photographer of this book, I'm also the publisher—Analemma Press, LLC.)To publish the 2nd edition will cost about $15,000, considering costs associated with printing, shipping, etc. I delayed publishing this book for a year due to the pandemic. Not surprisingly, the stay-at-home orders and strict travel restrictions had a significant financial impact to my business.I am requesting your help to raise $5,000 which will cover a third of the cost to publish the book but will make a HUGE difference in my abilities to bring this title to life. I’m so passionate about Acadia, connecting people with this magical park, and helping others grow in their own photography. With the exciting changes I’ve made to the book, I’m hopeful I can continue to do just that through this 2nd edition.As a thank you to YOU, my amazing community of valued supporters, I am offering pre-order discounts on books, eBooks, and workshops with me to help raise money to produce this exciting new edition. What's This Book About?My dear friend, fellow photographer, and park naturalist Bob Thayer summed it up best after reviewing the 2nd edition: "This is much more than a guide to photographing Acadia; it's a photography course in a book. This book will give you a deeper appreciation of Acadia, and make you a better photographer."I've sure grown and learned a lot since 2014, when the first edition was published—and I’ve poured even more of my heart and soul into this new version. I’ve packed all I’ve learned into this 224-page book from my 450+ days in Acadia since 2009 as a three-time Artist-in-Residence, frequent workshop instructor in Acadia (and elsewhere in the United States), and visitor and lover of the park.This new and improved second edition is my personal invitation to you to experience, enjoy, and photograph Maine's coastal gem through your own lens. You’ll hear how to get in the right place at the right time to create your very own treasured photographs from Acadia National Park. You’ll get professional-level advice on:

WHEN: The ideal times to photograph scenic vistas and intimate details, based on lighting conditions and seasonal events

WHERE:  Directions, with GPS coordinates, to 50 can’t-miss classic and lesser-known locations across Mount Desert Island, the Schoodic Peninsula, and Isle au Haut

HOW:  An 24-page Photography Basics section, 12 “Making the Photo” stories, and location-specific photography tips 
This new guidebook includes:
80+ new photographs with descriptions and technical details provided
4 new locations: Kane Path, Thuya Garden, Upper Hadlock Pond, and Beech Mountain Trail
5 new Making the Photos stories: One with the Lily Pads, It Takes Two, The Point of it All, Freddie the Leaf, and Finding Your Creative Voice
An expanded Photo Basics section in the front with updated instruction
GPS coordinates to the parking lot and/or trailhead added to each location’s directions 
I'm also producing an eBook (PDF) for download to your mobile devices with the same content plus interactive hyperlinks and maps included!Here's a sample location listing from Kane Path from the book: Also, here's a sample of one of the Making the Photos stories, called "One with the Lilypads," from the book:We've made an award-winning guidebook even better! To view more information about the original book, visit our website at www.photographingacadia.com What's in it For You:Pick your perk! (Click on the package listing on the right side of this website to order):
Get discounts on the new book and eBook!
See your name in the book forever! 
Get a 1-hour critique of your work with me
Polish your photography on a private half-day, 1-day, or 3-day workshop in Acadia with me 
I won’t be offering these discounts once this fundraising campaign concludes, so if you have interest in our guidebook, eBook, prints, and workshops, now's the time to buy! Where Your Money Will Go:All monies raised in this campaign will go towards the following:
The actual printing costs for 5,000 copies of the updated 2nd edition of the book
The cost of fulfilling perks (e.g. shipping, workshop logistics)
Indiegogo & credit card processing fees (~8%) 
In addition, I will continue to donate 10% of this book's profits to the Schoodic Education Adventure residential program, an unsurpassed educational opportunity for children to learn about science and nature in Acadia National Park. So far, we’ve contributed over $5,500 to this program! So not only will your contribution help me produce this book, but together we can also make a difference for our future generations!   Ways You Can Help:
Pre-order books and eBooks and receive some great perks like your name in the book forever, critiques, and even your own private workshop in Acadia!
Share this campaign with your camera clubs, friends, and family—please help spread the word with Acadia and photography enthusiasts!

 Thank you for your support!

story:
Overview

Walking on a Blade: Life in the time of Coronavirus is a collective photobook, and a beautiful assemblage of powerful, captivating imagery, a compendium depicting a profound, moving, and unforgettable age in our shared history. 

Walking on a Blade exposes the invisible threats, the risks and struggles of daily workers trying to survive amidst the outbreak of Coronavirus in Iran.


Community Voices

There are far more threats to society caused by the COVID-19 pandemic than are immediately apparent from the surface or what we see in today's media coverage. Ordinary workers and small business owners in less developed countries such as Iran place themselves on the front lines every day without access to proper protective equipment such as masks, and gloves. They face great penalties for doing so since the alternative is the grave.

Walking on a Blade is a result of our revered photographers' hard and vigorous work, and contains unique and previously unseen images by our outstanding international team of photojournalists and is sure to incite a powerful emotional response amongst its readers. Along with our associate, the Pulitzer Center, and support from dozens of professionals worldwide. Our book is the epitome of professional photojournalism in the 21st century.

Our book features first-hand personal accounts of the Pandemic as it unfolded in a multitude of countries. It is full of commentaries by some of the world's most renowned photojournalists. Moreover, it is designed and conceived by a brilliant graphic & text designer and printed by a masterful printing house.

This tremendous project is produced by people of color, marginalized front-liners who worked arduously to bring this project to fruition. As a centerpiece or as part of a collection, it is a historic and impressive work that will impact both the viewer and the reader alike.

 

  • We are also proud to mention that this project has received the prestigious Pulitzer Center Grant, one of the most sought-after and respected grants in photojournalism.

  • Walking On a Blade, has been globally published and featured in major publications such as Der Spiegel, VG, Titre, and Zenith.

 

 

Fact Sheet

This 380-page book will be published in 2 editions:

  • Hard Cover editions: are large-format (10.5"x12") 26*31 centimeter, hardbound coffee table style book. This limited edition run is of 200 pieces—Each book will be uniquely numbered and corporately sealed.
  • Soft Cover Edition: are large-format (9.5"x12") 24*30 centimeter. This edition runs as 500 pieces
  • Full-color
  • 30 visual stories
  • 16 personal Notes
  • 266 images
  • 14 Photographers
  • 7 Introductions note by internationally renowned journalists and storytellers

 

As the project proceeded to the final section, our team was already all over the globe. Aside from our 14 photographers from 3 countries, we had one translator in California, USA, another two translators in Toronto, Canada, and a copy editor in Barcelona, Spain. This project is the final product of 28 dedicated souls from 12 cities, six countries, and three continents. Regardless of all the hardship and troubles of working in the quarantine amidst the coronavirus pandemic, they dedicated their time and love unconditionally to this project to portray substantial evidence of the unprecedented time and unique global crisis that future generations will look towards for years to come. 

Walking On A Blade is a small-time capsule of ourselves so that later we might realize that aside from all the troubles and darkness, hope and The Passion Of Life became the survival kit to assist humankind in overcoming these obstacles and passing the torch of life and living to the next generation.

 

 

Project contributors

This project is the product of our exceptional creative team’s culminated efforts and excellent and meticulous work. We at NVP Images wish to acknowledge each member. Our writers, book designers, translators, copy editor, fact-checkers, and photo retouchers. This book would not have been possible without your expertise and unwavering support, especially during such a difficult time. Thank you for your hard work and dedication in bringing this critical and emotional project to fruition. We are immensely grateful for what you have done.  

Writing Team: Helia Ghazi (Writer) – Nazli Eisazadeh (Writer) – Niloofar Ghorashi (Translator/ proofreader) – Maryam Aghvami (Translator) – Mina Rahimi (Translator) - Paroma Basu (Copy Editor)

Design Team: Kaveh Ashourinia (Book Designer) - Sina Shiri (Photo Retoucher)

Multimedia Team: Rouzbeh Esfandarmaz (Original Music Composer / Clarinet & Piano) - Siavash Kahrobaei (Singer) - Shahrzad Beheshtian (Singer) – Pat Stewart (Recording) – Mani Mozakka (Recording)

Book Editor: Pooyan Tabatabaei

Our visual storytellers:  Marcel Gerou, Pooyan Tabatabaei, Yasaman Dehmiyani, Jalal Shamsazaran, Mehdi Fazlollahi, Ali Sooteh, Mahdi Barchian, Kianoush Saadati, Mehran Mafibordbar, Hamed Barchian, Ingrid Nordstrom Halvorsen, Siamak Namvar, Matin Hashemi and Mina Noei.

Special thanks to:  Beak Studio – PAMARO – Naz Studio

 

____________________

Stunning mosaic of stories

From nail technicians to rug weavers, to ‘carriers’ who survive by pushing goods for people on metal carts, to music teachers, boxing instructors and those who bury the dead, the photographs offer a rare and intimate window into the Iranian society, a country that the West knows so little about. They also reveal more universal themes. It’s Iran but it could easily be Argentina, where I was born, or Romania, India, Lebanon and even pockets of the United States or England. Inequality knows no borders, and it has become the definitive and most urgent story of our time.   

Marina Walker Guevara
Executive Editor
Pulitzer Center 

____________________

 

 

Introduction to the book

These are hard and tragic times. We are all suffering.

The global Pandemic has claimed more than 2.36 million lives and continues to affect and disrupt everything with seemingly no end. There are over 500k dead in the US of A alone.  A century ago, our civilization was devastated by a similar pandemic commonly known as the "Spanish Flu." Fifty million souls vanished, yet there is little to no easily accessible information about this event.

During these unprecedented times, journalism and intimate personal testimony are crucial. Future generations will see the global pandemic as a turning point in history. However, it will be hard for them to imagine what this plight and struggle was like without objective on the ground photographic evidence.

Walking on a Blade is a revelatory journey into the unseen life, a window into the world of the voiceless by those that can have their voice heard. Our book is sure to leave a lasting impression on the reader, featuring powerful imagery and poignant personal accounts of life during the COVID-19 pandemic. It is also an intimate and introspective retelling of the day-to-day life of our esteemed members.

The photographic record of the 1918 "Spanish Flu" pandemic is lacking; period accounts are few and next to none. Even worse, there is hardly any visual evidence to corroborate that colossal incident in our not too distant past, partly due to the inaccessibility and technical barriers of the photographic medium and the fact that it coincided with the November 1918 armistice. 

Why does the suffering continue? Why are we not prepared for these sorts of calamities? Why must innocent people pay such a dearly price in this time of supposed "enlightenment?" These are essential questions in dire need of answers. Perhaps we should spend more time addressing these issues than focusing on material gain, commerce, personal riches and geopolitical affairs. After all, what is the point of existing if we cannot defeat a deadly, transmittable, yet curable virus? If we all die, who will reap the benefits? So many unanswered and unaddressed questions.     

Walking on a Blade: Life in the time of Coronavirus is the collective result of our revered photographers' hard and vigorous work. Our courageous members set their well-being and safety aside to document life as it has been since the onset of this devastating virus. Along with our associate, the Pulitzer Center, and support from dozens of professionals worldwide. Our book is the epitome of professional photojournalism in the 21st century. 

It is now 2021; we live in an era of unparalleled access to useful, objective, peer-reviewed information. Nevertheless, the casualty count keeps rising, and so does the number of infected. To make matters worse, new variants of the novel (new) Coronavirus disease keep emerging. What have we done wrong? How many more need to perish and suffer before we address this deadly respiratory disease efficiently and responsibly.

It has been 103 years since the "Spanish Flu" epidemic, yet we've done little to nothing to improve our response towards respiratory illnesses. Little to nothing to avoid this calamity. Covid-19 has destroyed countless lives because of stagnant and incompetent reactions by those entrusted with our wellbeing.

Even our global economy, robust and complicated as it may be, is now on its toes. Our pharmaceutical companies who pride themselves on bringing us cures for every ailment and discomfort struggle to deal with the reality that their patients will not die from cholesterol, heart failure, diabetes, depression, hypertension, STD's and cancer but Coronavirus.

Moreover, our logistical ingenuities, which span the globe, and are excellent at delivering commercial goods to our doorstep, are failing us during this distressful time. We don't need iPhones, Avocados, Cocoa beans or PlayStations; we need vaccines.

Walking on a Blade is a formidable visual indictment for those who needlessly suffer from oppression and geopolitical discrimination, as well as a testament to the resilience of the human spirit and collective will to surpass this dark point in our history. Hopefully, with this book, our progeny will do better and learn from our mistakes.   

 

 

____________________

There is more than one perspective

What strikes one first when looking through the projects in the following pages, is the dignity and empathy with which people in these stories are portrayed. This is an anthology of people documenting their own society during an epoch-defining epidemic. There’s a sense of intimacy that comes from being part of the community, from understanding what to look for.

Leonie Marinovich
Documentary Photographer & Photography Educator

____________________

 

 

This is where we ask for your help! 

The quality and standards we hold for this book are high. We sought to create a small time capsule of ourselves so that later we might realize that aside from all the troubles and darkness, hope and the passion for living became our survival kit. A survival kit to assist humankind in overcoming these obstacles and a means of passing the torch of life to the next generation.

The costs needed for the final stages included editing, printing, and marketing. We have spent 12 months waist-deep in the creative process.

Our book represents something different, an anthology of unique voices that hold the power to cross into new territory and shift culture. All of this has made us realize that we are destined to publish our baby at the grassroots level!

So we are asking for help in raising $20,000 to independently publish and expose our book by the spring of 2021. We can no longer do this alone and would be sincerely humbled and grateful beyond measure for your contribution.

 

Local Stories With Global Impact

By supporting this campaign, Walking on a Blade: Life in the time of Coronavirus becomes your project. An opportunity for you to impact the lives of those who are grappling to cope with this devastating disease. It is also a means to assist the front-liners, courageous journalists, who put their well-being and fragile mental health aside to document the harshness faced by a marginalized and mostly ignored population. Furthermore, Walking on a Blade is an inclusive project featuring multi-disciplinary professionals working on a variety of content such as text, image, multimedia, and an original soundtrack. It is also a celebration of diversity, conceived and produced by 24 uniquely talented women and men, all of whom are people of color and have diverse backgrounds.  

A testament to a time when everything stood still. This book aims to depict the Coronavirus Pandemic as it unfolded and propagated throughout the world. 2020 was an unforgettable and tragic year that impacted millions. However, like many critical moments in human history, they are destined to be forgotten if not comprehensively documented. This book serves as proof for further generations to avoid our mistakes, and when, not if, a Pandemic occurs again, they shall be better prepared to deal with it. They will have irrefutable visual evidence showing just what happened and why.

Your contribution will help us raise awareness about the devastation caused by Coronavirus, unmute the muted, and save lives.

 

 

____________________

Far Beyond The Stereotypes

Against this generalizing sorting by mechanical eyes, the photographs published in this book remind us that the real Iran exists on the ground and show in a sophisticated, singular and individualized way, that human stories are only made possible due to two conditions: physical proximity and the eyes of Iranians themselves. This book meets this challenge with excellence.

André Liohn
Photojournalist

____________________

 

 

Why Crowdsourcing

First, and probably most importantly, we want to keep the price of this book as low as possible, and that's the reason why we need you as our supporters. This project represents the power of community and togetherness, and we want as many people as possible to be a part of its making.

We have put a tremendous amount of trust into the higher purpose of this project, understanding that it is in service to something much greater than ourselves.  The first person we interviewed was back in January 2020, and since then over 30 people have entrusted their stories to the co-creation of this living, breathing vision. It is our great privilege to bring such a powerful collection out from the shadows, as an appeal that might ripple out into the world and create meaningful and profound change.  

In this unprecedented time in modern history, technology has given us the facility to reach many through the most straightforward and immediate means, the internet. With its many caveats, crowdsourcing is still to date the most efficient and prolific method of raising funds for trustworthy and legitimate purposes. We at NVP Images have selected the IndieGoGo platform for this sensitive task. Crowdsourcing has extended our broadcast, allowing us to reach as many people as possible so that they may help us achieve our goal. The contributions made to this fund will assist us in continuing our endeavor to document and distribute critical grassroots front-line journalism that gives the voiceless a chance to be seen and heard.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Understandably, the financial situation is challenging at this time. But if sharing this campaign with your family, friends, relatives, and co-workers is all you can do, it is more than appreciated. Thank you for sharing the link.

 

 

____________________

A Common Mortal Enemy

Before some of us run out of breath, these committed artists are telling stories of isolation and oppression against the Iranian people. The subjects depicted are subdued by mechanisms of social control where the self is hidden, restricted, framed and shadowed.

Paolo Patrizi
Documentary Photographer

____________________

 

 

The Passion of Life

Editor's note on the creation of Walking On A Blade

Since late March 2020, when we decided to go ahead with the coronavirus project at the agency, I had to develop a system to control our produced material as it was coming in from different places.

We had eight photographers in Iran, focusing on specific, narrow, and challenging subjects of Iranian society. Their task was to focus on the middle and lower classes of the nation, including daily workers who had to keep working despite the pandemic and the country’s lockdowns as there were no other alternatives for them.  This project is named ‘Walking On A Blade.’

Then we had one other visual storyteller based in Canada (like myself) and another in Norway, who worked on more personal and in-depth stories of the impact of the pandemic on their inner family circles. This project is named ‘Life in the time of Corona.’

Apart from those two projects, we had three other photojournalists in Iran, reporting on COVID-19 frontline-fighters. That project is called ‘Disinfecting Iran.’

In the middle of the preparation phase, the Pulitzer Center selected our first project as one of the COVID-19 projects to collaborate with and fund. The window for working without a timeline began to close, and I needed to stay on top of all the projects.

As a senior editor, I started to design digital contact sheets from the photo selection we had from every story we received from each photographer in Iran. Based on the time we had and the project's complexity, I had to write short notes or key points on the contact sheets to pinpoint and clarify some subtexts, mark a few as my first selections, and forward them to other editors either in Iran or Canada. They would then make their own selections, mark them with a different color, and send the sheets back to me. Afterwards, I would look to see which images had both marks: mine and the other editor’s. These selections were then added to the general pool for the project's pitch. 

While we were reaching out to publications and media outlets to introduce our project, we went through every single contact sheet again. We chose from the broader selection for each narrative for the purpose of solo presentation. Some projects had the potential to stand alone as their own story, while others were only good for collective work. 

By mid-May 2020, based on the produced material, the agency decided to create multimedia, as well as publish a book as another final product. After carefully reviewing our options, we hired a very talented musician and composer, Rouzbeh Esfandarmaz and his company PAMARO in the Netherlands, to conduct an original song for the multimedia segment. 

The second move was to choose a book designer and start the long journey of book publishing. After all the considerations and based on our long-standing work relations, the agency decided to collaborate with Kaveh Ashourinia, an artist with a creative and complex mind, from Toronto, Canada. His company, Beak Studio, started to plan and design the book while we were completing the projects. This was a challenging process for him as the project wasn't finished, and he and his team had to be flexible with us. We had weekly and then near-daily meetings, to help the book progress properly.  

As the project proceeded to the final section, our team was already all over the globe. Aside from our 14 photographers from 3 countries, we had one translator in California, USA, another two translators in Toronto, Canada, and a copy editor in Barcelona, Spain. This project is the final product of 28 dedicated souls from 12 cities, six countries, and three continents. Regardless of all the hardship and troubles of working in the quarantine amidst the coronavirus pandemic, they dedicated their time and love unconditionally to this project to portray substantial evidence of the unprecedented time and unique global crisis that future generations will look back to for years to come. 

‘Walking On A Blade’ is a small-time capsule of ourselves, so that later we might realize that aside from all the troubles and darkness of our time, hope and The Passion Of Life became the survival kit to assist humankind in overcoming the obstacles and passing the torch of life and living to the next generation.

Life is still beautiful.

Pooyan Tabatabaei

 

____________________

Knolling Humanity

This book not only documents a series of stories, but also emphasizes individuals who are often overlooked and shows how their lives were affected by the pandemic. The book's core concept is not to reflect people's difficulties and sorrows during and after the pandemic. It tries to tell the story of life.

Kaveh Ashourinia
Communication Designer

____________________


 

Risks

The project is well underway. We dedicated every second of our time planning, editing, proofing, and finally pre-printing the book during the past year. It was challenging to materialize and produce this anthology due to the many delays brought by the Coronavirus pandemic. It was equally demanding on our esteemed collaborators who risked their health and well-being to capture and document the contents of this book. In addition to that, we faced complexities and delays during the printing process.

Nevertheless, we are pleased to announce that the book is essentially ready, and our graphic designer Kaveh Nia, worked hard to have every page finished on time. Moreover, the beautifully designed artistic cover by Kaveh Nia is ready. After a year of intensive labor, our magnificent opus is complete. Thanks to our devoted team of tireless visual artists and professionals.

There are always factors outside of our control, printing problems, shipping delays, and unexpected glitches that may arise. We are confident that none of these potential issues will occur, but we live in a strange, tumultuous, and chaotic time. The Coronavirus pandemic might have an impact on shipping and logistics. If this were to happen, we would continuously keep our backers updated and immediately inform them of any changes or delays.

It has been 103 years since the "Spanish Flu" epidemic, yet we've done little to nothing to improve our response towards respiratory illnesses. Little to nothing to avoid this calamity. Covid-19 has destroyed countless lives because of stagnant and incompetent reactions by those entrusted with our wellbeing.
Even our global economy, robust and complicated as it may be, is now on its toes. Our pharmaceutical companies who pride themselves on bringing us cures for every ailment and discomfort struggle to deal with the reality that their patients will not die from cholesterol, heart failure, diabetes, depression, hypertension, STD's and cancer but Coronavirus.
Moreover, our logistical ingenuities, which span the globe, and are excellent at delivering commercial goods to our doorstep, are failing us during this distressful time. We don't need iPhones, Avocados, Cocoa beans or PlayStations; we need vaccines.
Walking on a Blade is a formidable visual indictment for those who needlessly suffer from oppression and geopolitical discrimination, as well as a testament to the resilience of the human spirit and collective will to surpass this dark point in our history. Hopefully, with this book, our progeny will do better and learn from our mistakes.   
 

 
____________________
There is more than one perspective
What strikes one first when looking through the projects in the following pages, is the dignity and empathy with which people in these stories are portrayed. This is an anthology of people documenting their own society during an epoch-defining epidemic. There’s a sense of intimacy that comes from being part of the community, from understanding what to look for.
Leonie MarinovichDocumentary Photographer & Photography Educator
____________________
 

 
This is where we ask for your help! 
The quality and standards we hold for this book are high. We sought to create a small time capsule of ourselves so that later we might realize that aside from all the troubles and darkness, hope and the passion for living became our survival kit. A survival kit to assist humankind in overcoming these obstacles and a means of passing the torch of life to the next generation.
The costs needed for the final stages included editing, printing, and marketing. We have spent 12 months waist-deep in the creative process.
Our book represents something different, an anthology of unique voices that hold the power to cross into new territory and shift culture. All of this has made us realize that we are destined to publish our baby at the grassroots level!
So we are asking for help in raising $20,000 to independently publish and expose our book by the spring of 2021. We can no longer do this alone and would be sincerely humbled and grateful beyond measure for your contribution.

 
Local Stories With Global Impact
By supporting this campaign, Walking on a Blade: Life in the time of Coronavirus becomes your project. An opportunity for you to impact the lives of those who are grappling to cope with this devastating disease. It is also a means to assist the front-liners, courageous journalists, who put their well-being and fragile mental health aside to document the harshness faced by a marginalized and mostly ignored population. Furthermore, Walking on a Blade is an inclusive project featuring multi-disciplinary professionals working on a variety of content such as text, image, multimedia, and an original soundtrack. It is also a celebration of diversity, conceived and produced by 24 uniquely talented women and men, all of whom are people of color and have diverse backgrounds.  

A testament to a time when everything stood still. This book aims to depict the Coronavirus Pandemic as it unfolded and propagated throughout the world. 2020 was an unforgettable and tragic year that impacted millions. However, like many critical moments in human history, they are destined to be forgotten if not comprehensively documented. This book serves as proof for further generations to avoid our mistakes, and when, not if, a Pandemic occurs again, they shall be better prepared to deal with it. They will have irrefutable visual evidence showing just what happened and why.
Your contribution will help us raise awareness about the devastation caused by Coronavirus, unmute the muted, and save lives.
 

 
____________________
Far Beyond The Stereotypes
Against this generalizing sorting by mechanical eyes, the photographs published in this book remind us that the real Iran exists on the ground and show in a sophisticated, singular and individualized way, that human stories are only made possible due to two conditions: physical proximity and the eyes of Iranians themselves. This book meets this challenge with excellence.
André LiohnPhotojournalist
____________________
 

 
Why Crowdsourcing
First, and probably most importantly, we want to keep the price of this book as low as possible, and that's the reason why we need you as our supporters. This project represents the power of community and togetherness, and we want as many people as possible to be a part of its making.
We have put a tremendous amount of trust into the higher purpose of this project, understanding that it is in service to something much greater than ourselves.  The first person we interviewed was back in January 2020, and since then over 30 people have entrusted their stories to the co-creation of this living, breathing vision. It is our great privilege to bring such a powerful collection out from the shadows, as an appeal that might ripple out into the world and create meaningful and profound change.  
In this unprecedented time in modern history, technology has given us the facility to reach many through the most straightforward and immediate means, the internet. With its many caveats, crowdsourcing is still to date the most efficient and prolific method of raising funds for trustworthy and legitimate purposes. We at NVP Images have selected the IndieGoGo platform for this sensitive task. Crowdsourcing has extended our broadcast, allowing us to reach as many people as possible so that they may help us achieve our goal. The contributions made to this fund will assist us in continuing our endeavor to document and distribute critical grassroots front-line journalism that gives the voiceless a chance to be seen and heard.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Understandably, the financial situation is challenging at this time. But if sharing this campaign with your family, friends, relatives, and co-workers is all you can do, it is more than appreciated. Thank you for sharing the link.
 

 
____________________
A Common Mortal Enemy
Before some of us run out of breath, these committed artists are telling stories of isolation and oppression against the Iranian people. The subjects depicted are subdued by mechanisms of social control where the self is hidden, restricted, framed and shadowed.
Paolo PatriziDocumentary Photographer
____________________
 

 
The Passion of Life
Editor's note on the creation of Walking On A Blade
Since late March 2020, when we decided to go ahead with the coronavirus project at the agency, I had to develop a system to control our produced material as it was coming in from different places.
We had eight photographers in Iran, focusing on specific, narrow, and challenging subjects of Iranian society. Their task was to focus on the middle and lower classes of the nation, including daily workers who had to keep working despite the pandemic and the country’s lockdowns as there were no other alternatives for them.  This project is named ‘Walking On A Blade.’
Then we had one other visual storyteller based in Canada (like myself) and another in Norway, who worked on more personal and in-depth stories of the impact of the pandemic on their inner family circles. This project is named ‘Life in the time of Corona.’

Apart from those two projects, we had three other photojournalists in Iran, reporting on COVID-19 frontline-fighters. That project is called ‘Disinfecting Iran.’
In the middle of the preparation phase, the Pulitzer Center selected our first project as one of the COVID-19 projects to collaborate with and fund. The window for working without a timeline began to close, and I needed to stay on top of all the projects.
As a senior editor, I started to design digital contact sheets from the photo selection we had from every story we received from each photographer in Iran. Based on the time we had and the project's complexity, I had to write short notes or key points on the contact sheets to pinpoint and clarify some subtexts, mark a few as my first selections, and forward them to other editors either in Iran or Canada. They would then make their own selections, mark them with a different color, and send the sheets back to me. Afterwards, I would look to see which images had both marks: mine and the other editor’s. These selections were then added to the general pool for the project's pitch. 
While we were reaching out to publications and media outlets to introduce our project, we went through every single contact sheet again. We chose from the broader selection for each narrative for the purpose of solo presentation. Some projects had the potential to stand alone as their own story, while others were only good for collective work. 
By mid-May 2020, based on the produced material, the agency decided to create multimedia, as well as publish a book as another final product. After carefully reviewing our options, we hired a very talented musician and composer, Rouzbeh Esfandarmaz and his company PAMARO in the Netherlands, to conduct an original song for the multimedia segment. 

The second move was to choose a book designer and start the long journey of book publishing. After all the considerations and based on our long-standing work relations, the agency decided to collaborate with Kaveh Ashourinia, an artist with a creative and complex mind, from Toronto, Canada. His company, Beak Studio, started to plan and design the book while we were completing the projects. This was a challenging process for him as the project wasn't finished, and he and his team had to be flexible with us. We had weekly and then near-daily meetings, to help the book progress properly.  
As the project proceeded to the final section, our team was already all over the globe. Aside from our 14 photographers from 3 countries, we had one translator in California, USA, another two translators in Toronto, Canada, and a copy editor in Barcelona, Spain. This project is the final product of 28 dedicated souls from 12 cities, six countries, and three continents. Regardless of all the hardship and troubles of working in the quarantine amidst the coronavirus pandemic, they dedicated their time and love unconditionally to this project to portray substantial evidence of the unprecedented time and unique global crisis that future generations will look back to for years to come. 
‘Walking On A Blade’ is a small-time capsule of ourselves, so that later we might realize that aside from all the troubles and darkness of our time, hope and The Passion Of Life became the survival kit to assist humankind in overcoming the obstacles and passing the torch of life and living to the next generation.
Life is still beautiful.
Pooyan Tabatabaei

 
____________________
Knolling Humanity
This book not only documents a series of stories, but also emphasizes individuals who are often overlooked and shows how their lives were affected by the pandemic. The book's core concept is not to reflect people's difficulties and sorrows during and after the pandemic. It tries to tell the story of life. 
Kaveh AshouriniaCommunication Designer
____________________

 
Risks
The project is well underway. We dedicated every second of our time planning, editing, proofing, and finally pre-printing the book during the past year. It was challenging to materialize and produce this anthology due to the many delays brought by the Coronavirus pandemic. It was equally demanding on our esteemed collaborators who risked their health and well-being to capture and document the contents of this book. In addition to that, we faced complexities and delays during the printing process.
Nevertheless, we are pleased to announce that the book is essentially ready, and our graphic designer Kaveh Nia, worked hard to have every page finished on time. Moreover, the beautifully designed artistic cover by Kaveh Nia is ready. After a year of intensive labor, our magnificent opus is complete. Thanks to our devoted team of tireless visual artists and professionals.
There are always factors outside of our control, printing problems, shipping delays, and unexpected glitches that may arise. We are confident that none of these potential issues will occur, but we live in a strange, tumultuous, and chaotic time. The Coronavirus pandemic might have an impact on shipping and logistics. If this were to happen, we would continuously keep our backers updated and immediately inform them of any changes or delays.

story:
NOW AVAILABLE AT

www.bigsofti.com

On a film set, when lighting for beauty shots,  cinematographers use the biggest, softest lights we have, to make actors and models look their best. 

Why? 

A big light wraps gently around features on the face, and a soft light evens out skin tone and diffuses any hard shadows - so bumps and creases disappear. 

Created by Australian film professionals and based on these lighting principles, BIGSOFTI is a mobile, high quality, bi-colour LED soft panel that delivers stunning diffused lighting for better photos, videos and video calls on all your devices.

  • Universal clip fits all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands.
  • Shoe mount with 1/4"-20 thread fits all cameras, tripods and light stands.
  • 3M Adhesive Mount for computer monitors and other general surfaces.

     

Late night FaceTime calls with the team overseas? Make sure you always look your best with soft bright mobile lighting. 

 

With a variety of different ways to mount BIGSOFTI,  you can use it all sorts of different places for all sorts of different purposes.

 

Do you shoot handheld on a gimbal? We know they can be tough to balance. BIGSOFTI weighs just 74 grams (2.6 oz) - it's so lightweight, you'll hardly feel it.

 

Aussie DOP Peter Eastgate ACS (Netflix "GO") on a recent FOXTEL TV commercial using BIGSOFTI as an eye light.   

 

Whether you're a cinematographer on an Arri Alexa or an influencer shooting content on your iPhone - BIGSOFTI will help brighten up your frames.

 

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.

Simple 2 button function - for a combination of 9 different light settings:

Button 1 - Power On & Brightness Adjust - LOW - MID - MAX. 

Button 2 - 3 Colour Temperature Setting - DAYLIGHT - CLEAN WHITE - TUNGSTEN.

 

 

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.

Control your lighting angle by up to 45 degrees with the rotating barrel connector built into all accessory mounts.

 

Easily attaches to mobiles in seconds via the bowed flex of the universal clip. Over-moulded rubber edges for great grip that will never scratch your devices.

 

 

The design of the Universal Clip has been created to fit phones both with cases and those without. Flexible and resilient to fit all leading smartphone, tablets and laptops. 

 

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.

 

Quick and easy accessory changes with the custom rotating barrel mount. Each accessory simple slides in and out.

 

NB. This is an animated GIF - give it a second to load.

 

 

Cold-shoe attachment designed to fit traditional cameras. Plus 1/4" 20 thread mount in base allows for use on tripods and light stands.

 

BIGSOFTI has been designed for maximum big-ness but to still to have a footprint smaller than your mobile. Size compared here to the regular iPhone X.

 

 

 

 

The battery on our prototypes was 1000mAh.  In testing we have measured run times at approx:

95 mins at MAX | 140 mins at MID | 240 mins at LOW.

And full charge from flat is around 2 hrs. *Subject to battery age and weather conditions. 

But with our stretch goals achieved, we can upgrade the size of this battery by 1.5X to a 1500mAh battery - which will increase these timings.

USB-C allows for operation while charging, so if a need ever arises the unit can be run from a power source.

As we are injection moulding the diffusion panel, we will have full control of elements that effect the panel opacity (we'll be experimenting with the mix of composite ingredients / diffusing powders that give a glow effect etc). Once we have the tooling complete and can experiment with these options, fine tuning will take place to balance the LED outputs VS the diffusion opacity. As a result run times may vary up or down slightly in final production model.

 

While CRI is a commonly cited score, as a film professional, a more important rating is the Television Lighting Consistency Index or TLCI.  It also runs from 0-100.  Our LED rating of 98+ puts us in the range where any colour variation is so small, a film colourist would not consider correcting it.  

 

We've been hard at work over the past three weeks confirming the final details of our tooling setup - we have paid and signed our contract and have been working on the finer points of the design, with tool cutting due to commence any day. We have opted to work with a higher precision tooling company as it will both allow us to produce more units faster, and also deliver a product with a higher quality finish.  

We're also excited to announce that since we can now order at higher volume, we have been able to negotiate some rates and add a couple of pretty cool features that will now be shipped with every BIGSOFTI.

And after hitting our $650K Stretch Goal - every single BIGSOFTI shipped to every backer will now have a 1500mAh battery!

 

 

Grab a single BIGSOFTI for perfect front lit photos and video direct from your mobile, tablet, laptop or camera. The diffused lighting from our photography grade, bi-colour LEDs will help you create more professional looking content quickly and easily. 

 

 

Get a two pack for a 'two-light setup' - the standard for most simple filming situations.

Key light: The key light is the strongest, providing most of the light in the shot. It’s generally placed in front of your subject, around 45-degrees above and 45-degrees to the right or left.  You can use BIGSOFTI at a higher setting for your key light.

Fill light: This is a lower intensity light, used to fill in shadows on the subject’s face. It should be positioned to the side opposite the key light. You can use BIGSOFTI at a lower setting for your fill light. 

 

 

And if you want to look even better you add a third light . . .

 

Follow the two-light setup above, but also position your third light behind your subject facing back towards the camera. This backlight or hair-light throws a lovely rim of light to help separate your subject from your background for added depth to the image - making your content look more professional.

 

My name is Al Morrow, I'm a Sydney-based TV commercial director who’s worked with global brands in both Australia and the US for over a decade.  

I'm the guy who walks into a room and has to fight the urge to adjust the lights. Lighting quality literally affects how we see the world, and yet so many people hardly give it enough thought.

 

I know how important lighting is when filming, well, anything and because I shoot photos and videos on my phone all the time, I wanted to bring the same kind of high-quality light that I use on my film sets to my mobile.

 

Even though I’d been thinking of ways to bring film lighting to my phone, my ‘aha’ moment for BIGSOFTI didn’t come on set or even during a shoot. It came one day in the car. My wife was driving and her sister was in the backseat; taking selfie after selfie. She was holding up a jacket to cut out the direct sunlight and complaining that her photos either had too many hard shadows or were being blasted by the phone flash.

I commented to her, that without her knowing it, she was cutting and shaping light in a similar way that we would on a film set and that if she wanted full control of her image, she’d need to have a small, powerful, soft light with her. Her face lit up (no pun intended) 'that would be great!'. Many months later, she was the first person we started our tests on, comparing our soft light to the hard light of the phone flash.

 

That was when I realised this was not just a product I would use. Everyone (director or not), uses cameras and anyone shooting photos or videos needs good light.

The first thing I did when I got home that evening was to look at what products already existed in this space. There were phone cases that seemed cumbersome. Products that were made with cheap, low-quality LEDs. Lighting attachments that were too big, too heavy, too expensive.

There seemed to be a gap in the market! I was curious to see if we could address these design flaws and make something better - and the BIGSOFTI journey began.

 

BIGSOFTI began with me in my office pulling apart LED products I bought on ebay and hacking bits together but it really shifted gear when I brought on the team at Vert Design. 

 

I was impressed by both their enthusiasm and their experience (they had designed products for clients such as SONY, INTEL, BMW and DEUS among others) and, from the outset, our partnership was a perfect combination of my knowledge of lighting and photography and their passion for user-focused design.

We set off on two things: 1. Start on initial designs. 2. Find the right manufacturing partner.

 

Throughout the process, Head Designer Andrew Simpson spoke about product design being a 'swinging pendulum' between tech functionality and human interaction. Swing too far in one direction you lose the core practicality of the product, too far in the other direction and you lose the great user experience. We needed to make a product that was the perfect combination of both.

Initially, we created a light panel that would attach to the underside of a flip-out phone case. We found that while the function of the light module worked well, the user interaction with the design was lacking. We showed it to family, friends and colleagues who loved the effect of the lighting, but not the experience so we went back to the drawing board.

 

We explored fixed universal clips, magnetic blocks, locking rubber lugs, even a metal arm and shoe mount. We were split on the clip VS rubber lug and so decided to run some market research through the digital platform OnePulse, asking a focus group of 500 men and women 18-35, across the UK and US which design they preferred. A resounding eighty-five per cent said the clip-on design.

 

Our direction became very clear. Several iterations later, we now have a rotating, removable mechanism (patent pending), which houses a universal clip for all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands. Plus the additional features of a cold shoe camera mount with ¼” 20 thread mount and the 3M Adhesive Mount for general surfaces. It’s this simple versatility that helps put BIGSOFTI into its own category - being effortlessly transferrable across all your devices. 

 

We had our design, now we needed to get it made. After a false start with our initial manufacturer (bad communication, high costs, lack of knowledge and lack of passion about the product) we were put in touch with a man named Hunter Ho; an LED lighting product specialist.

During our first meeting with Hunter, we discussed the technical requirements of LED numbers, size, spacing and distance, colour temp,  CRI and TLCI ratings, the diffusing materials, batteries and charge times, circuits and regulatory approval checks. Hunter had an answer to all our questions and within a few days had sent us itemised quotes with unit numbers, costs, recommendations and timelines.

 

With Hunter’s input we were able to improve the lighting board and PCB layout, update the charge port to USB-C and increase the battery size and run time.  But most importantly, we were able to update the quality of our LEDs.

We are now working with specialised, photography grade BI-COLOUR LEDs, so new that they may have never been used in a device this small before. They deliver changeable colour temperature functionality - with options for all scenarios - DAYLIGHT (5500K), TUNGSTEN (3000K) and a CLEAN MIX (4000K). Which means awesome colour reproduction for better images. We are super confident in our design and just as confident in our manufacturer. 

 

Now that we had our product designed, user tested and refined - it was time to get to watch it in action out in the real world. I roped in some folks to have a play and my very generous brother Matt came along and filmed BIGSOFTI ... being used for selfies, on top of a camera gimbal, taking photos of food, for FaceTime video in the back of an Uber and zoom video conferencing at home on the laptop. This is what we made. 

 
 

During these uncertain times in the world, shipping costs have gone up significantly, however, we believe these prices should return to normal as the global situation improves. To therefore minimise costs for our backers, we will not be charging the current higher shipping charges at the time of pledging.

Shipping, Taxes (and VAT / GST) will be calculated and paid for towards the end of the campaign, just before we ship out to our supporters.  This is being managed through BackerKit who will be in contact via email. 

We will be working hard to secure you the best shipping prices. The good news is that BIGSOFTI is small and lightweight, so multipack purchases will be charged at a slightly discounted rate, so please consider ordering for someone else too, to help us cut down on shipping costs and air miles.

 

We were always planning to launch BIGSOFTI in the first few months of this year, and obviously things have been a little held up by this very strange and difficult time out there.

We’ve stayed across developments of COVID-19 from the very beginning, as news of the pandemic first began to spread in China. We have adjusted our delivery timelines to take into consideration any delays that might be encountered as we move into tooling and production.

COVID-19 is certainly going to impact the way we work and communicate for the next little while. There is generally a movement towards remote working and this is only going to increase, and with that, comes adjusting to the new norm of endless video calls both for personal and business reasons. 

 

We know there is a lot about social distancing that has been difficult.  Never-ending video calls is just one minor impact of the current situation.  But if BIGSOFTI can help solve this one little problem then great.

 Even though I’d been thinking of ways to bring film lighting to my phone, my ‘aha’ moment for BIGSOFTI didn’t come on set or even during a shoot. It came one day in the car. My wife was driving and her sister was in the backseat; taking selfie after selfie. She was holding up a jacket to cut out the direct sunlight and complaining that her photos either had too many hard shadows or were being blasted by the phone flash.I commented to her, that without her knowing it, she was cutting and shaping light in a similar way that we would on a film set and that if she wanted full control of her image, she’d need to have a small, powerful, soft light with her. Her face lit up (no pun intended) 'that would be great!'. Many months later, she was the first person we started our tests on, comparing our soft light to the hard light of the phone flash. 
Note the harsh light and hard focussed shadow from the single point LED on the phone (top left) VS much softer spread from BIGSOFTI (top right).
 That was when I realised this was not just a product I would use. Everyone (director or not), uses cameras and anyone shooting photos or videos needs good light.The first thing I did when I got home that evening was to look at what products already existed in this space. There were phone cases that seemed cumbersome. Products that were made with cheap, low-quality LEDs. Lighting attachments that were too big, too heavy, too expensive.There seemed to be a gap in the market! I was curious to see if we could address these design flaws and make something better - and the BIGSOFTI journey began. 
 BIGSOFTI began with me in my office pulling apart LED products I bought on ebay and hacking bits together but it really shifted gear when I brought on the team at Vert Design.  
 I was impressed by both their enthusiasm and their experience (they had designed products for clients such as SONY, INTEL, BMW and DEUS among others) and, from the outset, our partnership was a perfect combination of my knowledge of lighting and photography and their passion for user-focused design.We set off on two things: 1. Start on initial designs. 2. Find the right manufacturing partner. 
 Throughout the process, Head Designer Andrew Simpson spoke about product design being a 'swinging pendulum' between tech functionality and human interaction. Swing too far in one direction you lose the core practicality of the product, too far in the other direction and you lose the great user experience. We needed to make a product that was the perfect combination of both.Initially, we created a light panel that would attach to the underside of a flip-out phone case. We found that while the function of the light module worked well, the user interaction with the design was lacking. We showed it to family, friends and colleagues who loved the effect of the lighting, but not the experience so we went back to the drawing board. 
 We explored fixed universal clips, magnetic blocks, locking rubber lugs, even a metal arm and shoe mount. We were split on the clip VS rubber lug and so decided to run some market research through the digital platform OnePulse, asking a focus group of 500 men and women 18-35, across the UK and US which design they preferred. A resounding eighty-five per cent said the clip-on design. 
 Our direction became very clear. Several iterations later, we now have a rotating, removable mechanism (patent pending), which houses a universal clip for all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands. Plus the additional features of a cold shoe camera mount with ¼” 20 thread mount and the 3M Adhesive Mount for general surfaces. It’s this simple versatility that helps put BIGSOFTI into its own category - being effortlessly transferrable across all your devices.  
 We had our design, now we needed to get it made. After a false start with our initial manufacturer (bad communication, high costs, lack of knowledge and lack of passion about the product) we were put in touch with a man named Hunter Ho; an LED lighting product specialist.During our first meeting with Hunter, we discussed the technical requirements of LED numbers, size, spacing and distance, colour temp,  CRI and TLCI ratings, the diffusing materials, batteries and charge times, circuits and regulatory approval checks. Hunter had an answer to all our questions and within a few days had sent us itemised quotes with unit numbers, costs, recommendations and timelines. 
 With Hunter’s input we were able to improve the lighting board and PCB layout, update the charge port to USB-C and increase the battery size and run time.  But most importantly, we were able to update the quality of our LEDs.We are now working with specialised, photography grade BI-COLOUR LEDs, so new that they may have never been used in a device this small before. They deliver changeable colour temperature functionality - with options for all scenarios - DAYLIGHT (5500K), TUNGSTEN (3000K) and a CLEAN MIX (4000K). Which means awesome colour reproduction for better images. We are super confident in our design and just as confident in our manufacturer.  
 Now that we had our product designed, user tested and refined - it was time to get to watch it in action out in the real world. I roped in some folks to have a play and my very generous brother Matt came along and filmed BIGSOFTI ... being used for selfies, on top of a camera gimbal, taking photos of food, for FaceTime video in the back of an Uber and zoom video conferencing at home on the laptop. This is what we made.    

 
 During these uncertain times in the world, shipping costs have gone up significantly, however, we believe these prices should return to normal as the global situation improves. To therefore minimise costs for our backers, we will not be charging the current higher shipping charges at the time of pledging.Shipping, Taxes (and VAT / GST) will be calculated and paid for towards the end of the campaign, just before we ship out to our supporters.  This is being managed through BackerKit who will be in contact via email. We will be working hard to secure you the best shipping prices. The good news is that BIGSOFTI is small and lightweight, so multipack purchases will be charged at a slightly discounted rate, so please consider ordering for someone else too, to help us cut down on shipping costs and air miles. 
 We were always planning to launch BIGSOFTI in the first few months of this year, and obviously things have been a little held up by this very strange and difficult time out there.We’ve stayed across developments of COVID-19 from the very beginning, as news of the pandemic first began to spread in China. We have adjusted our delivery timelines to take into consideration any delays that might be encountered as we move into tooling and production.COVID-19 is certainly going to impact the way we work and communicate for the next little while. There is generally a movement towards remote working and this is only going to increase, and with that, comes adjusting to the new norm of endless video calls both for personal and business reasons.  
 We know there is a lot about social distancing that has been difficult.  Never-ending video calls is just one minor impact of the current situation.  But if BIGSOFTI can help solve this one little problem then great. 
 
An enormous thank you to everyone who turned out over July to back us on Kickstarter - the response so far has been incredible.  But we also couldn't have got where we are today, without lots of help from family and friends. This whole thing has been done as lean as possible. From learning how to build a website, to hassling my poor friends to be in the videos. Harassing my brother Matt to help me film things. To asking my wife Jan for feedback during scripting. And a couple of favours finishing the content with Chris at White Chocolate in Darlington, and Tone at Rumble Studios in Chippendale. So to all those people - a huge thanks. Literally could not have done it without you all. 
Chief Technology Cat analysing LED spectrum lab reports. LOL - No he's not. He's a moron.
 
Return policy.  Indiegogo is a platform that allows creators to showcase their product ideas at a discounted price.  This price is a pre-order for our product.  The funds raised throughout our campaign will be used to manufacture BIGSOFTI.  In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use we will not offer refunds or returns for items that are not defected.  If you receive a defected unit please email hello@bigsofti.com
Global Shipping.  We are excited to be offering international shipping.  Please note we are not responsible for additional duty and taxes that may apply to your local importation laws.

story:
What's Somewhere Magazine

Somewhere Magazine was started almost 3 years ago, we wanted to create a platform to share our passion for photography, art, youth-culture and to inspire and motivate people. We wrote hundreds of articles, made dozens of interviews and posted almost 4000 photos on Instagram, making us become one of the most influential photography-related accounts on Instagram. Somewhere magazine has built a large online audience of photography enthusiasts. We have now decided to launch our paper magazine to bring you photography that you love with a format and quality that this art deserves.

About the magazine

The first volume will be called "Remember Summer".

Our favorite photographers will be invited to express their vision of the theme through the form they want: fashion editorial, photo serie, short-stories etc

We haven't shortlisted any contributors yet, but we're aiming to mostly work with photographers shooting film because this is our favorite format.

More Details

- Around 180 pages of 100% original content

- Offset impression on Scandia 2000 White 300 + 115 gsm and GalerieArt Silk 130 gsm

- A release planned around October 2017

- A digital version

- A shipping world-wide

To have a better idea of what the magazine is gonna look in terms of photography; we suggest you to have a look on our Instagram which will give you an overview of what we like.(https://www.instagram.com/somewheremagazine/)

Why are we doing this ?

The growing success of our Instagram page has proven that there is a real interest/enthusiasm into our platform and the kind of images we like and we share.

Raising funds via a crowdfunding and offering people to pre-order our magazine is a way for us to make it happen faster and to reduces the risks.

Wanna help us ? 

If you like our project but can't contribute, you can help us by simply sharing this page with your contacts and friends.

Link and Credits

- www.somewhere-magazine.com

- http://instagram.com/somewheremagazine

- https://www.facebook.com/somewheremagazine

(photos selected are screenshots from our Instagram account)

(footages from the trailer belong to Salomon Ligthelm, Cyrille de Vignemont, Stuart McIntyre, Harley Weir, Chris Hewitt, Ryan McGinley, Terrence Malick and Yoann Lemoine)

story:
Every year we add even more amazing Goddesses to our ranks and it gets harder and harder to figure out how to include as many as possible in the calendar campaign.  Last year our Goddesses sported lingerie and mixed it with cheesecake pinup and this year we wanted to bring you the best of the best in images and also include both Goddesses you already love and brand new ones for you to meet. You know that that means, a new year, A NEW THEME!

These year's theme is a true classic: SWIMSUITS.  Each of our participating Goddesses is in the works creating an image that best utilizes characters you love in swimsuits matching that characters look and personality as well as recreating accurate looks from series you enjoy that continue to represent the character, only sexier! As Yoda would say "An Excellent Calendar, this will be!"

This year's calendar will feature images from  Alora Jaymes, Prisma Bunny, Bear, Brittnie Jade, Jessica Nova, Maygin, Faylin, Vonka, Wicked Lady, Nurse Harley, Erisaka, Lily Rose, Minnie D'Moocha, Essi, Lady Toxica, and Rockabilly Roxie!

With Additional Prints and Portraits created by: Alice Malice, Kathtea, Holy Cherries, Margarette Ghost, Val Valkyrie, and Xeno Frell.

Below you'll find an early submission  ready for viewing from the always awesome Lady Toxica.  This is a preview and the final image may vary.  

The 2019 Calendar will be a standard 12 month calendar with a centerfold and an additional unique image on both the front and back calendar.  Despite this, we have 22 Goddesses participating in the Calendar Campaign. That means you have all those options to choose from as well as additional images created by even more goddesses. Each of these lovely ladies have worked their buns off in the early winter months to create these fun swimsuit clad images.  Each of these images will  be offered as prints for purchase (either through one of our campaign perks or afterwards).  

 

Our Goal includes the cost of paying models, photographers, photo editors and getting the calendars printed.  Why so much you might ask? This year’s project has 22 Goddesses producing 46 Images. That's 22 different Goddesses that all need to be paid and nearly as many photographers.  

 

 

 

Choose From: Alice Malice, Alora Jaymes, Brittnie Jade, Erisaka, Faylin Lynx, Jessica Nova, Lady Toxica, Maygin, Minnie d'Moocha, Nerdee, Nora, Nurse Harley, Prisma Bunny, Rockabilly Roxie, Xeno Frell

Choose From: Alora Jaymes, Erisaka, Essi, Jessica Nova, Minnie D’ Moocha, Nurse Harley, Prisma Bunny, Rockabilly Roxie, Wicked Lady, and Xeno Frell
