Of course, if our supporters are generous we can add and do even more amazing things.  Every penny we receive will go right back into making GeekGoddess even better and giving our fans even more geeky goodness.  

$6,200: Digital Wallpapers of Calendar Images: will be included for backers of $30 or more

$6,400: Previously Unreleased BTS Photopack: will be included for backers of $30 or more

$6,600: Enamel Pin: pin will be included for all backers of $50 or more

$7,000: Free Surprise Print.  Receive an as yet unreleased surprise print as a bonus for backing.  Anyone who donated at least $20 will receive a free 4x6.  Those who donated at $35 and above receive a free 8x10.  

$7,500:  GeekGoddess Dakimakura Pillows:  We’ll produce GeekGoddess Dakimakura Pillows featuring a few select Goddesses. ALL backers will get access to purchase the pillow cases at a special Backer ONLY rate.   All backers over $500 will receive a free case of their choosing from the available options.   

$8,000: 3 Girl Set: Lily Rose x Alora Jaymes x Jessica Nova  All Backers will receive a desktop/phone wallpaper image from this set once it’s complete! 

$8,500: Goddess Polaroid: Backers of $50 or more will get an autographed Polaroid mailed to them with their physical perks later this year! 

$9,000: GeekGoddess Dakimakura Pillows Price Drop! All backers over $150 will receive a free case of their choosing from the available options.

$9,500: Geek Goddess Metallic Prints! We will do a limited run of metallic prints and backers at at least the $50 level will get one of their very own!

$10,000: Clothing Perks: New T-Shirts, Undies and possibly more produced, backers will get first looks at the Goddesses and Gods modeling these new clothing items and Backers of $100 or more will get a free T-Shirt!  

$10,500: Crop Top Goddesses: Backers of $100 or more will be sent a Polaroid of one of our goddesses modeling our new GeekGoddess Crop Top and Panties 

$11,000: GeekGoddess Posters:  We’ll produce a new GeekGoddess Poster that’s at least 13x19 in size.   All Backers at $35 and up will receive one for free.  

$12,000: GeekGoddess Mousepads:  We’ll produce custom GeekGoddess Mousepads.  All Backers of $200 and up will receive one for free. All other backers will get access to purchase at a special backer only rate.  

$13,000: Go Web Go: Unlock for More Details  

$15,500: Full GeekGoddess Themed Dice Set produced.  Backers of $500 or more will received a set. 

$18,000: Backers of $100 or more will receive the full GeekGoddess dice set

$20,000: Gifts from the Goddess: Unlock for More Details

$25,000: Mount Olympus: Unlock for more details


Are you looking for a custom perk?  Maybe you want to add a dice onto a Calendar.  When you select a perk you'll notice that you have the ability to add on additional funds to your donation.   While this most often gets used to add on shipping for our international backers there is no reason it can't be used to add on a little something extra.    If you are looking to add any of the following to your perk please use the price points below. 

$5: GeekGoddess  D20 or Button
$10: GeekGoddess Lanyard
$10: 2018 Calendar
$12: Individual Print/Portrait
$12.50: Individual Regular Premium Assets Print
$20: Individual Large Premium Assets Print
$80: Upgrade to the Large Premium Assets Set (Only applicable for Backers at the "Gotta Have it All" Level)
$90: Upgrade to a full pack of Thank You Card (Only applicable for Backers at the "Prints or Portraits", "Full Set of Portraits/Prints" and "Gotta Have it All" Level)

story:
About the Project

Earlier this summer, I had bilateral strabismus surgery. Ever since birth, I’ve had a slightly farsighted left eye and a significantly nearsighted right eye, and in short, my brain never fused these competing images into one 3D image. So instead, my brain just takes the input from the dominant eye and suppresses the other. When I try and force my eyes to work together, the result is a chaotic, headache-inducing effect of double vision without clear focus. 

A couple days after the aforementioned surgery, I was robbed in broad daylight on a bus while bystanders laughed. I had an epiphany, however, in the moments following the robbery. I realized that I need to be true to my vision as a photographer, both figuratively and literally, and use it to share my own story. Enter Seeing Double. 

In my debut experimental photography book Seeing Double, I will step out of the photo pit to convey the nature of what and how I see using multiple exposure photography in 35mm, while holding an unflinching mirror to the world, and that’s just the first section. Seeing Double will use the sandbox of multiple exposure film photography to explore additional themes and even peek beyond the cosmic membrane, all starring a cast of the creatives who’ve inspired me and my work. And to all my Instagram followers, yes, there will be a section of live concert photos! 

What We Need & What You Get

Film photography isn’t cheap, and neither is self-publishing a limited run of photography books. Even a run of 25 copies would cost nearly a grand after shipping and tax, and that’s not including the cost of film, development and scanning. With your support, I can make this happen. 

I don’t want to take something for nothing, so I am offering prints and other goodies at various price levels, as well as special rates on my services as a photographer. Rewards include signed and numbered copies of Seeing Double, portrait sessions, prints, limited edition sets of exclusive images, postcards and more. 

Seeing Double will be an  11x8.5 inch photography book with an estimated 100-120 pages consisting of experimental portraits, concert photos and more. In the event of overfunding, it will feature additional pages and possibly even more photo series. If the campaign reaches over $5,000, I will also have a gallery show for my work. 

All backers that pledge $5 or more will be formally thanked in Seeing Double’s acknowledgement section.  

The Impact

Ever since I got into music journalism, my longterm goal was to one day publish a book, except now I’ve switched from the written word to photography. Between the recent robbery and an extended cancer scare throughout most of 2018, I’ve been confronted with my own mortality and the prospect of going unfulfilled. 

Publishing Seeing Double is how I take ownership of my condition to make something special and  instill a sense of tangibility to my work. 

With Seeing Double, I want to do more than just get my truth out there. Ideally, it would bring more attention to a condition that’s ignored in public discourse and especially the media. But really, as long as it gives my contributors something that makes them think and feel something new, I’ll be satisfied. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on all your social media channels, and repeat. Text or email your associates. For anyone in media, interviews would also help. 

For sponsorship and media inquiries, contact fsmojica@gmail.com

About Me

Los Angeles-based photographer, writer, UX designer, music lover and cat parent. Bylines include Consequence of Sound, Vice, The New York Times, The MAT Magazine, Lyynks Music, Daily Voice, Beats Per Minute, Time Out Los Angeles, BrooklynVegan, Pass The Aux, Be in a Band or Die and more. 

Portfolio: frankmojica.myportfolio.com

Instagram: instagram.com/realfrankmojica

Twitter: twitter.com/realfrankmojica

Disclaimer: All images in the campaign page are featured as examples of existing work and are not guaranteed to appear in the book.
story_txt:
About the Project
Earlier this summer, I had bilateral strabismus surgery. Ever since birth, I’ve had a slightly farsighted left eye and a significantly nearsighted right eye, and in short, my brain never fused these competing images into one 3D image. So instead, my brain just takes the input from the dominant eye and suppresses the other. When I try and force my eyes to work together, the result is a chaotic, headache-inducing effect of double vision without clear focus. 
A couple days after the aforementioned surgery, I was robbed in broad daylight on a bus while bystanders laughed. I had an epiphany, however, in the moments following the robbery. I realized that I need to be true to my vision as a photographer, both figuratively and literally, and use it to share my own story. Enter Seeing Double. 
In my debut experimental photography book Seeing Double, I will step out of the photo pit to convey the nature of what and how I see using multiple exposure photography in 35mm, while holding an unflinching mirror to the world, and that’s just the first section. Seeing Double will use the sandbox of multiple exposure film photography to explore additional themes and even peek beyond the cosmic membrane, all starring a cast of the creatives who’ve inspired me and my work. And to all my Instagram followers, yes, there will be a section of live concert photos! 

What We Need & What You Get
Film photography isn’t cheap, and neither is self-publishing a limited run of photography books. Even a run of 25 copies would cost nearly a grand after shipping and tax, and that’s not including the cost of film, development and scanning. With your support, I can make this happen.

Publishing Seeing Double is how I take ownership of my condition to make something special and  instill a sense of tangibility to my work.

But really, as long as it gives my contributors something that makes them think and feel something new, I’ll be satisfied.

Share this campaign on all your social media channels, and repeat. Text or email your associates. For anyone in media, interviews would also help. 
For sponsorship and media inquiries, contact fsmojica@gmail.com

Los Angeles-based photographer, writer, UX designer, music lover and cat parent. Bylines include Consequence of Sound, Vice, The New York Times, The MAT Magazine, Lyynks Music, Daily Voice, Beats Per Minute, Time Out Los Angeles, BrooklynVegan, Pass The Aux, Be in a Band or Die and more.

story:
Several important things we'd like you to read:


1) Full background on Silberra:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/silberra-b-w...

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/silberra-b-w...

2) Combined shipping: the way out
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/silberra-b-w...

3) Silberra PAN series film is ready, the only thing we need is to make it mass market product by packing huge amount of it into beautiful boxes;

4) Silberra ORTA series film is ready by 90% today; three things we need to run it as mass market product are:
- purchasing good substrate to coat the emulsion;
- fixing a couple of minor faults in coating machine;
plus the same packing line to provide wholesale quantities of that film.

 

In accordance with Update #10 we've extended the duration of our campaign up to October, 30th. Thank you for your support!

 

Silberra Films: About Us

Since 2009 we've been manufacturing supplies for analog photography. We started it in our own lab, relying on the recipes we managed to acquire from different sources: encyclopedias, chemistry books, photographic guidebooks and many others. We've been studying chemistry, reinventing the solutions, trying to bring back the variety of the developers and auxiliary solutions from the times when analog photography flourished. 


We've passed a long way from small home-based lab to small-scale chemistry manufacture. This year we've decided that our products deserve their own brand name, and we gave birth to "Silberra" trade mark. This trade mark shall be the brand name for our films also and you can find a lot about the whole product range at our web-site: https://www.silberra.com .

Feel free to surf our Instagram  account also: https://www.instagram.com/silberrafilm/ . You'll find a lot of film shots made on Silberra film by photographers from all over the world.

 

Now we have 3 versions of Silberra PAN films (ISO160, ISO100 and ISO50) plus limited edition of Silberra PAN200 and Silberra Ultima200 (ISO200), which are black&white negative panchromatic films based on modified Agfa emulsions. We're ready to offer those in 35mm format, and we're working hard to start the production of 120 type. This film is 100% ready except packaging.

Here we have sample images from the coressponding film:

We have Silberra ORTA series, which is at beta-test phase now: black&white negative orthochromatic film based on totally new emulsions, and it will be available in 35mm format, 120 type and sheet films starting from 4"x5" and up to 8"x10". This film is 85% ready: we need to modify the coating machine to make it up to 100%.


R&D phase never ends: we're on the way to the next film already, and that shall be Silberra IC - new isochromatic black and white film, and then Silberra PANII will follow, new panchromatic emulsion.

We've been able to implement ideas into real products due to the only thing: we just kept doing the work each day and night. We did involve the best chemists and emulsion synthesis specialists we could reach. We've been telling them about the Renaissance of the film photography and we've been persuading them to postpone some technical films engineering to modify some of our films to make those really good for professional and common photography.

And here we represent the core team of Silberra (though lots of partners and assistants just stay behind the frame). 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to start mass market manufacturing of Silberra film to make it available worldwide. 

1) We need to make small semi-automated packaging line (or to subcontract one) to produce enough films to meet your demand (and we shall do it fast, for you not to spend years in waiting). 
2) We need to place order for corresponding amount of the beautiful cardboard boxes for Silberra film and it means that we need to buy it in wholesale quantity.
3) To start mass market manufacturing of ORTA film we need to buy substrate with all the properties that will suit us: anti halation layer, anti curling layer, and substrate shall be thin enough and yet reliable.
4) To run 120 Type manufacturing for all the films we need either to contract third-party manufacturing line or to create small semi-automated manufacturing line of our own;
5) We need R&D funds to go on with PANII (panchrome) emulsion and IC (isochrome) emulsion engineering. Every job must be paid, and scientific one shall be paid well.

Shall we succeed in acquiring the whole sum we're up to, we'll have really good ground for a start. Please keep in mind that backing us here you're not buying the rewards (film shall be much lower in price when mass manufacturing starts); you're backing us on running new film, new photo papers and new chemicals. And we won't disappoint you, folks.

As for rewards - we have a lot of them for you to choose. You can choose as much perks as you like; should you like to get several perks, all you need to do is to order the perks one at a time, that's it.
 

The Impact

One more place where new films are manufactured, that's what we'd like to implement with the help of that campaign. There are not too much photo films these days. Each new film which comes to the market is like new paint for painters: imagine that you've been limited to use just 5 or 6 colors through the whole life, and suddenly you have an option to use one more! Well, we've brought you a kind of color palette at once. 
 

Risks & Challenges

When you produce something new there are always risks and challenges. But we're sure that we'll overcome every challenge we have on our way. We've done too much to stop when facing any difficulty: there is no such option for us.

We have to engineer a lot in technics and emulsions too. But the only risk here is that we'll have to spend a bit more time solving the problem, than we're expecting. But we've got used to work fast, so the main thing for us is your faith and support: when one knows his efforts are not in vain, there are no obstacles in his way.
 

What for do we need money exactly? 

Here is the budgeting picture explaining the costs. As you see, we're placing a lot of the funds into perks manufacturing, as it will allow us to pre-order a lot of the components we need for full-scale manufacturing. While the first perks delivered at December 2017 are going to be hand rolled, the rest of the rewards shall be manufactured at the semi-automated or automated manufacturing line. Depending on the amount of the funds we will be able to acquire, we're going to construct it anew or subcontract one at the existing film manufacturing facilities. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'll surely appreciate spreading the word about us. Possibly there are people ready to help us but they're just unaware of our existence: world is quite huge, you know... Tell them about Silberra via your social network profile and you'll help us a lot!

story:
La raccolta che stiamo promuovendo è per la nostra amica Arianna, a cui, la mattina di domenica 27 settembre, all’interno del Caos di Terni, è stato rubato il personal computer, un notebook Asus nero N56, numero di serie: E7N0BC095046295, di appena un anno di vita e comprato in offerta a 900 euro. Arianna si trovava lì per svolgere un servizio fotografico commissionato da una compagnia invitata al decennale del Festival internazionale della creazione contemporanea.

Un portatile quasi comune, non certo l’affare del secolo per i rapidi rapinatori che l’hanno adocchiato e probabilmente già rivenduto, ma al contempo l’imprescindibile archivio e strumento quotidiano di lavoro per la nostra amica.

Dal momento che le ricerche del maltolto sono state vane, e il Festival di Terni non possiede un’assicurazione contro i furti, chiediamo un sostegno ad amici, colleghi e compagni di strada, a chi era presente e a chi sa cosa comporti un danno simile per chi vive di lavori temporanei.

Ognuno può donare un fiorino, sette scellini, una macchina del tempo o un potente antidoto all’incresciosa perdita informatica.

Per i più arditi, ovvero per quelli che osino invece realizzare la performance post-festival “scova il ricettatore ed estrai il preziosissimo hard disk del cuore”, riuscendo a recuperare l’archivio multimediale da lei in gran parte perduto a causa dell’ingordigia dei lestofanti, la ricompensa sarà inestimabile.

story:
“I'm so confident that you will enjoy my new book that I'm willing to print a copy just for you!”

This campaign is now closed. Nearly 100 copies have been ordered so far and they will be sent out in the next couple weeks. There are additional copies of the 1st edition printing that will soon be available for purchase at the website.  www.howtoshakeastick.com

Synopsis:
A collection of thought provoking images and captions presented with the intention of eliciting humor and hope through the author's struggle to make sense of the world. Once you start reading, it is likely that your initial judgement will soon be forgotten. As engaging as it is confusing, this book offers a self-guided tour of through your own imagination. In a world of 30-second elevator speeches Stick encourages you to take the stairs.

“...not only an instruction manual for defiant thinking, but also a poignant, enlightened view through the mind's eye.”
–James McLeod

“ ’★★★★’ is probably how the New York Times would describe it.”
–James McLeod

Four Years in the Making...
“How to Shake a Stick...” has been a labor of love for 4 years now. I first conceived the idea in 2010 and I have been adding photos and captions to the collection ever since. During the past 5 years I have worked on various magazine's and 'zines practicing the art of publishing, all the while making single copies and revisions to this book. I am pleased to announce that "How to Shake a Stick..." is now ready for it's “signature” first edition printing in both Hardcover and Paperback. This is your chance to order your very own 1st Edition copy.
  • Your contribution of any amount will help make the first print run of “How to Shake a Stick...” a success.
  • A crowd funding campaign, like this one, is the best way to assess how many copies I will be printing for the first run.
  • The finished book will be approx. 108 pages and have more than 50 images.
Perks!
These are some of the possible rewards for your contribution:

$25 - Paperback copy (signed) + Set of 5 Postcards

$50 - Hardcover Copy (signed) + Set of 5 Postcards


$100 - One Hardcover + One Paperback + Set of 5 Postcards + One hand chosen 'Stick' with the limited 'How to Shake a Manual' (8 pages, B&W)

$500 - Every thing from above + I will hand deliver your book to anywhere within a 1000 mile radius of Sacramento, CA and I will teach you how to juggle!

Photo: James McLeod / Juggler: Corey Connors

$10 - Just the Set of 5 Postcards (featuring pictures from the book)

Shipping costs are included in the Perk Amount, actual books are larger than they appear on this screen.

The Real Cost of Printing a Book
There are a lot of peripheral production costs involved with publishing a book. The printing and bindery costs are just a fraction of the total bill. Other costs include: design, editing, test printing, proof reading, ISBN, snacks, distribution, shipping, website management and promotional services. The unique shape of the book and the installation of the pocket page (stuffed with a real dollar bill) require some extra time and effort because I add these unique features to each book by hand.
  • I have done an extensive research regarding printing cost and quality to ensure the best presentation of this project. It's been 4 years in the making and I'm aiming for premium quality printing which this book deserves. Buy nice or buy twice.
  • If this fund raiser reaches the target goal of $5565, I will be able to print 100 copies in hardcover and at least 200 copies in paperback.
The Impact
This project is about more than just the printing of the first edition. The bigger goal is to create a sustainable printing and distribution model for this book. I see this project as a stepping stone towards further goals of documentary photography and future book projects.

For the past 5 years I have been working with friends to make the Banks Mag (kayaking magazine) and The Algerian (local skateboarding, music and art 'zine).The latest 'zine: The Algerian, made in Boise, ID has seen 13 issues to date. It's a fun process of collecting photos, creating stories, conducting interviews and highlighting local talent. The best part is printing and distributing the finished tangible product to our readers. The learning process and knowledge I have gained from working on these publications has proved crucial towards the making of this book.

Sample Pages

Risks & Challenges
I have chosen flexible funding for this campaign because even if I do not meet the target goal I will still be able to fulfill the perk rewards. I have set the donation amounts to cover the cost of the rewards regardless of the final quantity I will be ordering. Though, I am hoping people will order more books than I can shake a stick at...

Timeline
This campaign will run for 30 days and end on Nov. 16th. During this time I will be making final revisions on the book as well as arranging plans for printing and bindery. Proper quality printing takes time. Books could ship as early as January and will arrive to your mailbox no later than February 2015. I will be keeping everyone updated on the progress of manufacturing and shipping.

Other Ways You Can Help
I'm so thankful for everyone's interest in this project, each of you are helping to make this happen! Thank you.
  • Please share a link to this project with friends.
  • Remember how much you love your favorite books. That's how much they love you too.

The best part is printing and distributing the finished tangible product to our readers. The learning process and knowledge I have gained from working on these publications has proved crucial towards the making of this book.Sample Pages
Risks & ChallengesI have chosen flexible funding for this campaign because even if I do not meet the target goal I will still be able to fulfill the perk rewards. I have set the donation amounts to cover the cost of the rewards regardless of the final quantity I will be ordering. Though, I am hoping people will order more books than I can shake a stick at... TimelineThis campaign will run for 30 days and end on Nov. 16th. During this time I will be making final revisions on the book as well as arranging plans for printing and bindery. Proper quality printing takes time. Books could ship as early as January and will arrive to your mailbox no later than February 2015. I will be keeping everyone updated on the progress of manufacturing and shipping.Other Ways You Can HelpI'm so thankful for everyone's interest in this project, each of you are helping to make this happen! Thank you.
